results.description:
Visit TechinMotionEvents.com

 

Welcome!

Tech in Motion is broad by design, the goal of this group is to be interactive and allow technology enthusiasts to learn from other professionals, have questions answered in real-time, discover new tech, and hear stories that inspire. This group is a place for technology professionals who wouldn’t normally cross paths to meet, collaborate, and learn about what their peers are doing across the city. To learn more about Tech in Motion, click here!


Want to learn more about Tech in Motion?

  • Visit TechinMotionEvents.com
  • "Like" us on Facebook!
  • Join the conversation on Twitter! Share and follow along with @Tech_in_Motion
  • Check out our Tech Job Board
  • Read insightful content from our speakers across the country on our blog
  • Want to sign up for our email list? Click Here!

 

Interested in sponsoring a Tech in Motion event?

Click Here!


*We currently have two staffing firms dedicated to offering career counseling services to our members, so we ask that recruiters not join this group. Any outside recruiter will be removed, thank you for understanding!
results.name: Tech in Motion: Boston

results.description:
(English version follows) Quelques Quebecois/ses se rencontrent a Boston pour feter la St-Jean et ca y'est! On a aime se retrouver et passer une soiree a parler Francais, faire des contacts, expliquer qui on est a nos amis de Boston, prendre un verre et une bonne bouffe. Une belle soiree a la Quebecoise quoi !On a eu envie de le refaire et on veut en faire un beau gros groupe de "chums", contacts, amis/es etc, etc...Etes-vous partant ? On parlera peut-etre un peu plus Francais qu'Anglais, mais faisons de ce groupe une belle place invitante pour tous les Amoureux du Quebec, de ses gens, leur joie de vivre et la langue. C'est ce qui nous unis.

So we met to celebrate St-Jean Baptiste in Boston and we loved to get together, to speak French, make contacts, explain how we think, who we are to our American friends, have a good glass of wine, a good meal, a real nice French Canadian evening ! We wanted to do it again ! And get the gang bigger! Make it a nice group of friends, contacts, buddies, etc, etc. We might speak more French then English but let's make this group a nice welcoming place for everybody who loves our good old Quebec, its people, its joie de vivre and the French language. Please, remember that this is a group to get together and speak French. We welcome people who want to learn, but discussions are much more then often in French. That's what unites us !
results.name: Québécois and lovers of Québec in Boston

results.description:
Hey all, this group is for people that are new to the awesome city of Boston (or surrounding areas)! Since this group was formed early last summer we've done a little bit of everything: going out to dinners, grabbing drinks, visiting museums, brewery tours, ice skating, going to comedy shows, bowling, and exploring specific areas of the city.

Our crowd is usually half regulars, half newcomers so don't be shy if you've never done meetup before! Organizers make sure there are always a lot of fun events planned. Members can also create and organize events, or they can suggest ideas to the organizers (note: We don't allow our group to be used simply as a platform for fundraisers. If any of our regular members is involved in a fundraiser, we're happy to support them, but please do not join our group for this purpose alone)

Answers to some FAQs about the group:

-The target age for the group is roughly 22 to 36. No one will check your age of course but if you're way out of this range it'll be a little obvious :) We'd really like to keep the group at least in the 20s and 30s.

-Member Photos: It is required that all members have a satisfactory photo that we can use to identify members at events. This helps us a great deal as well as aids other members in recognizing you. Please make sure your photo is of YOU and not a pet/landscape/cartoon, as it'll be easier for us to spot you at events

-It doesn't cost any money to be a member! Many of the events cost money (food, drinks, admission, etc.) which is why you can pick and choose which ones you attend. Some of our events are spendy, and some are free! Keep in mind that the organizers do have to pay dues to run this group. If you have a good time and can donate a buck or two, please do. It goes a long way to help cover the costs of running the meetup.

-If you've RSVP'd "Yes" to an event but decide not to go, please change your RSVP to "No" as soon as you can. Organizers plan around the number they're expecting and it's respectful not to make them wait for people who aren't coming.

Any other questions? Just message the organizers!
results.name: The New to Boston Meetup Group 20's - early 30's

results.description: In these uncertain times, the Great Recession has reminded us of our vulnerabilities. Unemployment and Anxious Employment. Debt. Foreclosure. Evaporating Savings. Rising Costs. Job Insecurity. In response, Resilience Circles (also called Common Security Clubs) are forming around the country! Together, these circles of people learn about the causes of the economic and ecological challenges and how to face them, while simultaneously building relationships that strengthen our communities and build the potential for mutual aid and shared action We see ourselves as part of a larger effort to create a fair and healthy economy that works for everyone. And we'd love it if you'd join us! Our meeting will be low-key and friendly and we'd love to meet you!
results.name: Somerville Resilience and Resistance Circle

results.description: Whether you’re an avid photography enthusiast or just enjoy taking pictures, PhotoFly Travel Club is the perfect way to vacation, go on an adventure, and meet great people. Our members love travel, adventure, culture, and often photography as well! All of our destinations offer amazing opportunities to capture unforgettable photographs and each trip has at least one activity that is perfect for taking pictures.
results.name: PhotoFly Travel Club Boston!

results.description:
Are you a fan of My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic? Do you live in the Boston metropolitan area? Do you want to meet up with other bronies and bronettes (or pegasisters) to hang out, chat, and just have fun? This is the group for you!

Not a huge fan?  Just like a couple episodes?  No problem!  We're all about fun here.  We do everything from outdoor hangouts to restaurant visits and everything in between.  You don't need to know everything about MLP to make friends here.

Yours truly, Pony Princesses of the Moon and Sun (Andrew and Wendy)
results.name: Bronies-Boston

results.description: Whether you’re an avid photography enthusiast or just enjoy taking pictures, Boston Photography Lovers is the perfect way to meet great people who share a passion for photography or have always wanted to learn more! Our members love travel, adventure, culture, and of course photography! Many of our events & activities are great for taking pictures, sharing pictures, and learning! We even do some big trips around the world and locally in New England.
results.name: Boston Photography Lovers

results.description:
We are a group of runners who love running, and socializing, with other runners in the Arlington, Somerville, Cambridge, and Boston areas.  We have weekly Short/Slower run followed by an Intermediate 5-6 mile run on Tuesday's, and long runs (8-10 miles) on Thursdays.

Tuesday nights we often head out for food and drinks after the run.

Our group has a few simple rules:

1. On all of our runs we will stop occasionally to regroup with our slower members.

2. Please respect everyone's personal space.

3. We don't run with dogs or strollers, if you wish to run with either, this may not be the group for you.

4.  We are a judgement-free group!  

Check out our calendar to see all upcoming meetups!


We have many runners on our roster, all of our members have been to a meetup within the last 6 months, or have joined within the last three.  Occasionally we do go through our member list and purge inactive members to maintain a current roster.  If you were removed from our group, and would like to rejoin, please feel free to do so--we would love to have you!
results.name: Davis Square Runners

topics.name: Lesbian and bisexual women helpers with health
Lesbian and Bisexual women helping others - health
Lesbian and bi social contacts around health

results.description:
LASS: LESBIAN AID AND SERVICE SOCIETY

LASS is a community of lesbian and bi women helping each other through health challenges.

A chance to both give and receive!

Could you offer a ride to a medical appointment?  Are you having surgery?  Could you cook an occasional meal?  Do you have a friend with a chronic illness?


If you need help or are interested in volunteering, we would love for you to be involved in our wonderful community.  Get the help you need from volunteers who enjoy giving.

Come to our delicious potlucks and make new friends while helping plan the future of LASS!

FOR MORE INFORMATION OR TO ASK FOR HELP , CLICK THE "CONTACT US" LINK ON THE LEFT SIDEBAR.

See mission statement under Pages tab.

See resource list and LASS description under files tab.
results.name: LASS

results.description:
Our Origins on Meetup.COM: This group is for parents interested in early childhood informal and formal music education as well as parents interested in learning more about brain-based educational curricula. Smits Music & More (formly known as SESMB Community Music School) currently developing and offering programs from baby-toddler music, preschool ages, and up.  We plan to grow slowly.  So please ask about programs you'd like to see!

 

Our Evolution: In order to foster a sense of community with local and other nearby towns/cities' families, we will be posting more variety in our meetups that will encourage an open exchange of ideas, focused discussions on current issues in education, music, art and children as well as new innovative baby, toddler & preschool music and art programs.  As our program grows, we will offer more courses.
results.name: Smits Music & More

results.description:
How do we awaken here and now as everyday people?

Awakening is not just about Waking Up –- to realize the Mystery of our Infinite Nature. It’s also about Waking DOWN -- into life, our bodies, our issues, and relating to others in Mutuality with honor and authenticity. These are the insights of Saniel Bonder, founder of the Waking Down teaching.

Our gatherings, called sittings, will include silent meditation, mutual gazing meditation, and conscious sharing in a setting that facilitates embodied trust. The Boston gatherings are usually led by Allan Morelock (embodiedheartawakening.com; http://teachers.wakingdown.org/AllanMorelock/) and Gena Netten (http://teachers.wakingdown.org/GenaNetten/).

We offer compassionate listening to each other as we explore embodied awakening in mutually conscious relationship, and we practice acceptance in Being with whatever is happening in the moment, without pressure to redirect things or "fix" ourselves. Transformation happens readily and organically through the wisdom of Being, in each person’s right timing.

Come to a Waking Down Meetup and give yourself the chance to steep in a sacred space dedicated entirely to the deepening recognition of all that we are, as a platform for individual and collective evolution.

You may have an extensive spiritual history, or little, or none. We welcome you to join this collaborative exploration of Embodied Awakening!

FIND OUT MORE...

We encourage you to read a little about Waking Down before attending one of our gatherings so you have some context and can optimize your experience. In particular, we recommend this material:

1) Explore these recommended resources

Waking Down Defined video

as well as these pages of the Waking Down website:

http://www.wakingdown.org/getting-started/ 

http://www.wakingdown.org/about-waking-down/ 

http://www.wakingdown.org/exploring-waking-down/ 

http://www.wakingdown.org/introduction-to-waking-down-sittings/

2) Set up a free exploratory conversation with me and decide whether this work resonates for you.

We can meet by phone or Skype. I can be reached at gena@genanetten.com.

(Please note: This group is not a substitute for psychotherapy.)
results.name: Boston Waking Down

results.description: This group is a place for developers to learn more about the non-relational, open source, document-oriented database MongoDB (http://www.mongodb.org/). We meet once a month to talk about what's new in MongoDB and related technologies.
results.name: Boston MongoDB User Group

results.description: The most popular season at The HUB is Fall Ball! For the third consecutive season teams will compete in Weeknight and now Sunday Leagues. When most players hang up their cleats for the year The HUB gears up for another action packed season! Who's going to take a shot at knocking off The HUB's 2 time reigning Men's A division champs - A-Town from Arlington or B division champs High Life? The HUB will be offering 2 divisions of weeknight softball for both men's teams or co-ed teams: the American League -Advanced teams play on M/W/F and the National League - Intermediate teams play on T/TH/F. Play at fields around greater Boston. Or is Sunday more your style in which case the field is wide open in the HUB's inaugural Fall Sunday season. Most Sunday games will be played at beautiful Teddy Ebersole field on the Charles River. See if you can put your name on the Fall trophy! Registration closes August 21st and the season begins the last week of August! Don't delay space is limited.
results.name: The HUB Softball Fall Softball League

results.description:
This Meetup has been organized for the purpose of finding friendly people that want to play tennis in the Boston, Brookline, JP, Newton, Cambridge, Somerville and Arlington areas.

People can use this site to find other players that they can call on for fun tennis matches.
results.name: The Boston Tennis Group

results.description: We'd like to go beyond such recent commonplace doctrines as 'the end of history' (Fukuyama), 'the clash of civilizations' (Huntington), or 'the world is flat' (T. Friedman), to explore the actual political-economic, political-sociological, political-cultural, social-structural, cultural, technological, and ecological dynamics that are shaping our time. Throughout New England, we have an immense wealth of talent, and an exceptional range of extraordinarily thoughtful observers and interpreters of those fundamental forces that are conditioning our existence in the 21st century. Let's get together and utilize our respective talents to see what sense we can make of the great dynamics of our time!
results.name: New England Social Theory Group

results.description:
Welcome!

The Foxboro Jaycees are a dynamic, enthusiastic volunteer organization for young people dedicated to enhancing quality of life through community development projects and social events for chapter members. We make our community better and have a lot of fun along the way!

Anyone over 18 is welcome to stop by and visit us at our monthly membership meetings, on the second Wednesday of every month at 7:30pm at the South Foxboro Community Center or any of our events to learn more about the Foxboro Jaycees.

Learn more about our organization
results.name: Foxboro Jaycees

results.description:
Hello all. Welcome to the 20-30 Somethings of the Boroughs. This group was originally created for young adults in the boroughs area. This group has since expanded beyond that geographical limit and is for people 20 to 35. It has a lot of great people.

There will be regular meetups organized by group administrators. However, this group is member driven. Feel free to suggest or organize your own meetups. As far as events go, we are open to everything to include dinners, dancing, outdoorsy stuff, events, etc. We want everyone to have a say in what events are held. Feel free to message an organizer if you have any ideas.

We are a welcoming group and are very casual. However, we do request that members update their RSVP status as soon as they can, especially for events with reservations. A clear profile picture is required so we can identify members at meetups. Please check out the Pages tab for additional rules.
results.name: 20-30 Somethings of the Boroughs

results.description:
This group is open to professional women in the Greater Boston area of all ages. This group is a great way to make friendships as well as business connections. Whether you are looking to network wtih other women or simply enjoy a glass of wine with good company we invite you to join our group!

Come out and socialize with us every 3rd Wednesday of the month at a different location in Boston. Hope to see you soon!
results.name: Cocktails + Connections for Women

results.description:
Hi. This group was established in 2009. Anyone interested in the Scala programming language is welcome.

We meet at various locations in the Kendall Square neighborhood of Cambridge. Lately most meetings have been at MIT's Stata Center.

Meetings usually start at 6:30, include one or two talks or sessions, and conclude by 8:00; there is usually pizza and soda provided by a sponsor; and some of us usually go out for drinks and further conversation afterwards.

We'd love to hear from interested speakers and workshop leaders. Any length of talk is welcome, from 5 minutes to a whole meeting. The format is open; usually it's been talks with slides and/or live coding, but other formats like hands-on workshops and sessions are welcome too.

Meetings may be photographed and the photos posted to the group.
results.name: Boston Area Scala Enthusiasts

results.description: The Boston Mobile C# Developers' Group focuses on the use of C# in the exciting area of mobile development. The group's main topics are Xamarin.iOS, Xamarin.Android and Windows Phone. We meet in Cambridge, MA at Microsoft, One Cambridge Center. Membership is free. People interested in learning more about developing for mobile platforms with C# are encouraged to join.
results.name: Boston Mobile C# Developers' Group

results.description:
Welcome Girlfriend!!!

"Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends"

- Virginia Wolf

 

Girlfriends Of The North Shore is, first and foremost, for women who want to expand their circle of friends and have fun!

 

"You are only as strong as the tables you dance on, the drinks you mix and the friends you roll with"

 

We go out to dinner, to the movies, to horseback rides, we have girls night in and we have girls night out, we have a dessert club and we have a book club, we do wine tasting and we go blueberry picking - you name it! Really, if you want to do something fun just put it in our calendar and see if anyone would like to join you!


"The only way to have friends is to be one" 

 - Ralph Waldo Emerson

 

Girlfriends Of The North Shore is also for down-to-earth, sincere, positive and classy women who love to laugh, love fashion and also politics, women who have stories to share and listen to!

 

We women need to support, lift each other and grow together!!!

 


Now let's have some fun!!!
results.name: GIRLFRIENDS OF THE NORTHSHORE

results.description:
Boston Classical Meetup was created to provide a general classical meetup group for veterans and rookies alike. We attend all types of classical performances: symphonies, operas, chamber works, etc. in all kinds of venues - even house parties! (think Schubertiade...)

We will usually be meeting after performances, sometimes before, and occasionally during. Pre- and post-performance activities (lectures, receptions, parties, etc) are usually part of the meetup itself, so be sure to check the details!

The Boston Opera Meetup works in tandem with the Boston Classical Meetup for opera events, but until I find a fluid system to integrate the two, the Boston Classical Meetup is usually the most up-to-date. If there is a meetup on Boston Opera, there will also be one at Boston Classical... but not necessarily vice versa.

Some highlights of upcoming concerts that are not yet meetups can be found in the calendar, but the best place to discover new performances (and perhaps create a meetup for one! :)) is The Boston Musical Intelligencer calendar page. The meetup calendar page is not well integrated at the moment, but there may be more for it in store at some point. Until then, BMInt is definitely the way to go.


It's been nearly 4 years (we began in August 2011) since I started this group. It has been a challenge, but we have had some incredible events, met some fantastic (and sometimes famous) people, and made a lot of friends. Thank you for being a part of it!
results.name: Boston Classical Meetup

results.description:
Looking forward to seeing you at one of our events!

The mindfulboston.com event schedule is listed below. Most events include some form of meditation practice.

What is Mindfulness?  ---“Mindfulness means paying attention in a particular way; on purpose, in the present moment, and nonjudgmentally.”  
--Dr. Jon Kabat-Zinn (Creator of MBSR, the Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction program)

If you choose to click on the "JOIN US" button, you can then set up your own membership where you get email notices about upcoming events.
results.name: MindfulBoston

results.description: Walking barefoot through nature is a fun and rewarding way to exercise your feet. When hiking barefoot the feel of cool dirt, smooth rocks, soft pine needles, and crisp leaves all add to the delight of the hike. You feel connected to the earth. In the absence of dry leaves you are silent. We are a group of barefoot hikers located in Eastern Mass who enjoy getting together for hikes of varying intensity. Whether you are a seasoned barefoot hiker, a beginner, or even if you've never hiked, come join us on the trail. We will provide instruction to those that would like to learn.
results.name: Eastern Mass Barefoot Hikers

results.description: The Boston Windows Game Developers Group is a community of developers in the Boston, MA area. It's purpose is to gather together individuals interested in developing games for the Windows platforms. No experience is necessary, beginners and experts are all welcome. The group meets monthly in the Microsoft New England Research and Development Center at 1 Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA on the fourth (4th) Wednesday of the month at 6:00pm.
results.name: Boston Windows Game Developers

results.description:
QAPA is committed to providing a supportive social, political, and educational environment for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning people of Asian and Pacific Islander heritage in the Boston and New England area.

If you're interested in volunteering for QAPA or have any questions or suggestions regarding the organization, please send an email to qapa@qapa.org.

 

Please note that the posting policies for this group have changed since migrating from Yahoo! Groups to Meetup.com:

  • If you are representing or soliciting on behalf of another organization, your post must represent or specifically include the queer API community, or it will be removed from the message boards. 
  • This policy has been added to improve and maintain the quality of information that is circulated on the message boards and to ensure that the communication and purpose of QAPA and its members are not lost in a deluge of solicitation.
results.name: QAPA: Queer API Alliance of New England

results.description:
The best of everything: jobs, salary, life partners, discounted prices, opportunities, absolutely everything in life... can be yours, if you know how to communicate your wishes in a way that is most agreeable to your audience. Many people feel uncomfortable negotiating, thus shortchanging themselves because they refuse to engage in the process. Some view it as manipulation; or as a contest of wills in which power determines outcome, each party seeks to one-up the other, and the little guy doesn't stand a chance. .... It doesn't have to be that way. Effective negotiation can produce an agreement that meets the needs of both sides while preserving the relationship...The key to success is remembering that everything is negotiable -- and to get a deal you must ask for one.

WHO IS THIS FOR:

- People who understand that negotiation, like any other skill can be learned.
- People who believe that excellence is simply a matter of practice
- People committed to improving their future interactions

 

WHAT HAPPENS AT THE MEETINGS?

 

- Have themed meetings, focused on particular situations/ skills
- How to identify tactics being used on you by others and strong ways you could respond
- We'll discuss negotiation situations we were in and how we fared
- Review some strategies that work
- Research and share on some best-practices in particular situations
- Role-play situations to get experience practicing skills learned
- How to pitch your proposal for a promotion, a raise, expanded responsibilities etc.
- Provide direct feedback on how you come across in certain situations (if you want it)
- Developing confidence in any negotiation situation 
- Body language: how to read your negotiating partner 
- Body language: how YOU can communicate strength and confidence
- We could help analyze one of your past negotiations (if you ask)
- Build a network of people you can practice with before a high-stakes negotiation encounter

 

So whether you are trying to get a raise, sell an idea for the next company outing, or persuade your friends/ family to see things your way... Let's get together and help each other be more successful.
results.name: Mastering negotiation and persuasion

results.description: CABARET: A form, or place, of entertainment featuring comedy, song, dance, and theatre, distinguished mainly by the performance venue: a restaurant or nightclub with a stage for performances and the audience sitting at tables (often dining or drinking) watching the performance, as introduced by a master of ceremonies or emcee. We are a group of singers, musicians, songwriters, and performers who have a love of Cabaret! Please join us at events held all over the Boston and surrounding areas. Learn about BACA (the Boston Association of Cabaret Artists - http://www.bostoncabaret.org/), take classes and workshops, and meet others from the world of Cabaret just for fun, or to perfect your craft!
results.name: Boston Association of Cabaret Artists

results.description:
We are working women of all levels whether corporate based, home based, or an entrepreneur; you will connect with motivated and inspiring women. This dynamic group of creative women will meet in the Metro West and Central MA area.

Within this group of influential of women we are

  • A highly effective referral network
  • A great educational format
  • We share how our business benefits others
  • And we have fun!

In each Meet-Up Group there will be a 15-20 minute presentation where we learn how each others business's work. Each Meet-Up, someone from the group will present an educational format about their business.

There is a private Facebook page that is available to our community.

We meet twice a month. Once in Metro West and once in the Central MA area. You are more then welcomed at one or both Meet-Up's.

Time and Location for Metro West:

From 9:00 - 10:00 AM

2nd Tuesday of each month

At Body, Mind and Spine - 201 Boston Post Road West - Marlborough, MA 01752.

Time and Location for Central MA

From 8:00 - 9:00

4th Wednesday of each month

Location:TBA
results.name: Women Business Networking Power Hour

results.description:
The MOMS Club® of Reading, MA is a wonderful way for you to meet other moms, who live in Reading, MA, as well as a fun way for your children to meet other children and make friends.

 

Regardless if you're new to Reading, MA, lived here your whole life, or something in between... if you're a Mom, and you live in Reading, MA, This MOMS Club® is for YOU!

 

We are frequently asked by prospective members the age of the children in our group. Here's a breakdown by age group: 24 Babies, 19 Toddlers, 24 Preschoolers, 27 Gradeschoolers. We have new members joining every month and update those numbers frequently!

 

All of our members have the ability to schedule events and can see who is hosting and attending. The majority of our activities, including monthly Open Houses (currently sponsored by Cookies 'n Cream Bakery, but in the past we've had other sponsors give us baked goods, chair massages, books & nail polish), museums/aquarium/zoos, outings/adventures, parks/playgrounds, playgroups (we have a new playgroup coordinator) & walking clubs are held in the daytime, while the Book Club and Moms Night Out offer evening options.

 

Newly created, in the goals of the MOMS Club® of Reading, MA are to: have fun with our children and moms of Reading, MA, provide a forum for topics of interest to women, give mothers more of voice in our community, as well as perform service projects to benefit the children of Reading, MA.

 

We are a 501(C)(3) charity. Our goal is to have fun and provide each other support, while also raising funds to help children in Reading, MA.

 

Membership dues are $20.00 annually (which may be waived due to extreme financial hardship), which provides you with access to member functions, our e-community, monthly newsletter, Mother to Mother fund charity maintained by the international organization to help any of our members dealing with devastating financial and natural disasters, and donations to benefit children in Reading, MA.

 

The MOMS Club® is an international nonprofit organization (go to www.momsclub.org if you do not live in Reading, MA to find your local MOMS Club® or information on how to start your own:) and has 2,000+ chapters across our country and 100,000+ members! The first MOMS Club® was created in 1983 to support stay-at-home mothers. The MOMS Club® has since evolved to include work-at-home and working mothers.

 

Please consider Joining Us!
results.name: MOMS Club® of Reading, MA

results.description: An independent user group for Ping Identity customers. This group is driven by customers; supported by Ping Identity. If you are interested in federation identity, identity and access management, or Internet-scale identity, this might be the group for you.
results.name: Ping Identity User Group - Boston

results.description: Am I the only person in Boston who will admit to reading trashy romance novels and LOVING them? I've formed this group to find others who share my love and want to talk about the finer points of romance novels (because there are many!) in a fun, fantastically female environment. We'll pick a new novel to read every month, which could be anything from the latest Lisa Kleypas or Christine Warren to oldies but goodies like Persuasion or Rebecca. Join me for some great, though occasionally ribald conversation, drinks of some sort or another, and laughs, while we revel in our love of romance novels, trashy or otherwise!
results.name: Boston Trashy Romance Readers

results.description: InnerTuning introduces and sharpens individual skills for balanced psychospiritual growth. It builds on the ancient Tantric and Vedic traditions of India, enriching contemporary psychology and science in order to meet the needs of modern times. Its distinguishing features include: • A unique and detailed explanation of chakras (Microchakra Psychology and its microchakras), which are centers of energy in the subtle body. • An understanding of how the relationship between openings and blocks for the chakras and microchakras influences our behavior, emotions, feelings and thoughts. • Private consultations for Chakra Analysis - A personalized mantra and individual protocol is prescribed for improved functioning of the microchakras. • Knowledge of the ancient Indian metaphysics of sound. The sounds for InnerTuning are produced through vocalizations (mantra) or sustained tones from a stringed instrument of ancient origin (tambura). These sounds maximize the flow of energy to the chakras and produce surya akasha (ethereal space). This space quiets the mind and dissolves the blockages. • An emphasis on the human being as part of nature. This leads to many suggestions for everyday living in such areas as interpersonal relations, sleep postures, breathing patterns (prana), yoga postures, choice of color, nutrition and special childrearing practices. • Practical methods for utilizing the different functions of the left and right hemispheres of the brain. • The miraculous discovery of a divine sanctuary within - leading to blissful meditation.
results.name: InnerTuning

results.description: Meetup with other local professionals who are interested in the Online News Association (ONA). Gather with writers, editors, photographers, producers, and all with an interest in the production of news for digital presentation. For more information or to become a member, check out http://www.journalists.org
results.name: ONA Boston

results.description:
The Women's Coding Collective group of smart, nerdy (and proud of it!) women who are taking over the world learning to program for the web.


If you have big ideas for new projects...


If you want the satisfaction, control, and flexibility of building those projects yourself...


If you're looking for a friendly community where you can share ideas and get inspired...


And if you want to do it all in an open, supportive, intimidation-free environment with other women...


then, welcome to the Women's Coding Collective. : )

 

http://thewc.co
results.name: Women's Coding Collective - Boston

results.description:
Athletes are increasingly looking for ideas on how to conduct social media campaigns, obtain items for silent auctions and put on creative events. It's going to take creative approaches to capture fundraising dollars in this competitive fundraising landscape.

This meetup group is the place people come to organize your fundraising events, get help training for them, or tap into the thought leadership on how to creatively raise money for great causes through endurance sport.

If you're putting on a fundraising for your marathon, triathlon, cycling event, swim or any other event, join the group and we'll make you an event organizer. Advertise your event with hundreds of people and get ideas from seasoned fundraisers.

Join us and let's raise some money for some great causes!

results.description:
We are  a group of software architecture enthusiasts who meet to do Architecture Katas.

 

What is an Architectural Kata- you ask ? Read on... http://blogs.tedneward.com/2010/06/17/Architectural+Katas.aspx

 

The first time, I did Architecture Katas was with   Ted Neward at a workshop he hosted at   NFJS 2011 in Boston. I quite liked the experience. It was fun and very educational.

Three things I liked the most about the workshop was

A) I exercised my brain in way that I normally don't get a chance to do (I know!! I know !!)

B) I heard some excellent ideas from others - who obviously had worked on very different products and had different experiences than mine

C) It was very interesting experience forming a group with a bunch of people I had just met and start to build something together.

When I talked to others who had attended the same workshop, I realized that there are others as well, who are interested as well.

 

What to expect ?

Its not your usual user group where you come to hear someone's opinion. People will be coming to hear you opinion and you will observe how others approach problem solving.

All attendees will be separated into groups- of three or more. Each group is then given an architectural problem.

The problem statement has requirements and is in some sense vague. You can make reasonable assumption and can approach the "game-master" for clarification.

You then have about 45 minutes to discuss the problem and brainstorm within your group. At the end- you give a presentation and others ask questions and critique your proposal (No flashy presentation slides !)

 

Where and how often do we meet ?

We meet in Burlington, MA .Once a month. On or near the 2nd Wednesday of the month
results.name: Architectural Kata Practitioners

results.description:
"Social in the Suburbs" (formally "Single in the Suburbs")

"Suggest a Meetup"

If you have a fun event idea, that you would like to do, and want to invite others to join you, then you can post it as an "event suggestion".  If more than three people like the event suggestion, then it will automatically become an event.  This way, everyone who is interested can meet and enjoy a fun activity together.  The event host will become the person who posted the suggestion, and that person can communicate with the other members who RSVP "yes" via the comment section (on the event page), about how to find them, or contact them if needed.

There will still be more formally held larger events, hosted by myself or other event organizers, such as dinners that require a reservation for a certain number of people, or dancing at the Leominster Elks, but it would be fun for people to be able to get together for spontaneous events if they are free; such as meeting for coffee, ice skating, hiking, taking your dogs for a walk, having lunch, skiing, seeing a movie, etc.

About our group:

Our group, is for people over 35 who are looking to expand their social circle to make new friends in the suburbs, metrowest of Boston.  This could also be a great resource to meet someone special to date.

Our group activities could include: Kayaking, bowling, river rapid tubing, whale watches, sunset cruises, picnics in the park, show tubing, horse back riding, going to movies (new, classic and foreign), wine tasting, going out to dinner, seeing live music performances, swing/salsa dancing, rock climbing, hiking, day trips to various parts of New England, taking a scenic drive to see the foliage.... and any other great ideas that people may have.  Group trips to other countries or islands, is also a possibility in the future.

Studies have shown that taking time for leisure activities apart from the demands of work and other responsibilities helps people function better physically and mentally.  In fact, the more time spent doing different types of enjoyable activities, the better a persons health tends to be.

Important:

* Since this is a social group, and the premise of the group is for people to form genuine connections with each other, a photo of yourself on your profile, is required for membership with the group:

1. a photo that shows your face clearly, without sunglasses

2. a photo that is larger than 2 inches when I click on it to enlarge it.

3. a photo of you by yourself (Avoid using a group photo, or photo of you and another person, which makes it difficult to identify which one is you).

4. Your photo should be visible on your profile at all times (not hidden), from onset of your membership request, and it needs to remain on your profile throughout your membership.

5. Your first name is also necessary on your profile (not a made up username, or initials).

* It is important for me, for the Event Organizers, Event Hosts, and for other members to be able to recognize you at events, just as you can recognize us.

 

* If you are interested in becoming an Event Organizer and organizing events in your area, please let me know.

Organizers plan events based on activities that they themselves enjoy, and invite others to join them.  They are not paid to do this, it is all volunteer... out of the goodness of their hearts.  They do it for the fun of getting to know other people, and the enjoyment of enabling others to make positive connections with each other.

 

Rules for events hosted by Organizers and Event Hosts:

Please RSVP “Yes” only if you are certain that you will attend: “Maybe” isn't an option, this is particularly important for dinner events.

If your plans change and you are unable to come to the event, please update your RSVP, so that someone else from the group can take your place.

If it is less than an hour from our meetup time, and you are unable to attend, or are running late, you MUST contact the organizer by calling or texting, her/him, so we don't wait for you unnecessarily, or save a seat for you.

Please be considerate of your fellow members by arriving promptly.

The organizer will email the members who have RSVP'd “Yes” for this event, by 11:00pm on the day prior to the event, with their cell phone number.

Please bring enough cash to pay for your portion of the event. For dinner events, this includes the price of your meal, your drink(s), tip, and tax.

If this meetup event is full and you wish to attend, there will be an automatic wait list RSVP. When a spot opens, your RSVP will be changed to “Yes”, based on the time your were wait listed.

No-Shows:

If after the meetup, your name appears on the event page as a “Yes”, but you have not attended, and have not contacted the Organizer prior to the event to inform him/her that you can't join us, it is counted as a “No Show”.

“No Shows” impact everyone; your fellow members who attend the events, as well is the organizer.  If it is a dinner event, and a reservation has been made, it also effects the restaurant who staffs based on our reservation.

“No Shows”, will also effect your membership status.  An email from you, within 24 hours, explaining your absence is an expected courtesy.  Regular "No Shows" may result in being banned from group!

A "No Show" to a dinner event, when there are people on the Wait List who could have taken your place, may result in removal from the group!

Thank you in advance for your cooperation
results.name: Social in the Suburbs, over 35, Metrowest of Boston

results.description:
Welcome to the Boston Monopoly Meetup Group! I am Organizer of 2 other Monopoly Meetup Groups, The New York City Monopoly Meetup Group and The DC Maryland Virginia Metro Area Monopoly Meetup Group. I have been playing Monopoly since I was a child and started collecting Monopoly Games in the 1980's. I currently have over 300 different sets from all over the world (different countries, different cities, themed editions, you name it). My goal is to share my love of this great game with others. I often bring different versions to the meetups to play. Most countries and cities have localized the properties. And I think it much more fun if you can buy Mayfair or Avenue des Champs-Élysées instead of always buying Boardwalk. If you've ever played Monopoly or would like to learn how to play, come join us. All skill levels are welcome! You don't have to be a pro to enjoy Monopoly. In whatever language, Monopoly still spells FUN! We are a friendly, fun loving group of people that enjoy playing this wonderful board game. So, come and play with us and have fun too! Check out some of the Monopoly Games from around the world in the Photo section.

Steve A.

Group Organizer

 

P.S. - Check out my friend Albert Veldhuis' Monopoly website. He catalogs every Monopoly and Monopoly-like game he can find and lists them all by country. You'll get to see some of my Monopoly Games on his site (Bulgaria, Costa Rica, Uruguay, Japan - Odaiba, Pakistan, South Korea, etc)

http://www.muurkrant.nl/monopoly/country_index.htm

The link to the home page of his web site is:  http://www.muurkrant.nl/monopoly/index.html


I also have a friend in Florida that sells African Art. He travels with his wife to Nairobi, Kenya to bring back art from local artists to sell here in the States. He sells a Kenyan Monopoly Game called Kumiliki. It's a beautiful game that comes in both a standard version with plastic houses and game pieces and a premium version with houses and game pieces made out of soapstone. It looks just like Monopoly but with a beautiful board and box (see photos in the photo section). If anyone is interested in buying this game or any of the Artwork he sells you can contact him through his website.  http://www.insideafricanart.com/
results.name: The Boston Monopoly Meetup Group

results.description:
We belong to an International Organization of EcoMoms, started by Kimberly Pinkson as a grassroots, global movement toward a sustainable future and helping to reduce the climate crisis.

While the Easton EcoMom Alliance is part of an international community of EcoMoms, we are almost completely autonomous in how we hold our meetings, our topics, and our events. It is important to emphasize that this is our group! But we have the added bonus of support and resources from the national organization.

We are a diverse group of moms who are concerned with the health of the environment and how that translates to human health. Part of our mission is to promote sustainable living through engagement in the Easton community and immediately surrounding towns. Moms of all shades of green are encouraged to join - whether you are just starting to explore sustainability in your home or whether you are a seasoned activist! We can all learn from and encourage one another.

Events for our group will include, but will not be limited to, Monthly Coffee Chats, Moms Nights Out, Movie / Documentary Nights, Play Dates, Family Events, Guest Speakers, Workshops, Buying Clubs, Community Clean-ups, Knitting Circle, Book Club, Clothing / Book Swaps, and more! The events, including days and times, will become more numerous and diverse as our membership grows.

 

Mission

The EcoMom Alliance is a non-profit, 501(c)3 organization inspiring and empowering women to help reduce the climate crisis and create a sustainable future. In the process, we also help to alleviate the isolation and over-extension so common among mothers in contemporary society.

 

Vision

Throughout history, during times of fever, flood, famine or flu, women step up and do what must be done. Our planet needs that now more than ever! Our children need it, we need it, and the future of all species depends on it. As both role models and a powerful market force, mothers (and earth mothers alike) can help foster an environmentally, socially and economically vibrant and healthy future.

 

How We Do It

Celebrating the ancient tradition of women gathering together around the fire (kitchen table, water cooler or what have you) to share, support, teach and learn, we create and promote events that are both educational and entertaining, i.e. events that are worth finding a babysitter for!

Like most things in life, we believe that change begin with one step and therefore focus on the 10 First Steps for A Sustainable Future. Leveraging the power of mothers, the EcoMom Alliance is dedicated to promoting a sustainable future for all.

 

For more information visit http://www.ecomomalliance.org/.

 

Please be aware that the views and/or opinions expressed by an individual member or members of this group are not necessarily those of everyone in the group.
results.name: The Easton Area EcoMom Alliance

results.description:
This group is for Pittsburgh sports fans living in Boston, especially those interested in watching games with fellow fans.

Yinz can catch every Steelers game with a large group of Terrible Towel-waving friends at CitySide Bar in Cleveland Circle in Brighton.

We also set up regular get-togethers for Penguins and Pirates games at various bars around Boston, particularly during the playoffs.

The group was started in 1996 (one of the founders still helps us organize!) and has grown tremendously on Meetup and Facebook.  We're continuing to develop the group, both in quality and quantity.  We've recently sold Yinz in Boston koozies(!) for the 2014 season and organized a flag football game against the Baltimore Ravens fan club of Boston. We've also been actively marketing the group via a Facebook ad campaign and on Twitter. The more members that come out, the more events we can have and the more bargaining power we have with bars.

Hope yinz can join us!

results.description:
Fact: Cats don’t socialize the way dogs do. Which means cat people don’t have social outlets like obedience classes and off-leash parks where they can share stories about their furry children, find out who the best vet and/or pet-sitter in the area is, and lots of other useful things.

This Meetup group is looking to change that.

If you are an aficionado of the feline, rather than the canine, version of a family pet – and especially if you are owned by more than one cat – this is the place to get to know others like you. People who will take an interest in the brilliant work of art your kitty crafted from a humble roll of toilet paper. People who will help you figure out the best way to groom your cat’s coat, how to manage allergies (or at least try to), and get the best value for your veterinary bucks. And best of all, people who will never say, “You have HOW many cats?”

Join us. . . for a purrfect meeting of the minds!

NOTE: You need not actually be in physical possession of a cat (or vice versa) to join this group. We have some members who are currently catless and are using it to get their much-needed "kitty fix!" All with a sincere love of and interest in cats are welcome!

results.description:
Let your voice be heard!

Voices of Harmony is a group that creates cross-cultural understanding and shares the wonderful sounds of music from cultures around the world. We invite all members of the community to join us in song and conversation!

Who's invited? We welcome anyone interested in joining a choir committed to building a better community through music and dialogue.  All genders, all ethnicities and backgrounds, and all levels of singing experience welcome and encouraged!

What do we do together? The group meets every week to spend time together singing and sharing our perspectives through facilitated conversations about race, culture, and diversity in Boston.  During our introductory meetings (the dates posted on Meetup), we introduce new members, have a conversation to get to know one another and teach a song.

When can I join? At the beginning of each season, we hold an Introductory Meeting to invite new members. Mid-season, there are sometimes opportunities to sit in on a rehearsal, or to attend a performance.  
NOTE: The current Fall through Spring season is underway. If you'd like to be on our notification list, email us, so that you can hear about our events and how to join us next Fall!

To learn more about Voices of Harmony, go to www.voicesofharmonyboston.org or email us at voicesofharmonyboston (at) gmail (dot) com

results.description:
Have you ever experienced that utter exhiliration of "being in the zone"? When everything felt perfect, you could see the world crystal clear and time seemed elastic? Taketina is a unique way that allows you to encounter that sense of "being in the zone".

 

TaKeTiNa is a full-body, full-mind experience. It is simultaneously challenging and safe. No previous movement or music experience is necessary, and no drums are required. Participants come from a diverse array of backgrounds, ages, and interests. The Taketina rhythm process has the ability to repattern deep neurological structures which can have an impact on such diverse aspects of human functioning as emotional balance, pain control, and cognitive learning. Rather than “thinking about rhythm”, in Taketina, you connect directly to the rhythm using your body. Through vocalization, clapping and stepping you are guided into three separate rhythmic layers. It is a musical group process that allows participants to access their innate ability to express and embody rhythm. Taketina reinforces a natural, at your own pace and organic way of learning that can induce a deeply relaxed state. It is a powerful process that can rapidly quiet the chatter in your head and bring you into connection with your inner core. Are you curious? Then come and get a taste of Taketina.
results.name: Taketina - New England
results.who: Ta Ke Ti Na Rhythm explorers

We always begin by getting centered and grounded and practicing energy basics for clearing, balancing and strengthening our energies. We also focus in depth on a specific topic or technique each time.  In the past our work has included: energy boundaries, a 13-Chakra Balancing protocol, identifying and clearing limiting beliefs, the Five Rhythms from Chinese Medicine, a 10-step self-care protocol,  energy nutrition/energy protection, and a comprehensive trauma clearing protocol.

A Conscious Evolution Circle is a meditative spiritual practice of communing with The Unified Sacred Field/Source/Essence and one another, heart to heart, essence to essence, and co-creating fields of love and resonance based on evolutionary conversations. It is about coming together for the Planetary Shift, which is essential at this point in the evolution of consciousness.

Join us to help co-create spiritually based relationships that support not only our ongoing growth but also the culture and evolution of consciousness on the planet. Help manifest the birth of a transformed humanity and the vision of a peaceful, sustainable, and prosperous world. Be The Change You Want To See In the World! Be Causal in your Life and the Planetary Shift! Create a Vision and Shape the Destiny of your Life and the World!

Margaret Arndt is a certified Agent of Conscious Evolution (ACE) through training with Barbara Marx Hubbard, who is co-founder and president of The Foundation for Conscious Evolution. As a facilitator of Conscious Evolution Circles, Margaret's aim is to introduce the key points, the memes, of Barbara Marx Hubbard's training as well as other conscious evolutionary topics in the Conscious Evolution Circles, using the Vistar Method* for Evolutionary Circles, and create fields of love and resonance based on evolutionary conversations, thereby evolving ourselves, our humanity, and our world.

results.description:
Hi there!

 

Its really tough when you have a kiddo diagnosed with Autism or a Special Need of some sort to put yourself out there and do things that parents with NT kids do. Im not pitting folks against each other, the overall experience is just different. We get the stares, the "How could that parent let that child get AWAY with that!" sort of feedback at malls, parks, playgrounds. . .just walking around.

 

I am proposing a group thats only semi organized since many of us live in a life thats full of pre determined schedules, doc appts, therapist visits, etc.

 

I am also proposing dropping all of the facade of being "so sorry" that my kiddo just knocked that over or defining what the special need is over and over again to people. This is a parental retreat with semi structured chaos.

 

Just a note. . .everything is fair game but I don't have a round table and this is going to be a group of active folks where we can have a movie night/sports night/ quasi cocktail night (clearly this depends on the kiddos) and make real friends who UNDERSTAND the roller coaster that we're on.

 

My friends are fantastic people, but they are either parents of NT kids or single. As such, sometimes its good to just watch a movie and know you're not alone.

 

I look forward to hearing from you.
results.name: Somerville/Cambridge Parents of kiddos with Autism

results.description:
EventHorizon, endurance sport is an all FREE community of endurance enthusiasts of ALL levels. Many of us participate in the sport of triathlon (from sprint to Ironman) so we enjoy running and appreciate the beauty and benefits of all other types of self-propelled motion. The distinguishing benefit of this group is that it is organized by experienced AND Certified Multisport coaches living in the Boston area. There's no agenda or manifesto.  We meet up, train, socialize and that's it! EventHorizon is an official Ironman Triathlon club partner for 2013 which means awesome benefits!

We motivate each other and also want to try to have a purely social meetup at least monthly. Whether you just want to get in shape, you're a seasoned athlete, or you want to take a swing at open water swimming, your first full/half marathon, triathlon, or train for a century bike ride; this is the group for you!

Swimmers, cyclists, runners, triathletes, newbies and supporters are all welcome. The organizers seek to partner with Team EnVision, TIMIRCE, Charles River Wheelman (CRW) and other local endurance groups to have well attended meet ups of athletes of a full range of abilities. We have sponsors that were strategically chosen to help endurance enthusiasts mitigate the costs of new equipment, products and apparel.

The group also has a companion Forum that we use for interaction on related topics and a Facebook Fan Page. Subscribe for exclusive training content and networking with athletes. We also have a companion website with a myriad of training resources, videos, and links located at http://EventHorizon.Tv
results.name: EventHorizon Endurance Sport

The prayer time will include a celebration of Holy Communion by the Rev. Sandra Hutchinson. All are welcome to attend; all Christians are welcome to participate in the communion. The focus of this monthly prayer time is on a just, secure peace in Jerusalem and all of the surrounding region. All prayer concerns for the area are welcome, since one of the purposes of this service is to unite our various hearts and voices in prayer for the Holy Land.

All of our programs for families raising/with young Jewish children are open to all – temple membership is not required. So whether you stay at home or work, there will be plenty of activities that you can participate in. Programs and events are sponsored by a grant from CJP (Combined Jewish Philanthropies) and Temple Israel of Boston. For more information or to get involved in planning, please contact Julie Unger at junger@tisrael.org.

 

Join our mailing list! https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/viewform?formkey=dGNiLVREZC1NWWhoallWcnRmVDAwWVE6MQ#gid=0

The Boston A11Y Roundtable meets monthly to discuss online accessibility, including trends in regulations and guidelines, barriers that people with disabilities face online, and techniques for achieving equal access by all for websites, applications, and documents.

The format of the meetings range from speaker presentations, to group case studies, to impromptu discussions, and more. Everyone is welcome to attend! Audience: Developers, designers, usability professionals, accessibility experts, and anyone interested in making content accessible.

results.description:
Welcome to Young Bostonians!

Who are we: We are a group of young professionals, with an age range of 21 - mid 30's.  Our group is designed for anyone who is looking to meet new people and have fun while doing so.  It is for people who live in and around the Boston area.

What we do: We go on tours, go to festivals, athletic events, wine tastings, concerts, hiking, trivia nights, happy hours and more! Suggestions for fun events are always recommended!

Cost: To join the group, we greatly appreciate a $1 yearly donation to cover the costs of running the group.  Some of the events have an associated fee, which is always stated in the event description.

New to the group? We want everyone to feel welcome!  If it's your first event with Young Bostonians, feel free to contact the organizer in advance or say hello upon arrival.  The attendees are usually a healthy mix of newcomers and regulars. Everyone is very welcoming!

Requirements:

All members must have a recent, clear photo of themselves to join and stay a member of Young Bostonians.  Please be sure that the picture is only of YOU!

Please RSVP for all the events you plan on attending, and update your RSVP if your attending status changes! 

All members must be welcoming of all races, religions, sexual orientation etc. Any and all discriminatory comments related will not be tolerated. Please contact an organizer if you have any issues.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DISCLAIMER:  During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. The organizer, assistant organizers and event hosts are not responsible for the safety of the participants. We will try our best to prevent accidents, but are not responsible or liable if something happens to you. By being a member of the group, you fully acknowledge this.
results.name: Young Bostonians

I would personally love to see if  others would find my ideas helpful, but I would also just love to hear what others are doing.  I don't like to call it interfaith, because beliefs may or may not be an issue, but there are always family and culture differences.

We've developed a nice core group and we'd love to have you be part of our growing community. We have monthly meetup dinners which are enjoyable fun evenings. There was a membership fee for creating this meetup group so please bring $1.00 to each meetup event that you attend. This will allow us to maintain the group. The process going forward is that each person should voluntarily give $1 to the on-site event organizer.

SEMU (South End Meet UP) CRAFT (Creative Recreational Artistic Foodie Technical) Wizards group is a chance for professionals, amateurs, patrons and anyone who is involved with or passionate about the Creative Economy (CE)  in the in the Boston area, to talk shop and exchange stories, ideas and information. It is hard enough for professionals in other fields in this economy to ply their trade, but for the pros in CE, it is even more brutal out there. Why be alone? Why not be part of a gang.... or mob?

Formally known as the Creative Wizards Group, the point of this "re-branding" of this group, is to the finally establish it as a  nice, little community of diverse professionals who engage the creative process from different angles and that can connect, communicate and maybe collaborate with each other. Whether you are an established person in the local art scene, someone trying to break in to the design industry, or a long time patron, sign on up and network with other like-minded people in the South End.

I am currently the organizer of this meetup, but I would like to have some other people step up to the plate, as I also run another meetup and therefore it is difficult for me by myself, to give help build this group to be what is capable of being. If anyone wants to help steer this ship into the right direction please contact me through Meetup.Com

results.description:
It doesn't matter if you're a beginner or seasoned pro, shooting with a one-time use camera or a high end digital, this group is all about getting out, having fun, and taking some great photos with people that share the same interests and passions about photography.

We will not only visit the well-known locations for photography, but hopefully we will visit locations that you would not think of as being photogenic, or places that you did not even know existed, or would not even think of as a place for photography.

Please note that some traveling, up to 4 hours, may be needed to attend some events. Your organizers want to get everyone out of their comfort zone (including themselves) so please feel free to suggest locations you know of, have heard of, have always wanted to go to so we can all enjoy the adventure.

**In order to provide the best experiences for our members please note that you will be removed from the group if you do not visit the group site in three months and/or have three no shows. Neither is fair to the other members.**

Membership is $15 per year to pay for the group costs with a two week free trial.

Please note, certain events will have a minimum attendance set by the organizer. This minimum is completely at the organizers discretion and is a result of the many no shows we deal with. We try to come up with interesting places to introduce the members to and some are quite a drive for us. When we go through all this planning and are expecting 5-10 members to arrive and no one does, it shows a massive lack of respect for us and the work we put into planning the event. Some groups charge for each event to limit no shows but we don't. We're not trying to make a living from these events but we deserve respect. If you change your rsvp from yes to no you will not be marked as a no show. Your organizers realize life happens but just as you'd tell your boss or a friend that you won't be there, please take a few minutes to change your rsvp. Three no shows will get you removed from the group. Please understand that these rules are as a direct result of 95% of our events having a 20% - 50% no show rate, with a few having a 100% no show.
results.name: New England Photographers Group

results.description:
This human being is a guest house,
Every morning a new arrival.
A joy, a depression, a meanness,
Some momentary awareness comes
As an unexpected visitor.
Welcome and entertain them all,
Even if they are a crowd of sorrows
Who violently sweep your house
Of all it’s furniture.
Still treat each guest honorably.
She may be cleaning you out for some new delight.
The dark thought, the shame, the malice,
Meet them at the door laughing, And invite them in.
Be grateful for whoever comes,
Because each has been sent
As a guide from beyond.
~Rumi

"Asana practice is a process for being present in the moment with an abiding sense of freedom and wholeness that brings about an experience of being fully alive, energized, and in bliss. As a practice of self-transformation, yoga asanas give us a set of tools for untying the binding knots that create patterns of holding and stagnation deep in our being." (Mark Stephens, Teaching Yoga, 2010)

results.description:
Intuitive Painting is a powerful and exciting methodology developed by Dr. Pinki Feinstein, the founder of the Psycho-Creative Institute in Tel Aviv, Israel. Intuitive Painting (IP) is an amazing way to express "emotional creativity" and silence your self-critic, and it's enormously fun to do. The class is taught in Brookline by Rochelle Seltzer. Hugely popular in Israel and recently introduced in LA, this is the first time IP is being offered on the East Coast. I'd love to have you learn more about it and welcome you to attend a class or a workshop. No prior artistic experience or talent is required — you only need a passion to create! (Check out the excellent articles that Dr. Pinki has written for us, under the "More" tab, in "Files".

If this intrigues you please get in touch.

Rochelle Seltzer

results.description:
Women on Course is a one-of-a-kind group that connects like-minded women through business and social networking events, on and off the golf course. Whether you’re flirting with the game or already involved, Women on Course invites you to enjoy all the benefits the golf lifestyle has to offer. You don’t have to spend five hours on the course to take advantage of the networking and social benefits golf has to offer, join us on the 1st Tee or at the 19th Hole and know that a good time will be had by all who attend!

More than golf, Women on Course emphasizes fun and friendship at our Signature networking events and golf outings. Join us for a luncheon, a golf lesson or our wildly popular "9 & Wine" events where you can play a quick 9-holes and then enjoy a glass of wine in the clubhouse with your new friends. Form lifelong friendships and business relationship with other strong women, in person and through our virtual clubhouse where you will find golf tips, game improvement resources, member discounts, contests, forums and more.

Register for an event today! Give Women on Course a try and see firsthand why “Golf is more than just a game, it's a lifestyle.” For more information, visit our website: www.womenoncourse.com

results.description:
This group offers an alternative to many enthusiastic francophiles eager to learn the language. This is your opportunity to start or continue learning French!

These classes held online are relatively small but conducive to healthy exchanges while allowing personalized help from the instructor. Yes, students do get to converse with fellow students of the same level who are attending the class simultaneously.

A native speaker with fifteen years of experience teaching in a French Lycée, I can help you to conquer the intricacies of what is known as Voltaire's language. Working through Skype or at your location, at your choice when possible, I will steer you in the right direction so you understand nuances that might just escape you otherwise.

I take great pleasure teaching French and it is my hope that it shows.

As the group's name suggests, a level of commitment is required. I make sure students are not bored. However, the focus is on mastering the language while acquiring effective conversation skills .

The program spreads over 10 weeks. At the Introduction Session, you will learn more about the required material such as textbook and so forth. You will also have an opportunity to take a Placement Test. Also, the tuition is kept very reasonable. Please, email me for details and registration.

Come and join us, beginners, intermediate or advanced speakers. Come learn French!!
results.name: Serious French.....But, Relax!

results.description:
These are not your typical software engineering events.

BSE is a community organization founded to inspire software developers by creating software focused events that bring together new ideas and emerging technologies.

Events produced by BSE cover topics like Robotics, 3D Printing, Nanotechnology, Wearable Technology, Synthetic Biology, Artificial Intelligence, Arduino, Deep Learning, and Space Travel all with a software engineering focus and perspective.  We often cover emerging technologies alongside current technologies and techniques.

Coding ability is encouraged but not required to attend our events.

Events format varies from speakers to panels, job fairs, networking, or code labs. Emerging technology topics are often mixed in with app development, HTML5, Hadoop, Python, Eclipse, JavaScript, Java, Machine Learning, HBASE, MapReduce, MongoDB, NoSQL, PHP, Agile, Ruby on Rails (RoR), Swift, iOS, Android, R, Frameworks, IDEs, OO, Cloud, Angular.JS, Node.JS, Mobile, Business Intelligence, and UI/UX.

We will begin to expand into areas of technology no local meetup groups have ever covered before. This is an exciting time for human civilization and for software.

Join BSE, attend our events, and experience it for yourself.

Code The Future.
results.name: Boston Software Engineers

results.description:
Tantra: The Art of Conscious Loving™

Come discover the power of Tantra as a healing art designed to awaken you to the pleasures of life. Learn to live your life by the principles of Tantra Yoga. At each moment you can experience love and oneness with all things. Tantra is a lifestyle. You can call it a mindfulness practice or you can call it the practice of bringing the Divine into everyday experiences from the most mundane moments to the peaks of ecstasy, the path of Tantra allows you to bring body, mind and spirit into balance.

Have you ever wondered if there must be more to sexual loving? Have you experienced the kind of deep sexual connection with a partner that leads you to tears of joy and a deep sense of knowing the divine? Join this meet-up and learn that sex is an art form that every conscious person can master. Learn that when passion, love and consciousness join together they transform sex into a profound and loving meditation that increases intimacy, joy and connection.

If you ever heard the word Tantra and wondered what all the fuss was about - then this is the meet-up for you. Come be informed and guided by three extremely experienced and knowledgeable teachers/healers, trained among others at the Source School of Tantra Yoga in Santa Cruz, CA, and participate in the inquiry of how to live life to its fullest. Say "Yes, I want to live my life with passion and awareness!" Studying Tantra will fulfill this promise by giving you priceless skills - not only in your intimate relationships but woven into all aspects of your life. Let's be students together! (The word student comes from the Latin word studere which means to devote oneself.)

Although there has been a recent explosion of information on how to be more respectful and accepting of sexuality we can still struggle with the old cultural mixed messages that we carry within ourselves. In a safe and light-hearted environment we will explore these and continue to find ways to shed the old and bring in the new which is actually rooted in a deep knowing since the beginning of human consciousness.

This meet-up group is geared towards beginners, but participants of all levels are welcome. It is our experience that each time, no matter how often one has heard something, a new light is shone on an aspect that one thought (s)he had mastered. If you are a therapist/healer this meet-up group will also teach you practical tools that you can pass on to the people you work with. Together we will explore the basics of Tantra and move more deeply into the skills for deepening intimacy with yourself and/or a partner through meditation techniques, understanding and mastering energy, conscious communication, modalities of touch, and so much more. Classes will be a mix of didactic and experiential. We will have exercises, discussions, time for questions and answers, and sacred rituals (pujas).

We meet once a month for a series of five. The first series of five began on January 15, 2012 and culminated on May 23, 2012 with a Puja ritual and a Q & A session with Charles Muir, the author of "Tantra: the Art of Conscious Loving" followed by the Beginner's Workshop on May25, 26 & 27, 2012 when he was joined by Leah Alchin. Each workshop can be taken individually and will also build on concepts and practices of the previous ones. The next five months' series began in the fall of 2012.

In 2013 we will be sponsoring Sheri Winston, author of "Women's Anatomy of Arousal" for three workshops on March 1 and 2. These workshops can be taken together or separately. More information will follow.

The annual Source School of Tantra Yoga Beginner's Workshop will be held on May 24, 25 and 26, 2013.

Penny Goldmuntz, Dameron Midgett and Betta de Boer-van der Kolk are Advanced Certified Tantra Educators with the Source School of Tantra Yoga. The curriculum is greatly informed by SSTY. However, they both draw on their considerable experience as Body-Psycho therapists with methods such as Internal Family Systems; Hypnosis; Rubenfeld Synergy Method; Trauma Work; Tai Chi; Chi Gung; EMDR; Holistic Neurology Energy Healing; Mind Power meditations; REIKI; Energy Practices and many others.

We are delighted that Dameron Midgett, also an Advanced Certified Tantra Educator joined us in the beginning of 2013 to add his experience and knowledge to our teaching staff. For more information please read his profile on the Meet-up site.

We look forward to meeting you all and be students of Tantra together
results.name: Source School of Tantra Yoga Boston

results.description:
Learn how to add more joyful laughter to your life by attending the Let's Laugh Today Laughter Club in Franklin, MA, Wapole, MA, Sharon, MA or the Westwood Laughter Circle in Westwood, MA. See www.letslaughtoday.com  Anyone can do these easy, healthful breathing techniques along with simulated laughter that always seems to turn into real laughter! All ages and levels of physical ability are welcome. There are no fancy poses and no jokes or comedy is involved. There's plenty of free parking at all our venues. Since laughing is dehydrating, please bring your water bottle.

Linda and Bill Hamaker are Certified Laughter Yoga Teachers and have trained with the Indian physician, Dr. Madan Kataria, who created Laughter Yoga plus are also graduates of the American School of Laughter Yoga. You will leave the session feeling relaxed, energized and full of joy and happiness! Contact us through this Meet-up or our e-mail is letslaughtoday@verizon.net and see the web site http://www.letslaughtoday.com/ for more information and other opportunities to laugh with us and special events! We have been successful with our groups for three years now, but are now trying to reach the Meet-up community! Remember, we can also provide a FUNtastic laughter session for your own group or train you to bring the joy to your own community!
results.name: Let's Laugh Today based on LAUGHTER YOGA

results.description:
Free Tai Chi Classes with master level teacher Zhou Xuan Yun

Winter - Sundays from 10:00am - 11:00am, Castle Square Community Center, 464 Tremont Street, Boston, MA 02116

Summer - Sundays from 10:00 am - 11:00am, Boston Commons (across from Loews Theater on Tremont Street)

Visit dbahealth.org or e-mail info@dbahealth.org for more information.

______________________________________________________________________

ABOUT US

The Daoist Benevolent Association (DBA) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit corporation based in the state of Massachusetts owned by Zhou Xuan Yun.  The DBA is a Daoist Temple disseminating traditional Chinese Daoist philosophies and mind body health practices.  We offer Daoist mind body therapies i.e. taiji, qi gong therapy and various meditative practices, kung fu and traditional Chinese medicine treatments (TCM).  The DBA is open to everyone, and is committed to providing a safe and nurturing community environment.

In addition to this free Taiji class, Zhou Xuan Yun offers a number of different Tai Chi & Kung Fu & Qigong classes around the Boston area. For his full class schedule please see http://daoistgate.com/ongoing-classes/

______________________________________________________________________

Taiji Quan (Tai Chi) or “Grand Ultimate Fist” is often described as “meditation in motion”. Wudang Taiji Quan, combines ancient Chinese wellness practices with traditional fighting techniques. Practiced slowly, Taiji Quan is a set of gently, flowing movements that focus on movement and breathing, creating a state of calm relaxation.  Taiji addresses the key components of fitness; muscle strength, flexibility, balance, and aerobic conditioning. When used as a martial arts, Taiji Quan specializes in uprooting the opponent, redirecting incoming force and using softness to overcome hardness. Rigorous scientific research has shown evidence that Taiji is helpful for several medical conditions, including: arthritis, low bone density, breast cancer, heart disease, hypertension, Parkinson’s Disease, sleep problems, and stroke.


Taiji can give you
the strength of a lumberjack,
the pliability of a child,
and the peace of mind of a sage.

-Chinese Proverb
results.name: Daoist Benevolent Association's Weekly Free Tai Chi Class
