results.description:
South of Boston Lesbians is a social group for Lesbians anywhere south of the Boston. Our purpose is to help build a supportive and respectful community, socialize and have fun. We are an inclusive group for women (over 21) of different backgrounds that identify as Lesbian. We want to provide an opportunity for women to get together with old friends and to form new friendships. This is not a dating group. The group is about socializing and making friendships. 


 Group members are encouraged to propose events either by contacting the group organizers (Lori, Patsy,  Shawn and Linn ) or by posting themselves. Just choose an activity and share the details (date, time, place, and cost). Keep in mind some events may have to limit the number of attendees due to space or other restrictions. One of the organizers will attend as many of the events as possible to help welcome everyone. Please don't hesitate to share your suggestions.

Our goal is to create a vibrant and supportive community of women, so we ask that members use the Meetup platform in a considerate and respectful fashion. We are committed to have everyone feel comfortable and safe. We look forward to meeting new women, so sign up for an event today. Please be sure to edit your RSVP if your plans change. Some business and hostesses need accurate counts to ensure a fun time for all. Please use the message board and communication channels to propose or announce Meetups and events. (Please do not use the message board for unrelated requests, e.g. looking for an apartment rental or selling a car). We welcome sponsorship from businesses and for-profit events relevant to our demographic. For more information, please email an organizer.

Welcome to Free And Cheap Things in Boston (aka FACT-Boston)!

FACT-Boston has two primary objectives:

(1) inform people about free (or darn cheap) things to do in Boston that they might not otherwise know about, and

(2) help people find others to do those things with, in case they don't feel like doing them alone.

We'll find fun things to do that are either free or cost no more than $10. And we'll make some new friends in the process!

Here's to finding many FACTs (Free And Cheap Things) in Boston!

Gary

PS - You can now find us directly at www.FACT-Boston.com.

Feel free to suggest any free events you want. If you want to have a paid event by which you profit, you must speak with me regarding posting terms.

Change How You See Yourself and Change the Results
Women have regularly dated and/or married geeks of all shapes and sizes. Don't disqualify yourself before you've even started trying to connect with her. topics.name: Nutritional Approach for Special Needs Children

results.description: I set this group up because I want to discuss issues and solutions around how diet and nutrition can impact and improve the wellness of children with special needs. Do you know a child with allergies, anxiety, stomachaches, a picky eater, ASD, ADHD, PDD-NOS, quirky etc. It can be challenging to teach children about healthy eating -- especially if the child is very picky and/or resistant to new foods.  If you are a parent, a service provider, a grandparent, or a person living with special needs yourself, join us to talk about the current thinking regarding the value of a nutritional approach to supporting improved well being for the special needs child. Perhaps you have tried a special diet and it has worked -- or not; perhaps you are looking for recipes that will appeal to you or your child; perhaps you want to vent. Join us and share resources and support, and a few laughs. Feel free to e-mail me with your ideas any time. best, Paula

results.description:
Tired of only seeing Meetup groups and events that happen in Boston?Looking for something fun to do during the week or on the weekend that's closer to home? Look no further! This group is organized for men and women in their 20's & 30's who have time and energy to spare and want to make new friends on the North Shore! This group's events mostly consist of after-work drinks, dinners, leisure sports (bowling, mini golf, etc), and overall just mixing and mingling at bars or restaurants. We welcome all types of personalities, and our goal for this group is to help you do fun things with new friends. If that sounds like a good time to you, then we'd love to meet you!


By joining this group, we ask that you agree to the following:


1. Have fun and socialize respectfully both online and at events.

2. This is not a "singles" group, so please do not message members you haven't met with romantic inquiries or statements. Although some members have found romantic matches through the group, it was a result of our friendly, respectful, and pressure-free environment that we have created.

3. Update your RSVP if you can no longer attend an event. It is important that we have an accurate headcount for our events, and "no show" members take RSVP slots from other members. If you are a "no show" more than twice, you will be removed from the group.

4. Take responsibility for your safety. We ask that you make smart choices about your personal well-being and physical safety both during and outside of events. Although we will do our best to prevent accidents, we are not responsible or liable if something happens.

5. Post a current self-photo to your profile and answer all profile questions. This makes finding you at events easier and helps us cater events based on your interests.


To maintain our group's inclusive and welcoming atmosphere, we ask that you adhere to the guidelines above. After reading our profile above, we hope you will join our group! We look forward to meeting you soon!

results.description:
What is Slow Food?

Slow Food is an idea, a way of living and a way of eating. It is part of a global, grassroots movement with thousands of members in over 150 countries, which links the pleasure of food with a commitment to community and the environment.

Slow Food is a volunteer run organization committed to building communities through the food we eat. Slow Food’s foundation is in the promotion that all foods should be GOOD, CLEAN and FAIR for all. This means that we are collectively committed to supporting efforts to make our food supply more sustainable, cleaner, and available to consumers. Are you interested in sourcing foods that are more nutritious and delicious for your family? Well the Slow Food movement has grown now to more than 500 chapters around the world including over 225 chapters here in the United States. Slow Food even has nearly a dozen chapters here in New England and we collaborate our leadership together as Slow Food New England.

Here at Slow Food Boston we work to promote foods grown and produced first here in Massachusetts but also throughout New England. We seek to raise awareness of sustainability issues and to host events that are just plain fun. After all, if you don’t enjoy your food, why bother eating it? Life is too short to eat fast food.

What is Fast Food?

We all take for granted the process in which most of our food gets to our local marketplaces to satisfy our taste and demand for convenience. Much of our food supply is harvested now in large quantities in remote lands including Mexico. Our foods are grown on large farms and to maximize the farmer’s yield a massive amount of insecticides, growth hormones, antibiotics, and genetically modified seeds and species are introduced into our food supply. These foods are therefore rushed to harvest and then rushed to market on large boats and trucks typically requiring transportation of several thousands of miles. This is Fast Food! And we at Slow Food Boston look to change this process by educating our community about alternatives that make our foods more delicious and nutritious.
results.name: Slow Food Boston

results.description:
Welcoming all cycling enthusiasts from all Boston Areas.  Join us in creating one of the Best cycling groups in Boston.We organize a ton of Casual Rides for fun all over the Boston area.

See great neighborhoods, beautiful scenery and meet great people too! Rides range from slow rides 8-15 mph to fast rides 22 mph The purpose of this group is to bring people together, learn from experienced riders and enjoy Boston sunny days.

Suggested donation:

$1 appreciated, not required

For people looking to meet other local cyclists for rides all around the Boston Area, explore new trails, share training tips, etc.

Please be advised that cycling is a dangerous sport and you are solely responsible for your own safety. Helmets are mandatory and other protective gear is strongly recommended.Safety is a cheap and effective insurance policy. So why not be safe & Have fun

DISCLAIMER: By being a member of this group you hereby agree to assume all risks and liability related to or resulting from any and all group functions. You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold any of the group's leaders or representatives liable for any injury, loss, or damage to your own person or any members of your family, friends, acquaintances, children, pets, or property, arising directly or as a consequence from a group activity. You also agree that your membership of this group is based on an "at will" basis.

Our rating system:

Beginner - 5-15 mile rides led by experienced cyclists who are able to offer instruction. Each ride begins with an equipment check and basic instruction on using brakes and gears. The ride typically includes two or three instructional stops, as well as visits to scenic or cultural highlights, and sometimes we will stop at a cafe. Duration 2-3 hours.

Easy - 15-30 miles. Average rolling speed 8-12 mph. A social event on bikes. Frequent stops for photographs, scenery or to wait for the group to come back together. Often includes a visit to a cafe. Very good for riders who are comfortable with the basics of bike control and are looking to go farther afield. Duration 2-3 hours.

Recreational - 20-40 miles. Average rolling speed. 10-13 mph. For riders who enjoy bowling along a leisurely pace and having a good conversation while on the move. Why hurry? We're here to have an enjoyable ride! Stops to regroup at the top of climbs and elsewhere if the group has broken up. Cafe stop? You bet! Duration 2-4 hours

Sporting - 30-80 miles. Average rolling speed: 14-17 mph. For riders who are looking to extend their limits and experience. Should be riding at least three times a week and be capable of extended periods of high intensity exercise. Riders will learn how to ride in echelon and other close-formation skills. The first riders to the hilltop wait until all riders are up. Duration 2.5-6 hours

Advanced - distance varies. The pace will be high. For advanced riders with good group riding skills. Must be riders in training for a tough event, or otherwise excellent cyclists capable of riding with the most advanced group rides such as Roasters, House of Pain, etc. The group doesn't stop for those that get dropped.

Cycling Dinner - A Sporting or Recreational ride that ends at a restaurant. We will reserve a large table.

And much more to Come...Stay Tuned....


Like Us on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/BostonCycling

BostonCycling Founded: 3/12/12 by all of us, Cycling Enthusiasts !!!

The Spirit Within (TSW) is about safely exploring and deepening your meditation and spiritual practice. Danielle is trained in a variety of modalities such as Magnified Healing (working with Kwan Yin's energy), Usui Reiki, Melchizedek Healing (working with Egyptian and Ascended Master energy) as well as offering EFT (tapping), muscle testing and NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming to help promote healing, remove energy blockages and to awaken you to new spiritual tools and techniques. Danielle is a certified hypnotist, soul therapy practitioner, intuitive and channels most meditations and materials from the angels and masters to share with her students. Learn how to incorporate some of these tools into your own practice!

MENTORING

Mentoring programs are regularly offered and mentoring students will have an opportunity to work with TSW to learn how to operate a spiritual practice. TSW is about helping to create teachers and to inspire others to their own individual pathways of light.

HEALING CENTER

Danielle is working on providing an all-inclusive healing center that covers everything from meditation and mindfulness, to yoga and the body, diet and nutrition, energy work and holistic health and beauty care. In addition to her spiritual and holistic credentials, she is also a licensed esthetician, aromatherapist and makeup artist with over a decade's experience in the skin care and artistry industry. Her goal is to offer life changing principles that help each person learn to love themselves on the inside and outside! Our body is a sacred vessel of light that when treated with love and respect, transforms us into the joy and love that we are meant to be. 

PURANA Division

Danielle has added a new division within her practice that includes makeup artistry and skin care services. The new division is "Purana Makeup Artistry", which will offer skin care and artistry lessons as well as personalized services for special events. All products used will be certified non-GMO, Organic, Vegan and Gluten Free. Extensive research is being done to only offer the best products to help balance the mental, emotional, spiritual and physical bodies. Toxins most definitely alter our depth and experience on a spiritual path and learning to work with and utilize products that are toxin free will help cleanse and align the bodies mentioned above.

COMMUNITY

Danielle oversees a growing community that cares about sharing the light and being of service to one another and our earth. It is Danielle's mission to help spiritually strengthen, guide and share her light with as many as she is led to. Through these offerings and intuitive guidance she helps to inspire those in finding their own spiritual pathway and journey. Her offerings are extensive and many unique holistic and alternative therapies are offered at The Spirit Within. Danielle is currently enrolled in a Kundalini Yoga Teacher program and offers monthly sangha's (Community gatherings) at her North Andover location as well as teleconference's for world peace and specialized services to other yoga and holistic centers. She is the mother of two children and lives with her family in Methuen, MA.

Please check back regularly to see what is being offered! Hope to see you soon.

Sat Nam and Namaste!

May the divine light guide you on your path always.

Loving light,

Danielle Federico

results.description: This group is for men and woman who have been widowed and are ready to move on with the rest of your life. Be it for friendship, companionships or dating. Walks, bike rides, dining out, camping, weekends away, dancing or anything else you might suggest.  We could be a great source of comfort for each other.  See how easily you connect with others who understand what you have been through.  If you think you are ready to move on then you are probably ready for us, so join in the fun.
results.name: Widows and Widowers Moving On in the Merrimack Valley

We are organizing this meetup to network and celebrate all the innovations being created by our neighbors in Needham.

results.description:
We're the group formerly known as the Boston LUNA Chix. Starting for the 2015 season we'll have a new name and a new night! We'd love for all of you to join She Runs Boston on Tuesday evenings at 6:30 p.m. beginning in April 2015. We will still meet at Athleta, still welcome women of all paces and abilities, and of course will still have a ton of fun!

More information on the upcoming season can be found on:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/sherunsboston/

Twitter: @sherunsboston

Stay tuned, and we look forward to running with you in 2015!
results.name: She Runs Boston

results.description:
Started as a meditation group, we have now expanded to include all areas of holistic healing. We offer a place for like-minded people to try, explore, learn, and seek holistic healing for themselves through a variety of groups including (but not limited to!): Meditation, Qi Gong, Essential Oils, Health and Wellness, peer support and more!

Additionally, we also rent out space for other Meetups to host their groups, if interested please email liz@clearandnowhealing.com to make sure we are a good fit for your Meetup needs.
results.name: Andover Meditation Group

results.description:
Welcome to CoFoundersLab Matchup Boston!

Have you tasted a startup or want to start your own business? Maybe you’re a serial entrepreneur, a skilled developer or marketer looking to go out on your own, or corporate life simply isn’t for you?

CoFoundersLab Matchup Boston is an extension of CoFoundersLab.com, a FREE online matchmaking platform.

These in-person events complement the online platform by bringing together entrepreneurs looking for co-founders with those people looking to join someone else's startup as a core team member.

We'll bring together co-founders, advisers & interns. Hopefully you’ll find your perfect partner to get your business off the ground or to take it to the next level.

Start networking now by creating a FREE profile on CoFoundersLab.com!

Check out what entrepreneurs are saying at our CoFoundersLab Matchups:
results.name: CoFoundersLab Matchup Boston

results.description: Networking SMART (Strategic Marketing Advisory Referral Team) is a distinctively different networking approach for new business development and management. Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur looking to get assistance on building your brand, develop new business opportunities, objective advice to enhance your business, improve marketing & sales capabilities and results, developing meaningful business relationships?
results.name: Networking SMART - Andover

results.description: So when you are starting a business or thinking about starting a business..Everyone is always saying..Network! But how do you network? Where do you start? I am a newish to the Real Estate business and looking to meet other business people in the area to start networking. I would love to meet lots of people with lots of skills that I can connect with and learn from! JOIN ME on the adventure..Even if you haven't started a business yet..but are thinking about it..I want it to be a group of people who you can bounce ideas off of and just get started.  You don't really have to be new either..Just be interested in learning and creating new business connections.
results.name: New Business Owners or Entrepreneurs!

results.description: Group description for meet up group Join award-winning photographer Rick Friedman for Boston Photo Meetups and learn how to create with your DSLR! This meet up group is open to all levels of photographers with a passion to learn how to create better images. Come and join in for one of his photo meetups, where we will explore the graphic and unique perspectives of the city. Learn how light and exposure can dramatically enhance your images. Rick leads a number of Location Lighting Workshops in the US and abroad. He always enjoys teaching and sharing his knowledge about photography and lighting with other shooters. This group is designed to introduce photographers to the unlimited potential light, settings and other variables can have on their photographs. If interested in short photographic jaunts for a couple of hours please join this group and we will set up some times and locations. Looking forward to documenting with our cameras an incredible Spring. About Rick Friedman Rick Friedman, an award winning photojournalist for over three decade, Is dedicated to the art of photography. Rick is currently teaching a 12 city Location Lighting Workshop Tour across country during Spring 2012. Learn about his intensive Location Lighting Workshop Schedule and see testimonials from other photographers who have taken his class, editors who have worked with him and clients. To see the diversity and his ability , Please visit his website to see the and his FB page: Location Lighting Workshops with Rick Friedman (artist) To see his work, please visit Rick's website FB: Location Lighting Workshops with Rick Friedman (artist) Twitter: RickFriedmanPix
results.name: The Boston Photography Workshop with Rick Friedman

results.description:
In this group, we take it slow! Rather than rushing around taking thousands of photos, we learn to stand still, be present and see the beauty of the moment right before our eyes. Then we discover the most astonishing photos are not taken by us, but given to us. Photography offers a path to mindfulness and can be a form of meditation that connects you to the beauty of daily life. In this moment, we feel revitalized, refreshed, and awake!

Do you love to just get so into taking photos you loose track of time? Or perhaps you would just enjoy learning how to take better photos? Either way, you will feel a deep sense of satisfaction and pleasure when you create photos using this method.

You should join this group if you would enjoy exploring photography as a contemplative practice that connects you to the mystical, magical moments of beauty in daily life. Discover how to develop a good eye by taking photos while you are in the "zone" or flow state. Some simple mindful, meditation practices will be introduced.

We will explore 8 secret universal patterns of beauty such as luminosity and vitality as lenses through which to see creatively and be connected to a subject. We will have lots of fun as we go with the flow!

There are many different types of photography: landscape, portrait, night, each requiring basic photography knowledge and some special skills. Mindful photography is another type of photography you can add to your life purely for pleasure. The special skills required are focused more on your inner stance of stillness and quiet. Simple meditation practices are used to get grounded and centered before you click the shutter. That way you connect to the heart of the moment. Join us and find out more.
results.name: Mindful Photography Workshops for Non-Technical People

results.description: Disclaimer: while I have no problem with gaming, this group is not about that. No location chosen yet but I have some ideas.This just basically an informal meetup, maybe start with about 30 minutes of mingling, followed possibly by an informal roundtable discussion/introduction where all attendees can introduce themselves and have the opportunity to give a description of their project, idea or vision they are launching or looking to launch, as well as discuss any resources they would recommend to other entrepreneurs, artists & other self-employed professionals. This is just an opportunity to connect, communicate & hopefully collaborate with local like-minded people. If this meetup starts to take off, I would  hope we can open the floor for one member to do a presentation of an idea, event or project they want to get started. This is a format I saw into action at another meetup called Squared Off in Waltham hosted by Roy Krantz & Maureen Gilreath (link: http://www.meetup.com/squaredoff/) The idea is to go beyond just being a networking group, but also being a catalyst that can  cause a positive effect.
results.name: Mass Effect: Everett, Somerville & Charlestown Professionals

results.description:
Joining asians around to share ideas, have fun, eat out (dimsum, taiwanese dumpling, pho, thai food, sushi, and others), watch movies, and etc.

Where this going to lead us too? Fun, enjoying are selves, meeting new people around, and learn from each other.

Create meetups and share ideas.

If anyone is interested in helping out on the site, spell checking my writing, photographer for this site, great ideas or organizing meetups. Please email me. I need organizers to help me.

One guy can't make this all happen. Everyone pitching in and lend a hand.

Please have a photo of yourself on your profile and at less first name.

If your photo does not meet this criteria, your request to join the group will be declined.

There is a 24 hr cancellation policy in the group events. I know things happens. Just send me a email if you cant come to the event.

Thanks

--Willie Wong
results.name: Asian American Group

results.description: Weekly group activities
results.name: Beaverbrook STEP

results.description:
For women  who are in a serious relationship, married, or engaged and looking to make awesome new friends! It's hard to go out 3 - 4 times a week like our single friends, (although we love them), they are at a different stage in their lives. Besides, we've gotten accustomed to our daily routines with our partners. We kinda like curling up on the couch with a home cooked meal and watching movies -- isn't that what lazy Friday nights are for? We are in serious relationships, but still want to get out and mingle with a group of fabulous women once in while!

This group is for making new friends and enjoying: culture, dining, games, tasty food, nature, books, activities, movies, crafts, dancing and more.
results.name: Girls in a Relationship

results.description:
This is a great opportunity to meet nice people from the Brazilian community in the Greater Boston Area, to go dancing and join a lot of Brazilian and Latin cultural events!

You can also join us on Facebook: www.Facebook.com/HappyHeartsDanceSociety
results.name: Happy Hearts Dance Society of Boston - Meetup Group

results.description: ¡Hola a todos!  Somos un grupo de hispanohablantes que se reúne una vez al mes en Schoenhof’s Books en Cambridge para comentar un libro en español, charlar y en general pasarlo bien (normalmente acompañado de un poco de queso y vino también).  Leemos un poco de todo, desde Gabriel García Márquez hasta Borges y por supuesto que estamos abiertos a vuestras sugerencias. Somos una mezcla de gente de muchos países (España, Argentina, México, Colombia, Ecuador, EE.UU., etc.) así que todos sean bienvenidos… Nos reunimos en un grupo normalmente de entre 10 y 15 personas el tercer sábado de cada mes a las 12:30 de la tarde en Schoenhof’s Books.  Si quieres saber más, no dudes en contactarnos. Esperamos veros pronto! Saludos, Mark
results.name: Cambridge - Club de libro español

results.description:
SINGLES - CALLING ALL SINGLES - If you are single and looking to meet the RIGHT person to date - this is the Meetup group for you!!! 

Come go on 2 years worth of first dates in 1 night!!!  Our Meetup group is designed for you to meet with a bunch of singles in 1 night for fun "mini-dates."  This gives you a chance to meet one-on-one with a lot of different people in a fun, low-pressure, environment.  You select who you liked and want to see again for second dates!

We have events for singles in their 20's, 30's, 40's, and 50's.  Are you ready to go on a bunch of mini-dates in 1 night with other singles around your age??
results.name: BOSTON SPEED DATING FOR SINGLES

results.description: We are a Meetup that wants to provide friendship, events and fun for busy single professionals. We are open to singles of all ages who want to get together and participate in a variety of social events...and who knows, you just might meet that someone special!”
results.name: Boston Social Events for Single Professionals

Opportunities include TOT Shabbat Family Services, Dinner and Activities, Jewish holiday celebrations, Jumpstart Judaism - Shabbat music and fun!, parenting groups and classes, playground meet-ups, Pre-school Enrichment classes and more! Most activities are held at Temple Isaiah in Lexington and are open to all – members and those seeking a Jewish community.

Whether you're an absolute beginner learning the ropes or a business tycoon with the next billion dollar startup, you are welcome to come out to exchange ideas, network with each other, learn, and have a good time.
results.name: Business Model Generation Meetup

results.name: Avid Geo

results.description:
JUNTOS (Together) "The Leadership Encubator" is a group of energetic professionals whose mission is to grow personally, professionally, and intellectually by empowering ourselves and others to achieve financial freedom, to realize that by giving our highest gifts to the world, we can fulfill our most meaningful personal goals in life. Together we are making a difference in the community, Juntos is a partnership with School Districts, Real FIC Realty and Latin Management.

 

 

Come, join…This is a true opportunity to network, grow, serve, and even find true friends!

  

Together for         Yourself, Your family, Your community, Your country, Your world!
results.name: JUNTOS (Together) "The Leadership Encubator"

topics.name: Cross Mentoring with expert CEO business owners

results.description:
Do you have a product, service, project, dream or idea that could benefit others – or the world – if you could only put the right structure, funding, and resources in place to create it or get it to market faster?

CEO Space will speed up your efforts and deliver measurable results faster, easier, smarter and more reliably.  We guarantee it!

Across America local clubs introduce business owners, corporate executives, investors, inventors, speakers, and other professionals to the philosophy of CEO Space International.  All forums are currently held in Lake Las Vegas, NV 5 times per year.  Attend one, attend all! Work ON your business instead of IN it.

Never hear of CEO Space? You're not alone!  CEO Space is BIG on the West Coast, but only recently introduced here in New England.

Our local club Meetups are free and open to the public.  Their main purpose is to spread awareness and answer questions for potential members.  We also do one-on-one coaching calls with anyone interested in learning more about the organization but are too busy or otherwise unable to participate in the group introduction.

As a guest you are welcome to attend our local meeting up to 3 times to see if CEO Space is a good fit for you. If you decide to join CEO Space International, it is a lifetime membership.  You can attend Grad Weekend at the Forum as many times as you want for the rest of your business career for no additional charge. Also as a graduate you are a permanent member of CEO Space New England group and may visit any of our club meetings as often as you like.

CEO Space is NOT a weekly dog-eat-dog, competitive, must show up and bring referrals type of group. CEO Space focuses on replacing the failed model of competitive capitalism with the hypergrowth-inducing model of collaborative capitalism.  It's for entrepreneurs, business owners, corporate executives and venture capitalist to who want to take their business to the next level.

Guests are welcome from all New England locations, including greater Boston, Metro West, MA, NH, RI, etc.  New England meetings are primarily held in Manchester, NH and other locations by invitation.  If you would like a CEO Space guest speaker at your next event, give us a call to find out how.
results.name: CEO Space New England

results.description: For Corona SDK developers to get together and discuss mobile development and technology, Corona tips and tricks, and the Lua programming language. Experienced Corona developers and newcomers are equally welcome!
results.name: Corona SDK - Boston Meetup

results.description: Greater Boston offers enormous cultural opportunities to encounter everyday in our communities, work places, schools, and universities. This meetup group is to take advantage of such wide-ranging cultural environment and to explore our cultural diversity expressed in art, music, academic events, food, or just gather for fun to get to know each other with different cultural backgrounds. Anybody who is interested in exploring multi-cultural events happening in Boston and Cambridge are welcomed to join.
results.name: Boston Cultural Nomads

results.description: The Virtualization Group–Boston is a volunteer run, professional association, which exists in order to encourage an exchange of knowledge about all aspects of virtualization, green technology and cloud computing between IT Professionals. Furthermore, we will foster affiliation with similar virtualization groups located elsewhere to expand the reach of knowledge and training resources.
results.name: Virtualization Meetup Group–Boston

results.description: The Hindi Ke Bolnewale (=Speakers) Meetup Group meets in order to learn and use Hindi in conversation. Both native Hindi speakers and those who are learning Hindi are welcome! Join us for our next meeting.
results.name: Boston Ke Hindi Bolnewale

results.description: The Mix-Your-World Diversity Connection (previously called Mix-Your-World Interracial Connection) was formed to provide a comfortable setting for people of different races and cultures to come together for fun. How you view the group will be up to you. If you want it to be only about fun and friendship, we are cool with that. If you'd like it to be about dating, romance and relationships and you discover your "soul partner" or "un-soul partner" is a fellow member of the group, that's cool, too. We are not exclusive to black and white, but all races and cultures. Our meetups should always be open to people of all races and cultures, and should never be such that any person might feel uncomfortable attending for any reason.  We are about inclusion, not exclusion.
results.name: Mix-Your-World Diversity Connection

results.description:
This group is for those going through one of life's most difficult times. Divorce, separation, or the end of a significant relationship are devastating events - loneliness, fear, hopelessness and despair can seem overwhelming. These meetups are for mutual support with other people going through the same experience with a focus on healing, rebuilding, and moving forward constructively.

This group was founded to provide a support meetup for the Northern Middlesex/Southern NH area. When I found myself needing support there was not a Divorce/Separation group in this area so I decided to start one.
results.name: Moving On with Purpose - Divorce and Separation Support

results.description: Hand drumming is fun, healing, and deeply satisfying to our souls and spirits. I am a drum teacher and performer who has experienced the joy, power, and peace of drumming in groups for more than 15 years. A drum circle is a great way for us to share this experience together. In our gathering we will explore rhythm together including some teaching, some jamming, and some following the rhythms where they lead us. If you are interested in hand drumming, please join us. If you do not have a drum, drums will be available for you.
results.name: The Woburn Drum Circle

results.description:
Our Toastmasters Club meets on 1st and 3rd Saturdays of the month in Watertown, Massachusetts.  Please visit our club website at WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org for more information.

We are part of Toastmasters International.  For more information about our parent organization, visit Toastmasters.org.  Visitors are welcome to attend these meetings as guests for free. Talk to any club member about joining.
results.name: Watertown Saturday Toastmasters

results.description:
You spend your days being serious, responsible, professional. Maybe you have a stressful job, have bills to pay, have people who depend on you. BEING A GROWN-UP IS HARD WORK!! Every now and then, we need a play date - whether it be for just an hour or evening - to reconnect and relax.

"There's power in looking silly and not caring that you do." -- Amy Poehler

SILLY DATE! BOSTON is a good clean fun Meetup group in Boston/Cambridge for singles and their friends. Members are fun, friendly, independent and are interested in getting together to meet more people, make new friends, try different things, share some laughs, and cut loose in a laid-back and supportive environment.

There is no typical meetup. Our volunteer organizers post meetups based on their individual interests, but members can submit event ideas too.

Some past/sample events:

MUSEUMS (ICA, Museum of Fine Arts / MFA, MIT Museum) * STANDUP / IMPROV COMEDY (Joe Wong; Nick's Comedy Stop, Lizard Lounge, ImprovBoston, ImprovAsylum) * MOVIES/FILMS (Veronica Mars, The Muppets, Argo, Lincoln, Star Trek; Sundance Film Festival; Coolidge Corner Theater, Brattle Theater, Somerville Theater) * PICNICS (Public Garden/Boston Common, Hatch Shell) * THEATER AND PERFORMANCE (Shakespeare on the Common, National Theatre Live / NT Live) * DANCING (Contra Dancing, Swing Dancing) * SINGING (A cappella / ICCA Varsity Vocals, Sing-a-longs, Karaoke) * LIVE MUSIC (Dar Williams, Will Evans / The Sweet Remains; Berklee School of Music, Cafe 939, ICCA Acapella) * FOOD (Dim Sum, Cheap Eats, Ethnic Eats; Taiwan Cafe, Brown Sugar Cafe) * LOCAL FESTIVALS AND EVENTS (Craftboston, Blink / Christmas Tree Lighting, HONK! Festival) * TRAVEL/ DAY TRIPS / WEEKEND TRIPS (Harbor Islands, Beaches, Providence, New York City)

Events start with a rough plan, but once attendees arrive.... we improvise!

Sounds good?

JOIN AS MEMBER! To be a member, please submit a representative photo and tell us a little about your work/play/ shy/outgoing/ introvert/extrovert self and any silly/serious /quirky/geeky interests. Every new member is a future friend so we want to get to know you!

ATTEND A MEETUP! Check out our event calendar. Events with an 'EVENT HOST' are confirmed and someone has volunteered to be an Event Host i.e.contact point to manage communications and greet attendees. Events with a 'FYI ONLY' or 'TENTATIVE' are suggested on a "see ya there, maybe" basis until someone steps up as Event Host.

SUGGEST AN EVENT! Have an event you are planning to attend and looking for others to join you? Suggest it and offer to 'host' it! Being an Event Host is easier than it sounds and a great way to support groups, organizations, interests you care about, as well as a great way to meet more people and make new friends.

---------------------------------------------------------

MEMBER STUFF:

Members must be 21 years of age.

To foster friendly and supportive "non-scene" singles-friendly community, members agree to be respectful of each other. Behavior that makes others uncomfortable will not be tolerated. Bad behavior is reason for removal from group and includes:1) disparaging comments concerning age, race, sexual orientation, religion, politics, economic situation, 2) overtly sexual or aggressive advances toward another member, 3) expressions of extreme indecency, hatred, pornography, fetishism, criminality via group website, email, in person.

Members agree to be considerate and courteous to Event Hosts, who agree to lead on a non-paid volunteer basis. RSVPs of "Yes" should be honored. Same-day no-shows will not be tolerated and is reason for removal from group. Lateness and cancellations should be communicated to Event Host.

Members agree to participate in events at their own risk and will not hold Group Organizer(s) or Event Host(s) responsible for any incidents or damages.

To keep the group diverse and events as relaxed as possible, there is intentionally no fee to join and to RSVP, except when there is venue charge eg. museum admission, movie ticket, etc. However, should you enjoy your experience, please consider helping to defray our fixed Meetup costs (currently $144/yr) by using our Sponsors links when making purchases.
results.name: SILLY DATE! BOSTON

results.description:
This group is dedicated to getting people drawing and exploring their drawing mind in all different settings. Please join us to discover and explore your Drawing Mind. Each session will be held in a different location and is offered as either a one and a half hour session or a one and a half hour family drawing Scavenger Hunt or a three hour workshop.

The Drawing Mind is focused on enhancing and developing a process approach to drawing. To discovering your visual voice by drawing in a variety of new ways. The Drawing Mind team will help you develop your intuition, learn to see deeper and quiet your critical voices. During the class we will give you fun exercises to build your drawing mind. We will offer feedback and group critiques so you can look and share your drawings with others. You will see that by the end of the session you will approach drawing in new ways and have a more flexible pencil when embarking on the drawing process. Your Drawing Mind will be awakened.

 

Deb Putnoi
results.name: The Drawing Mind

results.description: The New England Netezza User Group(NENUG) is for Netezza users interested in meetings and discussions topic such as Netezza best practices and Netezza use-cases.   The Group will promote open communication between IBM’s Big Data Group and NENUG members concerning the Netezza appliance or the integration of the platform with other IBM products and services.
results.name: New England Netezza User Group

results.description:
Enjoy shaking off those clothes and being yourself amongst easy-going and fun-loving friends? How about a night-time skinny dip at a local swimming hole, or friends pool? A casual dinner, a card game, a cookout, body painting, massage, or just a few beers or refreshments? Naturism brings out the best side of people, and getting naked with friends is a wonderful exercise in shedding some of the shame that gets piled on by a judgmental and vain society. Don't think you look good naked? All the more reason to try it! Learn to be comfortable with your body with a group of liberal-minded friends with the same desire.

I formed this group as the sole Beacon Of Hope in the area, and as an experiment to see what happens. I don't have a huge place but I can host a small get-together or a cookout, and I have friends who I might convince to let me use their places; we'll start small, and hope for more venues! Besides, we're making friends in the meantime! "Build it and they will come!" Your sexuality is not important because this is not a hookup or sex group--just casual friendly nudity and light hearted fun and adventure in clothing-free social activities.

JOIN UP AND HELP ME CREATE SOMETHING DIFFERENT AROUND HERE!! NERVOUS? ME TOO, SO WHAT? LET'S DO THIS! YOUR IDEAS ARE WELCOME!

**$8 Annual Membership Dues are payable immediately after your 14 day free trial (you can enter your credit card at anytime). You will receive an email with the instructions.
results.name: Northeast Naturists

topics.name: Making Music on Electronic & Digital Keyboards

results.description: Always wanted to learn to play the piano, but haven't had the time or support? I will provide a small group setting and teach groups of three in 6 week sessions! I am an experienced pianist and educator and have a fun, innovative and improvisational style. Come join us!
results.name: Small Group Piano Lessons

results.description:
Non-religious, Christian, 25 and older, Urban Christian Society is a group for people mid-twenties to late thirties, and older (aka forever 29). By joining this meetup group, members can organize their own independent meets and network with others who are part of the Society.  (Formally known as quarter life society. There was often confusion about quarter life society being primarily a college group, so we changed the name.)

Events are real life verses "church" events. People do not need to be "christians" to attend. Most events will be alcohol, dog and child friendly (people to use their own gage for whats appropriate, feel free to ask if it's not obvious: ex. "will the hike be doable for a 5 year old?" etc.)

Our goal is for people to share their lives here. Example: if planning to attend a holiday parade, post it as an event. Going running regularly with fido? post it.. etc. etc. The vision is to intersect lives and have a nice structure to build relationships as a part of our ongoing lives verses creating a "sub-church" community that becomes an added commitment on top of life.

Do what you love and find others who love doing it too. The vibe is laid back and relaxed.
results.name: Urban Christian Society  (25 and older)

results.description:
Ultimate LOVE and Passion (ULP for short) is a community of like-minded individuals creating friendships and relationships that stand the test of time. Using principles from top authors, trainers and coaches we can ALL learn to have fun, playful, passionate relationships with the right person.

Have you tried all those "other" dating sites?

Do your friends try to set you up on blind dates?

Have you been in relationships where you just don't have that "spark" everyone talks about?

Are you on a journey of self growth but don't know where to find others for support?

If you answered "YES" to any of these questions ULP could be the perfect fit for you!

Who should join ULP?

- Someone that is NOT in a current relationship (SINGLE).

- Someone involved in personal/professional growth and development.

- Someone who is seeking an ideal and committed relationship/friendship.

- Someone who wants to learn how to have an ideal relationship.

- Someone who likes to have fun, socialize and meet new people.

When applying for membership please complete the following:

1. All of the required profile questions to the best of your ability.

2. Upload a CURRENT picture of yourself (preferably a headshot).

If your profile is not complete we will contact you for further information and may deny your membership request.

Ultimate LOVE and Passion is where singles who set a higher standard connect!
results.name: Ultimate Love and Passion - Boston

results.description:
If you've ever wanted to learn how to take better photos, but you don't want to get bogged down with all the technical stuff, then you're going to love this. This unique meetup group is for you if:

    You own a camera (or smart phone with a camera) and you'd really like to use it more, but you're not really sure where to start and what to do. Perhaps you are ready to take that camera off the auto setting?

    Maybe you've taken a photography workshop before or tried picking up one of those thick, boring books, but you quickly got overwhelmed and overloaded with the technical stuff.

    You don't intend on becoming a "master photographer", but you'd like to learn how to take better pictures of things you find interesting. That could be nature, people, landscape, architecture, etc. Whatever you feel drawn to. We are a learning group and each class builds specific skills to improve your photography.

    You would like to explore related topics like creative photography and mindfulness? This unique approach encourages you to slow down, take fewer photos of higher quality by experiencing the beauty of your life.

And the best part? The techniques you'll learn will have an immediate impact on your photography. You'll see an instant improvement and you'll also have an opportunity to get positive and constructive feedback for your work in a supportive environment.

If that sounds good to you, then I invite you to join our group. You'll learn a lot, meet some warm and wonderful people, and have lots of fun while you improve your photography. I'm looking forward to meeting you in person soon.

All I ask is PLEASE INCLUDE A REAL PICTURE OF YOUR FACE for your profile description when you join us. I can't find you in a crowd when we meetup if you use a photo of your cat. 

You can get started learning some of the practices by exploring my new book.

Flow-tography Take Better Pictures.

http://itunes.apple.com/us/book/flow-tography-better-photos/id499049037?mt=11&uo=4


Warmly,
Suzanne
results.name: Take Better Pictures - Non-Technical Photography Workshops

results.description:
The practice of meditation can transform your life and empower you.  It assists you in getting to know and accept yourself.  This is the key to true health and happiness - connecting with who you really are.  The purpose of this group is to create a safe and nurturing environment to learn about and practice various forms of meditation, including but not limited to guided meditation and chakra healing meditation.  All levels are welcome.  I am also an energy healer and will bring healing energy into the environment to enhance the positive experience.  Whether you are looking to relax or something more, this group has something for you.  Come, relax, and enjoy!

For those who want to learn more about energy healing, I also offer Integrated Energy Therapy (IET) Certification classes and other workshops related to working with and connecting with angels.
results.name: All is Well - For Body, Mind & Spirit

results.description:
We started this group to help form a connection for Jewish and Interfaith Families, in and around Burlington, MA. We hope to have active and social members, who are interested in or are exploring raising their children in the Jewish faith. We welcome families with children of all ages.  Member ideas, suggestions, and participation will be an integral part of what makes this group successful!

*This group will be private.  In order to protect ourselves and our children, we require that you submit a small introduction about yourself, a photo, and answer a few simple profile questions in order to become a member and have full access to our website.
results.name: Jewish & Interfaith Families In and Around Burlington

results.description:
GET SOCIAL IN BOSTON!

So you're looking for something to do in Boston… You're looking for great events… You're looking to meet new people and make new friends... You're also open to new ideas and trying new things...

WHAT IS SOCIAL IN BOSTON?

Social In Boston is a group organized through the Meetup platform. If you are unfamiliar with Meetup, just think of it as the opposite of Facebook. Facebook is for everyone you already know in real life to connect with you online, whereas Meetup is for a bunch of people you don't know to sign up for an event online and meet up in real life. :)

1. SIB Is A Social Network of Friendly People...

Social In Boston is a social network of friendly people. If your social network has dried up; If you're out of college and your friends have moved on; If your friends are all married; If you and your significant other are looking for to get out there together; If you're new to the city and haven't made any friends yet; If you've never had many friends at all. Whatever it is, you'll find it here. :)

2. SIB Is Also A Fun Activities Group...

We are fun activities group! All of our events take place in public venues, and you are even welcome to bring a friend if it helps you get comfortable. Activities we do include bowling, billiards, social mixers, ice skating, snow tubing, dodgeball, live music shows, museums, dinners, and many more. Many events are free, some events have a small fee, usually $5 to $10. Once in a while we'll have a more expensive event.

There are many large events where the age range is anywhere from 20's to early 40's, it's always a mix and they are always different.

Check out the reviews members of Social In Boston have left and watch the slideshow of photos from our events.

Social In Boston Group Rules:

1. RSVP RESPONSIBLY

Your RSVP is your word that you will show up. Please RSVP only when you know you can make it and remember to keep your RSVP up to date if your plans to attend happen to change.

Reasons for this include other members counting on you to show up, showing respect for the organizers efforts, and even the amount of food that gets made for certain events.

2. PROFILE PHOTOS ARE REQUIRED

Social In Boston only accepts members with clear photo's of their face set as the main photo in their profile. This must be maintained for the duration of your membership. Requests to join from people without proper photo's will be deleted. Photos are required so we know who you are at events and also to cut down on the amount of spam accounts that try to infiltrate the group.

3. DON'T SPAM THE GROUP

The group is set to filter applicants to prevent the unscrupulous spamming of our members by people that are too lazy to do the real work required to find clients or promote their businesses to.
results.name: 💥 Amazing Social In Boston

results.description:
Please join our Facebook group, as INunDATE will continue, but not via the Meetup page.

http://www.facebook.com/INunDATEBOSTON

"Like" our page and share it with your friends. We'll start up again after the holidays!

 

Tip back a few drinks and skip the "are you available?" shuffle. The beer is real, and so are the people. RSVP for an event, and we’ll announce the exact location the DAY OF the event, so stay tuned. Pay for what you imbibe, the mingling is on us!

 

The spirit of this group is to remain casual and open, but in light of several inquiries about age limitations we think 30-55 makes the most sense, based on the founders' ages, expected attendees, and venues. If you fall slightly out of this range, please do not be deterred from joining us as we know age is not the only thing that defines us.
results.name: INunDATE BOSTON

results.description:
The Gurdjieff Society of Massachusetts is an affiliate of the Gurdjieff Foundation of New York. The Society is nonsectarian and nondenominational, and its membership is composed of individuals of diverse backgrounds. The aims of the Society are: to preserve the ideas and methods of the noted spiritual teacher George Ivanovich Gurdjieff, to explore what their practice requires in today's world, to maintain a community of seekers that welcomes new members who share these interests, and to contribute to society's understanding of the human condition, both the great promise and the great peril.

_________________________________________________________________________________________

For more information, please visit our website at www.gurdjieffsocietymass.org or contact us at info@gurdjieffsocietymass.org.
results.name: The Gurdjieff Society of Massachusetts

results.description: The Sacred Fire Community sponsors monthly community fires in six countries around the world. We create opportunities for heart-felt connection and community in a time of isolation and disconnection from each other and nature. The fires are open to people from all walks of life and all traditions, or none.  The fires are family-friendly and open to people of all ages.  Sitting in the sacred space that Fire provides, we share our lives, our stories, our gifts, and receive the respectful support of community. Whether quiet and contemplative, emotional and challenging, or raucous and irreverent, each time around the Fire provides many opportunities for us to open to the transformation and wisdom of our hearts. Stories and music, laughter and jokes, connection and conflict are shared and embraced. Over time, the gifts of Fire unfold in our lives. For more information about the Sacred Fire Community and locations of other SFC Community Fires, please visit www.sacredfirecommunity.org.
results.name: Sacred Fire Community

results.description:
Boston is such an active city. You want to join the jog mob, but you don't know anyone with a similar schedule. You've been thinking of joining the gym, but the other attendees are intimidating and your iPod just isn't comforting enough. You want to try hiking or a new dance class, but don't know anyone with a decent combination of humor and a sense of adventure.

This group is for everyone that wants to try new and unique activities. Our events are planned and suggested by members and can be executed in small or large groups. Rarely do the events require money! There are a crazy amount of classes offered around Boston for ***FREE***. Let's take advantage of them together :)

This group is for anyone who wants to get up and move, while meeting fun, like-minded people. My hope for Boston Social Fitness is for you to use it as a forum to organize physical activities that will be fun and encourage you to moooove and connect. See you soon!

 

*Please note: This group requires a clear, current self-photo, as well as your first name, or an equivalent that you go by daily. Example; Jay instead of Jason or Tina instead of Christina, etc.
results.name: Boston Social Fitness (B.SoFit)

results.description:
Engineers are some of the most powerful people in the world. They have native intelligence, talent in mathematics and science and are responsible for numerous major technological advances. They not only possess knowledge of theory, but also how to apply that theory to real world problem solving and the creation of marvelous inventions. It’s unfortunate that they are so often unsung heroes.

Entrepreneurs, on the other hand, are often broad brushed as near mythical, larger-than-life, demi-gods. We live in an unprecedented time in history. The world economic crisis has many questioning their ability to survive. In a rare move, both democrats and republicans agreed on the JOBS (Jumpstart Our Business Startups) act and the president signed the bill in April to pave the way for new startups to more easily access financing.

There comes a point in some engineers’ careers when thoughts turn to having a more important role in society. They’d like to make a contribution and do work that has more meaning. The thoughts of others turn to starting their own business, they want to be their own boss, control their own destiny. Perhaps all they desire is a way to perform work using a broader range of their talents instead a narrowly defined skill set. At this unprecedented time in US history however, one can both start their own business and do a great service to their country by employing some of the 40 million that have lost their jobs.

Engineering Entrepreneur is a group for engineers who either are or would like to be either self-employed or business owners capable of employing others. With a background in counseling, engineering and entrepreneurship, I decided to start this group to provide opportunities to engineers interested in entrepreneurship. It is my hope, that through a collaborative effort, we can find greater satisfaction in our careers, a more meaningful lifestyle, and greater prosperity for all. Join us!
results.name: Engineering Entrepreneur

results.description:
At the "Symposium on Water Innovation in Massachusetts" on May 8, 2012, the state's water cluster convened for the first-time ever, beginning an effort to make Massachusetts the global innovation leader in this $500b industry.

The Massachusetts Water Industry Meetup enables key stakeholders -- entrepreneurs, investors, academic researchers, government officials and service providers -- to meet and exchange ideas about Massachusetts's water cluster and how to make Massachusetts the global innovation leader in the $500 billion water industry.
results.name: Massachusetts Water Industry

results.description:
If you're a woman over (or fast approaching) 50 who is eager to explore the possibilities of this new phase of life and create your best years yet, then you're going to like this. This unique meetup group is for you if:

  • You'd like to meet new friends who are also eager to explore and create this new phase of their lives.
  • You feel "stuck" in some old patterns, and would like some real-world solutions to move beyond them and live the life you were meant to live.
  • You're sick and tired of the mixed messages that the media are sending you as an older woman: Oprah extols you but everyone is trying to convince you that you should always want to look years younger than you are.  (Botox is a "girl's" best friend.)  You refuse to believe that women over 50 are less valuable than our younger counterparts in society.
  • Your kids are already out of the house (or that is coming soon), and you're not sure what to do with yourself and that feeling of restlessness you have.
  • You're dealing with any other changes or transitions in your life.

This is an educational group about learning how to really, fully live this new part of our lives.  I'll share what I've learned over the years with you, and you'll have a chance to do the same. Together we'll support each other in creating rich lives that support all aspects of our being -- physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual -- and have a lot of fun in the process.

If that sounds good to you, then I invite you to join our group. You'll learn a lot, meet some warm and wonderful women, and have lots of fun while you learn how to move past old patterns that aren't working anymore. I'm looking forward to meeting you in person soon.

Warmly,
Phoebe
results.name: Embracing Your Power and Passion after 50

results.description:
The Fifth Commandment

"You shall not kill."

The purpose of this group is to organize against the Massachusetts ballot question (November 2012) which seeks to legalize assisted suicide. Catholics and others in the Boston area who want to stop the new law are encouraged to join this independent grassroots effort. We speak only for ourselves. We will emphasize the Fifth Commandment and the Natural Law as the foundation of our opposition to state-sanctioned self-murder.

We will communicate by email and raise an alarm about the dangers of the proposed law by leafleting, writing articles and letters, rallies, marches, teach-ins, debates, etc. The more people who join the more we can do, so spread the word. We don't have much time so let's get started.

It is not necessary to write an introduction or post a photo to become a member, however this is not a debating society and people who support so-called "death with dignity" will be politely asked to take their arguments elsewhere.

LEARN MORE.

 

Suicide is always failure ... and failure is not an option.

 

 

The Good Samaritan

by Tissot
results.name: The Fifth Commandment

results.description:
Welcome to South Shore Moms and Caregivers

Our group is an offline community of mothers and caregivers with the shared priorities of safety, fun, service, and support. We strive to make our group an inclusive, safe and friendly place where we and our children can come together to play and learn, share the common experience of parenthood, and support the neighborhoods in which we live.

Our goal for the group is to make lasting friendships for ourselves and our kids. To accomplish this, we need to get to know each other. The best way to make friends in this group is to attend or suggest events.

New Members

We welcome those who want to be active members. By active, we specifically mean attending at least one event every 3 months (which includes anything on our calendar). All members can suggest/post events to our calendar.

Moms and caregivers of all ages are welcome. Although we have children of all ages in our group, we primarily meet on weekdays during the day. Working moms and moms of school aged kids can meetup with us for our mom’s night outs or weekend family events, but they are sporadic.

New Member Guidelines
To be approved as a member, you must:

  • Complete your profile and post a recent picture of yourself as your main picture on your profile. For the safety of the group, and so we can find you at meetups, we need to see your pretty face!
  • Thoroughly answer group questions. We want to get to know you!
  • Attend one meetup within 30 days of joining the group, or you may be removed from the group. If you don't see a meetup you can attend, suggest one! This rule is for the safety of all our members and it will be strictly enforced.
  • Once you have joined the group, make sure you are subscribed to organizer messages. That's the only we have to contact the whole group about announcements and changes.

Current Members

We have made some changes to increase safety and participation in the group. One of the changes is to be "verified" which means you have met one of our organizers personally. If you are not "verified" you may not be able to attend certain private meetups so please make sure you meet with one of our organizers as soon as possible. If you have met with an organizer and it doesn't say "verified" under your name, please let us know so we can adjust your status.

Your participation is vital to keep this group going!

  • This is a meetup group. All members must be active. Being active means attending at least one event every 3 months. As mothers, we understand that some circumstances (e.g. illness, travel, birth, etc.) do not always allow active participation, and Organizers will make exceptions to this rule on a case-by-case basis. If you are going to be inactive for over 3 months, please let an Organizer know.
  • If we find that someone is not active based on the above criteria, the person will be warned once and then removed from the group if activity doesn’t pick up.

Members due

There is a $6 non-refundable annual fee that is used to cover Meetup cost, encourage more engaged members, snacks for playgroups, organizers meetings and the Helping Moms group.

Playdates

There are a lot of us, so we encourage you to host/attend playdates throughout the South Shore. You can host/attend playdates at parks, museums, the zoo, the beach, playgrounds, really anywhere you think we can have some fun! If you would like to host a playdate at your home, please e-mail your address only to the people who RSVPed "Yes" to it.

If you would like to attend a playdate at someone's house only RSVP for it if you have already met the hostess at a previous Meetup, and please be courteous if you can't make it and let the hostess know as soon as possible. We know that life happens! As moms we all understand that unforeseen events come up. If you are going to be late, please call/email the hostess to let her know.

The Fine Print - Read Before Applying

  • Please fill out the profile questions when you apply. No profiles with any blank questions will be approved.
  • Give us a great introduction. The introduction you write will be seen by all of our members when they log onto our site. So, tell us about yourself! Bare introductions will not be approved. Introductions should have more than your name, child's name, and hello in order to be approved. 
  • You must have a recent picture of yourself as your main profile picture in order to join. This is to help ensure the safety and comfort of all. No applications will be accepted without a picture.
  • Though we love to support each other, please do not join this group with the intent to sell to us. Business Meetups are not okay. If you'd like to host a playdate or do a free class/demo to the moms or kids that's fine.
  • The entire purpose of this group is to meet other moms/caregivers. For security reasons all new members must attend an event within their first 30 days as a member. If there isn't an event that you can come to, suggest one! Exceptions will be made for those moving to the area. If you will not be able to attend an event in your first 30 days, please let the organizer know why.
  • By applying to this group, you acknowledge and agree that your safety, and the safety of anyone that attends events with you, including your children is your sole responsibility. You understand and agree that you will not hold the group or any organizers responsible for your safety and well being.
  • By applying for this group, you acknowledge that there will be people taking pictures at our events, and you give permission for those pictures to be used on the group website, and for group purposes.
  • You understand that anyone found not adhering to our policies may be removed from the group at any time at an organizer's discretion.
results.name: South Shore Moms and Caregivers

results.description:
Massa/tchoukball is a group dedicated to learning and playing the fun, non-contact, co-ed sport of tchoukball. Tchoukball is a  fast paced non-contact ball sport that can be played on any surface using two pitchback trampolines.

Tchoukball is easy to learn and very fun. What makes tchoukball different is that the team with the ball may go in any direction, not just one team going east and one team going west, and the defending team may not guard the team on offense or interfere with play. Tchoukball is extremely unique and easy to learn after five minutes.

Playing tchoukball requires the purchase of no equipment. It's akin to playing a gym class game. If you miss random games designed for gym class, tchoukball could be for you.  In tchoukball you need to be able to throw and catch a ball the size of a kick ball but with the consistency of a volleyball. 

Ultimate frisbee players, volleyball players, soccer and basketball players may find this sport fun.

As we are one of the few tchoukball leagues in the United States, we have been invited to represent the USA in international competition. If you've ever dreamed of wearing USA on the front of your jersey, please try this out.
results.name: Massa-tchoukball

results.description:
We are a collection of happy geeks! We are people who are into anime, fantasy, sci fi, video games, tabletop gaming, manga, comic books, and more. Mostly we just like to get together and have fun! We have anime nights, gaming nights, movie nights, costume parties, etc. and do public events such as conventions, Renaissance Faires, museums and picnics. If you live in the MetroWest/Greater Boston area and want to meet people with similar interests, then join our group and come to an event!

Check us out on Facebook! www.facebook.com/HappyGeeks

Group Rules:

Be respectful and courteous of your fellow group members. This includes using polite behavior as well as exercising proper hygiene :).

Please note that we are not a singles group! Of course, it is inevitable people will meet and fall in love in this group, but we are primarily here to make friends and share activities and interests with each other. Please don't expect to meet your soul mate or "hook up" with people. Treat everyone, regardless of gender or relationship status, with respect!

Only RSVP to an event if you are able to attend. Three "no shows" will get you removed from the group. Telling someone in advance that you will not be able to make it will not count against you.

Please read event descriptions carefully! If an event host says to bring food, drink or cash to pitch in, you are expected to follow through.

We only accept members who are 21+. The age range for our meetup members is 20's and 30's. If we discover that you are not 21, you may be removed from the group.

All members are required to have one personal photo (a picture of their face) in their profile photo file. We will turn down applications with no picture or pictures with non-visible faces.

You're expected to have a name that you go by as part of your meetup profile. This is for safety purposes as well as to help event organizers mark your attendance correctly. A first name or nickname is fine.

You're expected to remain active in the meetup group. This means you should visit the page at least once per month or so to check out what events we've got going on. We will remove any members who have been inactive for 6 months.

A part of being in the meetup group is receiving communications from organizers. These are typically important updates and you are expected to read them. If you feel you are getting too many e-mails from Meetup itself, you may adjust your e-mail settings on the meetup page (this is not something that we can control).

You can e-mail me at any point through the e-mail on my profile page.

topics.name: Social Group for Singles 45 and Older

results.description:
Welcome to North of Boston Jewish Singles (NOBJS). Our membership is open to all Jewish single adults who are 45 or over.

We are not a dating service but we are a great place to meet interesting, charming and enthusiastic single people with whom you can get together and have fun. If you are widowed, divorced, or never married, we invite you to join our activities.

We are located in the Merrimack Valley, about 25 miles North of Boston. Our membership comes from all over the greater Boston area- from Randolph on the South Shore to Worcester in the West and Concord, NH to the North.

NOBJS presents a variety of events each month that are meant to appeal to our members and to Jewish singles in the community. Naturally, most of these activities include food.

Each month, on a Sunday morning, we have a coffee and bagel schmooze in Andover.

Some of our other events have included a Chanukah parties, concerts at Merrimack College, super bowl parties, harbor cruises, and of course, dining out at various restaurants.

results.description:
Boston is the greatest city in America for rowing, and it's a pretty good place to be gay. So where are all the LGBT rowers? I want to start a meetup group that will let us meet and socialize without making people commit to being part of a boat that has an ongoing practice schedule.

So this meetup is starting out as a SOCIAL group. This is NOT a learn-to-row group, and it is NOT being organized to line up nine people to go out in a boat. Maybe later, but just now right now.

For people who have gotten in touch with us because you want to learn to row, first of all: Hooray for you! You're going to love it. Then, what you should do is to get in touch with either Community Rowing or Boston University. They both have great learn-to-row programs, and you'll be out on the water in no time this summer. Here's their URL's:

https://www.communityrowing.org/signup/new-to-rowing/

http://www.bu.edu/fitrec/programs/noncredit/rowing.shtml

Some background on me: I rowed freshman and intramural crew at Harvard, and now I'm rowing a single out of Community Rowing. But I travel a lot for work, and so being part of an eight just wouldn't work for me. Just the same, I could imagine going out on the water every now and then in a pick-up boat, perhaps with adult supervision from a coach at one of the boathouses. And for the scullers among us, it would be nice to connect with other people to go out on the water with, either in singles or in doubles.

IN SUMMARY: if your experience with rowing involves being on the water, and when you're inside you refer to those godawful contraptions as "ergs" and not as "rowing machines", then you're somebody who should join this group. There are hundreds of us LGBT rowers out there in the Boston area -- we're just waiting to finally meet each other.
results.name: Boston Gay Rowers

The agile marketing community includes; practicing agile marketers, marketers new to the concept—who are curious about using agile marketing, and members of the agile development community.

Interested in speaking, contact John Cass at genejohncass@gmail.com or 339 368 1955, we are looking for speakers on the topics of agile, digital transformation, customer journey mapping, marketing technologies, customer experience, CDO's and more.

results.description:
Join with confidence. I’m a founder/organizer and event organizer of many other groups with a direct network of over 10,000 members!

Welcome to Boston's best and largest Meetup group for 30-Somethings!

Code of conduct:
