results.description:
Idealists & Rationals of Boston

Would you rather talk about concepts and ideas than the latest movies, trends, and small talk? Do you desire either a strong intellectual or emotional connection - or both - with the friends that you meet? This group was created for you! Typical Topics of Discussion Include:

• Ethics, philosophy, education, politics, current events, science, and More!!

Idealists are: passionate, personable, desire an emotional connection, abstract thinkers, dreamers, subjective, imaginitive, inventive, empathetic, concerned with saying the right thing at the right time to inspire or build someone up, warm, and focused on how systems directly help people. Rationals are: logical, objective, desire an intellectual connection, abstract thinkers, inventive, brutally honest, telling it like it is as a way to give constructive criticism so that methods can be improved, and focused on the systems themselves.

Rationals are: logical, objective, desire an intellectual connection, abstract thinkers, inventive, brutally honest, telling it like it is as a way to give constructive criticism so that methods can be improved, and focused on the systems themselves.

We have only 4 Basic Rules of the Group. They are below...

Group Rules

1. Be respectful of all beliefs, opinions, and perspectives. No bullying or manipulating to get someone to conform to your belief or view. State your belief & if your arguments are well put together someone is likely to embrace part or all of your views . Allow them to present their views in similar fashion & stay open-minded. When they present a valid point admit it. Be humbled enough to edit & alter your own views when someone presents something convincing.

2. Arguments & Disagreements are an essential part of this group. Someone does not hate you if they disagree. Keep the focus away from person & onto the issue itself.

3. No rambling; keep the discussion moving & give others a chance to talk. This is not a monologue but a discussion. If you desire to present on a topic that can be the time for your monologue.

4. Because of negative past experiences, we do not encourage political arguments to take over the topic at hand. If we decide to schedule a specific political issue, it will be clearly stated ahead of time, with clear guidelines that every participants will have to adhere to.
results.name: Idealists and Rationals of Boston

results.description:
Boston is a great city but after having lived here for some time I've come to realize most people don't get out and explore beyond their own neighborhoods. Every neighborhood in Boston though has something neat about it though so I started this group as a way for proper Bostonians to meet other proper Bostonians from other neighborhoods who have settled here too. This group is for people who like living in urban environments and call Boston their home. From East Boston to West Roxbury, the North End to the South End, Roxbury to Roslindale, everybody in Boston is welcome. I can't forget about the near by cities either- that's you Cambridge, Somerville, Chelsea, and Brookline.

We do events in all the Boston area neighborhoods but especially focus on Boston city proper. I have a talent for finding local festivals, free concerts, and nice parks to visit. I also lead walks around different neighborhoods I've researched the history on myself. In addition there are plenty of weeknight game, pub trivia, and lectures around town.

Group Rules: I put a lot of work in to the meetup group and I've very serious about creating a community here. The theme of this community is cities, urban issues, and exploring our neighborhoods. To be successful in creating that community the group must have rules. Here are the rules:

#1 - The group is primarily intended to be for people who have settled in the city. Let's face it - Boston is a pretty transient place so people who actually decide to settle in Boston are a pretty small bunch on meetup. The intention of this group is to be a way for those people to meet. Therefore the primary audience is not people just visiting Boston, here temporarily, or from the suburbs. There are many other new to Boston and groups for general audiences but that is not this group.

#2 This group is not for people who want to anonymous. It doesn't make for a friendly meeting up experience without knowing who you're meeting up with. To that end it is required you use your real first name in your profile and a recognizable picture is required to join and stay. I'd also encourage you to fill out the profile with something interesting about yourself.

#3 Three no shows and you're out. I put a lot of work in making events work so I ask members to put some effort in to actually showing up. I take attendance at events and if you show a pattern of not showing up you'll be removed from the group.

#4 Please check the site every 6 months. I very purposefully am trying to keep this group small and active. The only way to keep it small is to remove "dead" profiles. If you don't visit the site every 6 months you'll get an email with some instructions on next steps.
results.name: Boston Neighborhood Explorers

results.description:
Beautiful blessed snow! Hope everyone is keeping warm, healthy and in good spirits!

This group is to facilitate the ever-growing community of people who are living a Heart centered life and like to grow spiritually. It is open to everyone and dedicated to share and provide a space where others may come to share and learn more about Reiki, Kundalini, and Heart meditation.

I actually live in Bethesda, MD but my daughter just had my first grandchild and she lives in Boston so I will be spending lots of time in this area..  Baby is now 1 year old :)

The intention is to meet at least once a month for Open Heart Meditation & Reiki Tummo Healing sessions.... and will also offer Open Heart and Reiki Tummo workshops twice a year.

Reiki TUMMO is a technique that developed independently and goes beyond healing to assist you in your spiritual growth. As Divine and Kundalini energy begin working in synergy, a deeper and gentler acceleration of cleansing and spiritual development occurs helping us to be better connected to our hearts as well as to start feeling and being more aware. In Reiki TUMMO, Spiritual progress is based on learning to use your heart more in your daily life and opening your heart for true insight and understanding.

Through a series of gentle steps and courses, Reiki Tummo prepares the foundations to support your continuing spiritual growth and development. So come along and be prepared to smile, relax, and experience the sweet feelings of Love radiating from within your Heart :-)

You can learn more about Reiki-Tummo at:  http://www.reikitummo.com

Open Heart Meditation workshops are  offered 2 or 3 times a year as well as day-long Reiki Tummo workshops.   REIKI TUMMO WORKSHOPS IN BOSTON: October. 2013.

You can learn more about what we call the spiritual heart by clicking on the link below.  There are also free open heart meditations that you can download to do on your own :)

To learn more about the Open Heart Meditation, go to: http://www.openheartmeditation.org/

The spiritual Heart is our connection to the Divine.... and the very foundation of Reiki Tummo & Open Heart Meditation, so come along and be prepared to smile, relax, and experience the sweet feelings of Love in your Heart :-)

WLL
Martha Luz (TaluzA)

For more information about Open Heart Meditation & Reiki Tummo, please visit:

Do you like coffee? Do you like spending hours in coffee shops? Do you like discussing life with people? This group is for you!

This is not some large "mix and mingle" group. We meet in small venues with limited seating, so we place low caps on RSVPs. For this reason, we enforce our RVSP policy. If you RSVP, you are expected to attend. Again, an RSVP of yes does not mean "maybe" or "that looks cool." It means "I will attend." Please observe our policy and only RSVP if you certainly will attend. Also please do not "crash" events if you did not make the list. If you repeatedly no-show or show up uninvited, you will be removed from the group, as inaccurate RSVP counts create hassles for our hosts and organizers.

Why do we ask for a profile photo? Because we like to know who you are to help keep that "lost Meetup look" down to a minimum when you first show up. ;)

And yes, tea drinkers are kindly welcome to join the group.

results.description:
Although this Meetup Group was founded in 2012, the class began in January 2000 and for most of its history has met twice per week. Our 1,000th class was on 10 March 2011.


 Our purpose is to improve our health and also make friends. We provide a safe environment where men can gain the physical benefits of yoga (strength, balance, focus, calmness, better blood circulation) and the  social benefits of a friendly, encouraging community of men.  



We get naked. We practice yoga. We don't care if you are young or old, straight or gay, black or white, sculpted or sagging. We welcome students of all levels, including beginners. We take pride in our respectful, supportive, and friendly but non-cruisy atmosphere. We are refreshingly free of “attitude”. Class duration is 90 minutes.

Due to the nature of our class, we are careful about whom we invite to our studio. If you are accustomed to other Meetup groups where anonymous people are invited as casually as if the event were a frisbee toss in the park, have patience. We provide a safe environment because of our intentions and the fact that we screen first-timers before inviting them.

1) You will need to send a direct email via Comcast (NOT via Meetup) to Bobby, the founder/organizer, who will then reply with introductory messages (too long to include here). 

First use

yoga4men@comcast.net

If no reply within a reasonable time, you may try

default.catchall@here-and-now.com

 2) Although you are free to use a different name in class, you must provide your real name to the instructors and the two organizers. Your full name is not absolutely necessary for your first message to Bobby, but is needed to proceed further. Your nickname or screen handle is not an acceptable substitute. You must be prepared to show valid identification at your first class.

3)  You must read and agree to the rules.

 



About this Naked Yoga Class - The Rules


1) This group is for men only. This is one of the attributes that make it unique.


2) This group is open to all men regardless of sexual orientation. It is not about sex, cruising or voyeurism. Members are free to disclose or hide their sexual orientation. Members do not assume that any other member is gay or is available for any relationship outside class.


3) During class, members do their best to concentrate on their breathing, posture or other aspects of the exercise. Looking at someone in order to understand the pose while exercising is OK; sitting back and staring is not. Those who find themselves unable to keep up with the exercises are asked to go into a rest pose rather than watching the class.


4) Members who feel attracted to others in the class do their best not to make it obvious to anyone during class. Members are expected to be equally friendly and helpful to all others in the class, regardless of any erotic attraction, or lack thereof. Spontaneous erections, if they occur, are treated as natural, involuntary and unremarkable and not taken personally; we simply continue our exercise without comment. What we wouldn't like is any deliberate erotic gesture or intentional distraction from the purpose of the class.


5) Those whose bodies are far from ideal are just as welcome as anyone else. We are in this group to improve ourselves and help each other. We respect any man who shows up and works at the exercises, no matter how he looks to us today. When we choose partners for stretching or other exercises, our ideal is to spend our time equally with all other possible partners.We do not favor or disfavor anyone based on age or looks. Please note: We do partner work only in infrequent special sessions, always announced in advance. In our regular classes we have no occasion to touch each other.


6) We respect the owners, manager and other users of the space we are in.  and the privacy of the class. Drop-ins and guests must at least speak with a class member prior to class time before being invited to join us. We will not disclose the specific location of the studio except to those who understand and accept our philosophy. If anyone else asks us where we meet, it is OK to say "a dance studio in Central Square" but nothing more specific than that.


7) Naturist etiquette applies. Among other things, this means:



a) We stay within established nude areas.

b) We respect the rights and property of others

c) No photos without prior permission.



8) This is a naked class. The only exception is for the instructor.


9) You are responsible for your own safety. It is up to you to know your limitations and make sure you don't injure yourself. In particular, if you have conditions such as glaucoma or high blood pressure, you should avoid inverted poses. If unsure, consult your doctor before attending this class.
results.name: Naked Yoga for Men (Cambridge, MA)

results.description:
Are you a Mom living in Stoughton, Randolph or Avon, MA?

The MOMS (Moms Offering Moms Support) Club® of Stoughton, MA is a wonderful way to meet other moms right here in your community. We are moms who agree that raising our children is the most important job we will ever have.

We are new moms and experienced moms, moms who understand what you are going through…and the best part is we are moms who live right down the street from you!

The MOMS Club® of Stoughton, MA provides many resources and activities for moms and their kids, including:
• Playgroups for babies, toddlers, and preschoolers
• Meetups at playgrounds or area attractions
• Weekly playtime at YMCA Soft Play-space
• Monthly daytime member socials for moms and kids at various local venues
• Community service projects
• Monthly Moms' Night Out
• Discussion forums
• And more! All members are encouraged to schedule events and activities.

The dues are $25.00 annually*, which provides you with access to member functions and our e-community. The MOMS Club® of Stoughton, MA is a 501(C)(3) charity. The majority of our proceeds goes to local charities that benefit children and families.

We are a chapter of the International MOMS Club (www.momsclub.org), a nonprofit organization which has existed for over thirty years. The MOMS Club® has 2,100+ chapters across our country and 100,000+ members! The first MOMS Club® was created in 1983 to support stay-at-home mothers. The MOMS Club® has since evolved to include work-at-home and working mothers.

If you are not a resident of Stoughton, Randolph, or Avon, please go to www.momsclub.org to find your local MOMS Club® or information on how to start your own.

*Dues may be waived in cases of extreme financial hardship
results.name: MOMS Club® of Stoughton, MA

results.description:
Welcome to The BNI Elite Chapter. We are Boston and the South Shore's fastest growing chapter. Since Chartering July 3, 2012, The BNI Elite have passed 512 referrals and $1,027,305.49 in closed business!

We thank you for your interest and time to visit us to learn more about how BNI Elite can benefit you. BNI Elite members commit themselves to building trusted relationships with each other to understand who, how and when to refer clients to each other through warm introductions. In most, if not all businesses, the road to success depends on “Who You Know…” in addition to “What You Know…” to win new clients, increase market share and enhance our personal brands.

You are welcome to contact BNI Elite members to inquire how they can help you. We appreciate the opportunity to learn about you, your business and how we can help you reach new clients. With your high energy, our camaraderie and of course our referrals, we share our networking philosophy of “Givers Gain” which means “ if I help you grow your business, you will help me grow my business”.

Should you commit to joining our high energy business networking group, please contact any member on the BNI Elite Leadership Team to discuss next steps with our application process.

Why join another BNI when you can be among The BNI Elite! Stop by you will immediately see why we are different than other area chapters.

Kindest regards,
BNI Elite Chapter Members

results.description:
Boston Paranormal Investigators was formed in March, 2006, to promote research into all aspects of the paranormal - hauntings, UFOs, parapsychology, and any other topics that fit under this umbrella - throughout the Northeast. Members enjoy the following benefits:

* Education and training, including an extensive library

* Structured field investigations

* Monthly meetings for planning and reporting

* Assistance in conducting individual investigations

* Examination/reviewing/classifying of evidence

* Peer review of evidence

* Publishing and dissemination of findings after peer review

* Repository for evidence collected

We also focus on sharing our findings and educating the general public on these subjects by training and lecturing, helping to produce films, programs, and books, and participating in local and regional conventions and other events. In our research, we basically take a scientific approach, and we try to find natural explanations for reported phenomena while keeping an open mind. Additionally, we attempt to capture measurable, verifiable evidence using such tools as nightvision camcorders, EMF meters, remote temperature sensors, digital voice recorders, Geiger counters, motion sensors, digital still cameras, and similar technologies. In addition, we recognize the complementary value of psychics, sensitives, mediums, and others, and welcome their assistance. Members have been featured on SyFy's Ghost Hunters and on the Biography channel. We presently looking to bring a few new faces into the group.

No previous experience required, just a serious interest in the paranormal (ghosts, UFOs, etc) and (this is important!) a commitment to attend monthly business meetings and monthly investigations. If you are interested in joining our team, want to ask us a question, arrange for a speaker or presentation, or request help with a haunting, possession, or other problem, please use our contact us section.
results.name: Boston Paranormal Investigators

The meetup organizes regular events. both for folks around Cambridge/Boston, and around the i95 loop. The goal is to provide:

results.description:
Welcome!

You have made the important first step in meeting a group of people who share many of the same feelings that you are experiencing right now. We are modeled on the North Shore Divorced and Separated Group.

 

The members have diverse backgrounds. This includes a wide range of professions, trades, economic and religious backgrounds. Over time, feedback from the people that join our group has been that they find comfort in meeting others who know what the divorce/separated experience is all about. Each meeting, the group is facilitated by nonprofessionals. It is important that you know that we are simply a group of concerned people helping people. Tremendous bonds of friendship have been forged and continue beyond the scope of the group. The comfort that you will find in this group has helped hundreds of people over the years and is a testimony to the longevity of the group. You be the judge...we invite you to attend our next meeting.  Everyone that attends our meetings, understands what is said in the meeting, stays in the meeting. Confidentiality is respected and you are encouraged to speak on your own terms and when you are ready. Meetings generally last approximately two hours.

There are social opportunities that take place in addition to our meetings, if you choose to participate. The comment is often made that people wish they had found this group sooner. Several members who at one time were going through the divorce process continue to stay active in the group because they feel that they have something to share with others who are going through this phase in their life. We hope you will join us, and know what types of activities you would like to see.

We are concerned about your safety and privacy.  The settings are designed so that group events and members are only seen by people inside the group. We require a face picture for your safety and the safety of our other members.

Many thanks to the people of the North Shore Separated and Divorced Meetup for their help in setting this up, and for creating such a great model of a support group.
results.name: Greater Boston Divorced, Separated and Friends Support Group

results.description: Natural Dharma Fellowship is an organization of Buddhist practitioners offering basic meditation instructions in the Mahamudra and Dzogchen traditions of Tibetan Buddhism. Our practices emphasize the innate wisdom of one’s inherent being and are led by Lama Willa and Natural Dharma meditation teachers. There is an option to pursue a Vajrayana path with Lama Willa for those drawn to it. We meet for meditation and discussion on Tuesday evenings from 7-8.30pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138. The format is very accessible to newcomers as well as those wishing to deepen their practice — anyone interested in Buddhist contemplative practice is welcome! Please visit http://www.naturaldharma.org for more details and information. (Please note: most of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending than it says on the Meetup site.)

results.description:
Greetings!

 

Join us for free pickup doubles tennis in Easton! 

Have you not played in a while, but are dying to get back on the court?  Don't have a partner, but want to play? 

Our group is known for fostering a welcoming, inclusive atmosphere--we're here to play, have fun, enjoy some camaraderie, make some new friends and get some exercise.  No arguing over line calls or berating a missed shot here.

How does pickup tennis work?  Show up at the appointed times, bring a can of balls, join others who are also there, warm up for a while, then play for points for about 30-45 minutes.  Then, we change up who is playing with whom--for example, trying to match people of similar skills, or beginners with a more experienced person so as to keep games even.

We've got retirees who haven't played in 16 years, a recent college grad who played division 3 tennis competitively, and everything in between.  All that's missing is YOU!

Let's Play!  We look forward to welcoming you to the group.

 

With best wishes,

 

MarkT

Organizer

results.description:
We are looking for people who want to meet other people!

We love everything technology (old or new), are willing to wait in line to see the new Burton, Cameron, Jackson, Scott, or Spielberg flick on opening night and love role-playing in whatever form it takes: pen and paper, live-action or online. We have clothing in our closet that would fit well in the 16th century or the 23rd century. We can master any interest that piques our curiosity, whether it be making crème brûlée from scratch (kitchen torch!) or building a trebuchet (launch stuff!).

If you enjoy sci-fi, fantasy, gaming, conventions, ren faires, movies and TV, museums, comics, science, lectures, superheroes, zombies, technology and just getting together with like-minded people to discuss all of this - then this is the place for you!

Come let your geek flag fly!

You know you're a geek if...

  • Anyone has said to you: "You’re Ephixa?!?! You pwned me the Sen’jin battlegrounds!" (insert the appropriate substitutions for your own MMORPG).
  • You not only know what an MMORPG is but you beta tested and then became a moderator.
  • You paid $6000 for your computer and $500 for your car.
  • You renamed all of the characters on "The Big Bang Theory" with your friend’s names.
  • Someone mentions the Q Continuum, and you know what that means.
  • You get really excited that your mixer has a dough hook.
  • You design detailed floor plans before moving all of your furniture around.
  • You say phrases like "Make it so!" and "These aren't the droids you're looking for," when you talk to people.
  • You plot to get your grandmother on Facebook.
  • Felicia Day: If you’re a guy, you want to date her, if you’re a girl, you want to be her.
  • You met your partner at a gaming convention or a ren-faire or a comic book store.

You’re a geek with kids if…

  • You had a Star Wars theme for your baby shower.
  • You are planning another pregnancy, you calculate your due date to not conflict with PAX East.
  • You shout out “Frak” to avoid the other “F” word in front of your kids.
  • You and your partner don’t spell out words like other parents to avoid having your kids know what you’re talking about. Instead, you just speak Klingon.
  • You look forward to Christmas to put together the kid’s toys.
  • You researched and/or developed your own family crest.
  • You use a CAD package to design your child's pine wood derby car.
  • Your three year old asks why the sky is blue and you try to explain atmospheric absorption theory.
  • You research your kids Halloween costume for authenticity and sew/build it yourself.
  • You still you have more toys than your kids.
results.name: North Shore Geek

results.description:
We are a community of dog owners and dog lovers working together to support and encourage safe dog socialization through structured weekly pack walks. (We are NOT a stand around and play group.) We will hold regular, structured off-leash group walks and nature hikes at various times and locations around the Boston metro west and neighboring areas. We urge participants to use our outings as an opportunity to encourage and reinforce positive socialization skills and the behaviors you want your dog to exhibit everyday in public.

All types of dogs and people are welcome, but for everyone's safety, we have a few rules that we ask every participant follow in order to walk with us: 

*Dogs should be tagged and up to date on shots

*All dogs must be leashed until we begin our walk (retractable or flexi leashes will not be allowed;  please use a standard or flat leash no more than 8 feet)

*No face-to-face greetings for the dogs

*Give every dog space before the walk, over excitement can create a ripple effect or a fight

*Always bring a leash and poop bags to clean up after your dog

*If dog will be off leash reasonable voice control is required

*Out of courtesy to others on the trail, if we ever come upon a single hiker or a leashed dog, I ask that people leash their dogs while we pass.  

*Please be on time. To be very specific, when I ask that you be on time I ask that you be ready to walk at the time designated in the event.  If you know you will need a few minutes to get yourself ready upon arrival, please show up 5-10 minutes early to give yourself that opportunity. 

*Not all dogs are created equal, or even want to be.  We have a myriad of different dog personalities on our walks these days.  While I think this is awesome, some of our dogs do not.    This has presented some issues recently in maintaining a cohesive, balanced group and providing a stress free safe walk for both us and our dogs.  Some of dogs are excited players and barkers, a number of us don’t do well with puppies and other dogs can be nervous or reactive and just want to have a quiet walk together without much play.  As a way of alleviating this issue and honoring our dogs’ different personalities, we will split our walks into two groups: high energy and low energy.  (I am clearly oversimplifying with these names, for the sake of ease)  The night before or the morning of a walk (depending on how good you all are about finalizing you RSVP in advance) I will take personality/play style/energy level/age of the dogs attending (sorry people, this walk is about the dogs after all)  into consideration and if I feel it is best I will split the group into these two sub groups to walk separately.  I ask that people stick to these groups for the sake of safety and time constraints for that walk.  If you genuinely feel your dog would be better served hiking with the opposing group to the one you’ve been placed in please let me know after the walk and I will be happy to discuss it with you.


Attendance Policy: We have lots of new members joining this group who would like to attend meet up events and we have a lot of people who've been in this group for a while and should know my contact information by now who are not showing up to meet ups and taking spaces that people would otherwise fill. This is not only unfair to our new members would like to become a part of the group but also to our members who all stand around waiting for you to show up but to other members who would like to attend these events and can't because spaces are full. I know things come up and everybody has an off week so I will allow three strikes for this new policy, but our new rule will be as follows. If you are a no-show or no call for any meet up to which you have RSVP'd yes it will count as a strike against you. Upon your third strike, I will then ban you from the group for one month and notify you of the ban via email.

Disclaimer: Participation in this group is an at-will activity and has inherent risks for which Organizers are not responsible. Furthermore, Organizers of this group are not responsible for parking tickets or tickets from park officials. Off-leash activity is at owner discretion, and Organizers are not responsible for any injury to you or your pet. Dog safety is solely the owner's responsibility and if your pet is in an altercation it is up to the parties involved to settle for damages. It is also the responsibility of each participant to be familiar with the venue (eg, have a copy of a trail map with you).
results.name: MetroWest Pack Walk

results.description:
BOSTON AREA's MOST ELIGIBLE

 

Welcome! Meet Mark and Dan...

 

If you're a single young professional and you're looking to improve your social life, meet like-minded singles in the Boston and Providence areas, network, date, and mingle. Boston Area's Most Eligible (aka Providence Elite) is for you. Look, it's hard to meet people out of college. Some struggle to find friends in new areas, similar sex persons to hang out with, and of course quality dating partners. We aim to change all that, while having a damn good time.

 

Similar to other dating/mingling sites...."Mixer Events"-The primary purpose of this group is to reach out and to interact with other single professionals and have a great time in various fashions... In addition to, and of critical importance to your success is to accurately and adequately portray yourself in pictorial and verbal format. Ie. the best product you put in, yields the best results in the end. Please take a look at my profile (Mark) if you have questions or as an example. Overall...a database shall be compiled to seek out and contact, if desired, a potential friend or date. Feel free to contact members and express your interest in them. However, harassing will not be tolerated and should be immediately brought to my attention, for possible membership termination. If desired, attend an event together for the opportunity to meet, without the pressures of a first date scenario, yet also facilitate mingling amongst your fellow group members, if say the meeting doesn't go so well. Worst case, you don't meet a companion, but you do meet some great new friends.

 

WHAT HAPPENS AT THE MEETINGS?

We will get together and go out to different events, such as:

 

Exclusive Boston Most Eligible Mixers-Grand Happy hour like events and more intimate beer, wine, and food tasting events.

"He said, She said" Group gatherings

Other less formal Monthly/weekly Group Happy Hour events

Trivia nights

Game nights

Fitness events

Outdoor events

Ski trips

SCUBA adventure/boating trips

Other Group gatherings

Etc....

We're looking for organizers to host these and other recommended events in the future. Please inquire within...

 

Whether you're just looking for new friends, or a high quality partner, this group is right for you. Join us! We look forward to seeing you at a future event.

 

Requirements for membership include:

Single adults only

Age range: 21-35.

Classify as a young, single, professional. (based on descriptive questions and photos)

Answer all descriptive questions and your about you section fully and truthfully.

Participate in Group and Group outings.

Minimum of 4 (more recommended) quality, large sized photos of yourself, depicting your true likeness.*

 

*Sometimes privacy is of concern... If you wish to maintain your privacy and refrain from placing photos on the site, please feel free to email me the required photos for proof of membership criteria and you may be accepted into the site without the required photos, though they are very strongly encouraged.

 

***Group Membership termination may occur if requirements not maintained.
results.name: BOSTON AREA's MOST ELIGIBLE

results.description:
Market research suggests that cross-platform development tools for mobile devices are here to disrupt the status quo where IOS apps have to be developed in Objective C and Android apps in Java.

Did you know that you can build and deploy an IOS app to an IPhone or IPad and an Android phone all from your local Windows machine? Cross-platform tools(CPTs) allow developers to create applications for multiple platforms - usually mobile, but increasingly tablets or TV screens - from almost the same codebase or from within the same design tool. CPTs reducethe cost of platform fragmentation and allow developers to target new platforms at a small incrementalcost. More importantly, cross-platform tools allow software companies targeting multiple platforms toreuse developer skills, share codebases, synchronise releases and reduce support costs.

The charter for this meetup is to look objectively at cross platform vendors, discuss pros and cons,  and choose the one that suits the situation at hand.
results.name: Mobile Cross Platform App/Game Development

results.description:
Are you a Mom in the Canton, MA area?

The MOMS Club® of Canton, MA is a wonderful way to meet other moms who live in the area, as well as your children to make new friends!

Welcome!!

MOMS Club is for Moms Offering Moms Support

The MOMS Club of Canton, MA is a non-profit organization with these moms in mind: Stay-at-home moms, Home business moms & Part time working moms

We meet mainly during the daytime hours, when moms need support most.  MOMS Club members are able to connect with other moms and share advice and friendships while their children play together and develop important socialization skills.

Being a MOMS Club member entitles you to:

♦ Playgroups ♦ Family Events ♦ Park Playdates ♦ Holiday Parties ♦

♦ MOMS Night Out ♦ HOWL & AWE (Husbands Who Often Work Late/Activities for Weekends & Evenings) ♦

And Much More!!

All of our members have the ability to schedule events and can see who is hosting and attending. The majority of our activities include museums/aquarium/zoos, outings/adventures, parks/playgrounds, playgroups, running/walking clubs are held in the daytime, while the Book Club and Moms Night Out offer evening options.

The goals of the MOMS Club® of Canton, MA are to: have fun with our children and families, support other moms, provide a forum for topics of interest to our members, as well as perform service projects to benefit the children, parents and families of our area.  We are a 501(C)(3) charity.

The dues are $25.00 annually (which may be waived due to extreme financial hardship), which provides you with access to member functions, our e-community, monthly newsletter, and donations to benefit children in our area.

The MOMS Club® is an international nonprofit organization (go to www.momsclub.org if you do not live in Canton, MA to find your local MOMS Club® or information on how to start your own:) and has 2,100+ chapters across our country and 100,000+ members! The first MOMS Club® was created in 1983 to support stay-at-home mothers. The MOMS Club® has since evolved to include work-at-home and working mothers.

Please consider joining us!
results.name: MOMS Club of Canton

results.description:
Hello and welcome to EXPLORE HAUNTED LOCATIONS. This group is for people that enjoy visiting haunted locations, joining in group paranormal alks through historical buildings, restaurants, pubs, homes and cemeteries. This is where those with paranormal interest can unite and share experiences, stories, ideas for future site visits.

I am an amateur! I inadvertently found a very old cemetery while geocaching. I snapped pictures of the site. When I uploaded the pictures I was surprised to see spirits in the pictures, As I researched the area I found it to have an interesting history of lost souls. This was the first of many that peaked my interest.

ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME!!! We welcome beginners and those with prior experience, guest speakers, paranormal investigation groups and experts in the field.  We also love to cross post meetups with other meetup groups:)

Our walks will generally take place during daytime hours or evening/dusk.

Although our interest are in the paranormal we are not a paranormal investigation group. We just enjoy meeting up with others with common interest and going out and having fun.

Anyone over the age of 18 who shares an interest in the paranormal is welcome to join our group.

Just like the pro’s we can’t guarantee you will see ghost or spirits but you will have fun exploring the area with new friends.

We are not teachers, we just organize events to get interested members together to explore.

Our group is brand new and we need your help to grow. Please post ideas on the discussion board.

NOTE; PLEASE DO NOT WEAR HEAVY SCENTS/PERFUME COLOGNES TO ANY INVESTIGATIONS.

No Show Policy:  3 no shows and you will be removed from the group.

If you are interested in leading a paranormal tour please contact the organizer, your group thanks you in advance for your help in sharing a fun time! Thank you for your interest in our group.

We are a nonprofit group who gathers with the intent of meeting like minded members to explore haunted places, you do so at your own liability and risk.

results.description:
I want to try an experiment.

Imagine a typical weekday after a long day at work. You finally get home, collapse onto the couch, click on the television…and then you remember—you have a petting zoo meetup to go to in 45 minutes. Problem is you don’t want to go to the petting zoo. Sure, it seemed like it’d be a hoot when you signed up for it eight weeks ago, but dammit your feet are tired, and you just want to relax, and besides—the new episode of Space Commandos is on tonight. So regretfully you cancel. I know…you promised yourself you’d get out more often, meet exciting people, go on more adventures, but tonight just ain’t the night for it.

Two days later, you arrive home from work vibrant, with pep in your step and rocket fuel in your veins. You’re ready to party! Or at least do some karaoke, local trivia or a late night screening at the old-timey movie theater. You’d even go to the petting zoo tonight, and pet those little animals like a champ. And look! There’s a cool meetup tonight at that awesome restaurant you’ve always wanted to…oh wait, the meetup’s full. No big deal, here’s another one at that hip bar you’ve heard about, Fangtasia. Nope, that one filled up weeks ago. Here’s one that still has an opening, quite a few openings actually…My Little Pony playgroup? Not exactly what you had in mind. “Why can’t there be more spontaneous people like me”, you think to yourself as you settle in for another re-run of Space Commandos.

Sound familiar, or is it just me? My schedule is unpredictable, so it’s hard to know when I’ll be available next month. And, besides, I don’t know if I’m going to be in the mood for a petting zoo on the first Friday in October. Maybe I’ll be more in the mood for a whiskey and grilled cheese breakfast…or a My Little Pony party…I doubt it, but stranger things have happened. The point is I’d like to find out, and so my experiment: Spontaneous Fun.

The idea is for a more spontaneous meetup, one that will focus on scheduling things later that same day, maybe even two or three days in advance, but nothing greater than a week. Maybe you’ll get a meetup notice one afternoon for a get-together for drinks later that evening, or for a night at the drive-in theater tomorrow night. I’ll focus on things that interest me (obviously), and ask for ideas from you as well, things like: drinks after work, a drive-in movie tomorrow night, or maybe an explosion-laden action film at Jordan’s IMAX on Sunday, a cool restaurant in the area one or two days in advance, a True Blood marathon (don’t worry, it’s a show) or Game of Thrones season premier, a casual hike in the area, dog park meetup (we’d have to bring dogs, otherwise that’d be weird), things like that. I’m open to get-together’s in Boston, but there are already a million meetups in Boston/Cambridge; I’d like to see more stuff happening north of the city.

So, whether you’re the spontaneous type who prefers to follow your whims, or you simply forgot to pay your electric bill and now have nothing to do, come out and join us.
results.name: Spontaneous Fun

results.description:
We're just beginning Bott & Tu's book, so I've temporarily reopened the group to new members.

Are you interested in reviewing or rounding out your knowledge of graduate-level mathematics?  The purpose of this group is to undertake a structured study regimen to that end.   Personally, I want to review various subjects and fill in some significant gaps in my own background.   Initially, the plan is to cover approximately the material relevant to a PhD general exam in mathematics at roughly the same level of detail -- give or take a few topics depending on the proclivities of the members (my own bias is toward differential geometry and algebraic topology).   If there is interest, the group may branch out into more specialized or detailed studies down the road.   The idea is to set out a specific plan of study and meet once every week or two (as scheduling permits).   Hopefully, meeting as a group will motivate us to make steady progress and allow us to learn from one another (and meet some interesting people).   The book "Analysis, Manifolds, and Physics" by Choquet-Bruhat gives a good sense of the topics I'd like to cover.   Anyone is welcome; you need not be a student (I'm not one).  However, I ask that you realistically assess your own background and your ability to commit to a long-term programme.   Basically, if you would feel comfortable signing up for an MIT graduate course in Algebra, Differential Geometry, or Topology, then this group may be a good fit.
results.name: Cambridge Advanced Math Study Group

Newton Safe and Sound  (Newton Citizens for Effective Leaf Blower Regulation) actively supports the Newton Board of Aldermen's actions to protect our children, our health and our environment with legislation to effectively regulate the use of leaf blowers.  Membership is open to all Newton residents.

We are Newton citizens who are concerned about the harmful health hazards to children and adults, and the harm to our environment caused by the noise, dust and exhaust from leaf blowers. The serious harm done by these machines is very well researched and extensive literature documenting this is available under the 'More - Files' tab at the top of this page. Leaf blowers are a hazard to our health, they disrupt our lives and their use causes contention in our community.  Only the manufacturers of these machines actually profit from their use.  Commercial landscape workers, others who use them, and all who are exposed to their noise and breathe their dust and exhaust, pay for it with our health, well-being and the denial of our basic right to enjoy peaceful lives and quiet in our homes and communities.  Efficient alternatives are available and there are landscapers who provide excellent services without using leaf blowers. Our Board of Aldermen is now considering legislation to protect us from the harm from these machines. Please join us in supporting them.  Let's join the many other communities who protect their citizens from this hazard.
results.name: Newton Safe and Sound

results.description:
We are a group of real estate investors seeking a means to meet and interact with other like minded investors and related professionals, so we can all do more deals and conduct more business.

www.BlackDiamondREI.com


Based on this premise, we have the following guidelines for our Networking After Hours events:

  • Events held months in Waltham and Worcester
  • Free Events: Networking events are free and open to the public. We encourage a relaxed, informal and fun atmosphere.
  • Local Speakers: Monthly events will include lots of ways to interact and topics of interest presented by local speakers, with no selling speakers. If a speaker is not local to New England, they will be speaking on a topic of interest to real estate investors and not selling a program or course.
  • No Selling Speakers: Speakers will not sell books, tapes, CD's, courses, bootcamps or mentoring programs at our networking meetings.
  • No Seeking "Investors": Attendees are welcome to bring deals to buy and sell, and to introduce themselves to the group. No presentation of "investment opportunities" such as real estate syndications. No seeking "Investors or Partners". This is an SEC violation. No offering of "mentorship programs".
  • No Multi-level or Network Marketing: Multi-level marketing programs are not allowed in this venue. Please do not solicit other attendees that you meet for multi-level programs during or after the meeting.
  • Patronize the Venue: Because we are a free event, we depend on the welcome of our venue providers, and would encourage you to patronize the restaurant during the event. Join us before and after the event for a snack, meal or beverage.
  • No Memberships, no Fees, no Dues: There are no membership dues and therefore no long list of discounts and other perks as benefits of membership.
results.name: Black Diamond Real Estate Investors- Waltham and Worcester

results.description:
This group is about getting together to learn and practice Irish Session Tunes, and to listen to Irish Music. I find learning tunes at sessions to be impossible, and while it is enjoyable to learn and play music at home, it would be fun to get together with others to play occasionally. I started this group to see if there are others like me. To start, we are meeting once a month to play tunes at a fairly slow tempo.

Because the goal is to learn tunes and to practice playing with others I'm guessing that this group will be made up of beginning and intermediate level musicians (If good anchor musicians want to show up all the better), and that we will choose sets of tunes to work on. This way everyone gets to play. Of course, this is all open to what the group wants to do as a whole. Tempos will be anywhere from slow (while everyone is first learning a tune) to comfortably fast (once we've learned a tune). I'd like to keep one specific monthly Meetup away from blistering tempos, although if anyone wants to become an assistant organizer to schedule something more like a session for this Meetup, they are more than welcome (I'll pay the Meetup fee. Anyone who becomes an Assistant Organizer will not have to contribute. The yearly fee is not a lot of money.)

My motivation comes from years ago when I belonged to a CCE Branch in Utica NY. We used to play together weekly, usually in someone's dining-room or living-room. It was a lot of fun to get together. And we all knew a common set of tunes after playing together for many years. Of course we had a great anchor musician, a guy who grew up in Ireland playing accordion. He was patient, and quite tolerant :) CCE in Boston does have Sunday sessions in Watertown, but they don't have a tune list as far as I know. And Watertown is a bit far from the T.

The format is open to whatever the group decides: We can start with new tunes played slowly, and work our way to tunes we have learned well, picking up the tempo as we go. We could also just mix new sets with old sets. I think the first format might be better if better musicians want to show up later to play faster tunes. This depends on who joins. Currently, I'm working my through Malley's 100 Essential Irish Session Tunes. We can choose to go through a collection like this (All great tunes), or we can put our own setlist together.

So here is to whatever happens!
results.name: Somerville Irish Music Meetup

AMC offers a structure for leadership training, peer-approved leaders, and workshops taught by volunteer instructors to help others improve their skills and participate at a higher level. Our trips are open to everyone based on ability, although participants in backcountry trips are usually screened to insure they don’t end up somewhere they don’t belong. We are diverse in the style and ability of our trips and the ethnicity and age of our members. We are serious about skiing with competent leadership, but loose enough to have fun on the way. You don't have to be a social butterfly to join us.  In fact, this group is perfect for those who want to improve their social skills and practice interacting with new people.

results.description:
COLLISIONcollective (aka Cc) was founded in 2002 as an offshoot of the MIT student art group, ATat (Arts and Technology at tech), whose charter was to host events showcasing art incorporating technology.

Formed by artists and technologists, the COLLISIONcollective is premised on the sometimes abrupt intersection between art and technology. Its practitioners are drawn to this synthesis as the epicenter of forward-looking cultural adaptation. COLLISIONcollective was formed to address several vital needs: the promotion of artists, the creation of events and venues for exhibition, and fostering the exchange of ideas, techniques, and enthusiasm for making art. CC brings together people of all ages and disciplines in a collective format, creating a supportive community.

COLLISIONcollective produces experimental shows, called COLLISIONs, engaging viewers with interactive and robotic art, inviting them to explore laser-lighted spaces, shake their heads at LED sculptures, listen and dance to live electronic music and generally have a good time — while being introduced to the future of art.

COLLISIONcollective members' work can be found from the basements of MIT to exhibitions, galleries and museums throughout the world.

Please check us out on Facebook too!

https://www.facebook.com/collisioncollective
results.name: Collusion by COLLISIONcollective

results.description:
0.  First, let me address some questions people have asked.   This is a writing group, not a critiquing group.   You don't need to distribute work ahead of time or do any homework.   You can write anything you want; there is no preferred genre or style.  You can come as frequently or infrequently as you wish.   You can RSVP or not, show or not.   We do not charge, we do not judge.

1.  We now allow RSVPs, but they are optional.  For some reason the Boston community seems to prefer the use of RSVPs.  But I still want to remove any pressure.  Therefore, I'll open up the ability to RSVP but it's nonbinding and purely optional.  RSVP if you like, don't if you prefer not to.  Feel free to attend or not -- regardless of your RSVP.  And don't worry, you won't get penalized as a "no-show" if you don't make it.   However, please don't bother RSVP'ing "no" -- it just deluges me with emails.

If you suddenly feel like writing 3 minutes before the meeting (and are very very fast on your bicycle), just show up with pen and paper.   If you RSVP'ed and find true love 3 minutes before the meeting, I suggest skipping the group and picking lifelong happiness (unless he/she is on their way to the meeting too, of course).

2.  The format of the (standard) meetings has coalesced into a somewhat stable shape.  We write for 1 hr 15 min (which seems the optimal time from experience).   Then we introduce ourselves (even if some of us are familiar faces).  Whoever wishes to then reads.   Unless there are many readers and time is an issue, you can read anything you wrote (or edited) at that meeting.  If you want to read something else, then usually that's fine -- just keep it to a reasonable length.  Each reader may indicate whether or not they would like comments.  The rule for comments is that the reader cannot respond to them.  After everyone has read, we socialize a bit.   If there is interest, some of us may grab a bite or continue to chat in a nearby cafe.

Note:  Because we used an email list to manage this group until recently, the first few meetups show only 1 attendee (me).  For those who are curious, we averaged 4-6 per meeting.

Modified Original Description:  This is a shameless copy of my favorite New York writing group. The idea is simple: write a bit, optionally read, and possibly grab a bite afterward. No cost, no strings, no commitment, and all are welcome.   Each meeting will start with around one hour of writing anything you like. Then, after brief introductions, anyone who wishes may read what they wrote. If there is interest, some of us may grab dinner afterward. Although you have to sign up for the group, there is no cost, optional (and non-committal) RSVPing, and no attendance limit. We'll simply announce our meetings, and you can do as you please. Stay on the list as long as you wish, come as little or as much as you like, stay only for writing or reading, etc. You can choose to always read, never read, read on prime days ... there's no pressure. Ideally, we'll meet once every week or two. All types of writing are welcome. In the NY group, people wrote stories, poems, screenplays, journal entries, pieces of novels, memoirs, and essays. One even wrote computer code (fortunately he never read it :) The group should be thought of as a safe place for writers to come together, and hopefully it will spawn collaborations, friendships, and some interesting work.
results.name: Cambridge and Boston Friendly Writing Group

results.description:
This is a group for all those who miss the pleasure of digging into a new book with the knowledge that on the other side of the cover they will have the opportunity for engaging conversation! Prepare yourself for some mid-brow chatter, snacks, and reading. We're aiming for one book a month, democratic voting selection, and wide array of subject matters probably heavily leaning towards fiction. Did I mention the snacks?

Here are a few useful tips for joining our discussions:

- You're welcome to join even if you haven't finished the book!  Often people who haven't finished find the discussion a helpful motivator to finish things up.  The one caveat is, be prepared for spoilers.

- You're welcome to join even if you're on the wait list.  We certainly wouldn't want to turn anyone away.

- Newcomers are always welcome!  We enjoy hearing new points of view and fresh perspectives.

- Typically we meet at the Democracy Center (45 Mt Auburn St., Cambridge MA) in the Rosa Parks room.  The Rosa Parks room is on your right after you walk through the front door on Mt. Auburn St.  The Democracy Center is a free, non-profit space that is very generously offering us its space, but doesn't have any food service.  So you won't be able to order food or drinks, but feel free to bring your own!  We'll also pass the hat for donations to the Democracy Center at the end - so if you could chip in a few bucks, that would be lovely.

- The group is volunteer-run and we definitely encourage members to step up and help out.  If you are interested in leading a discussion, joining the organizers group, or organizing a one-off event (like a movie outing, trivia night, author event at a local bookstore, etc.) please get in touch!  The more the merrier.
results.name: Cambridge Book Club for Awesome, Amazing, Readers like YOU

results.description: Calling all Reiki Practitioners. . . Join us as we unite in Reiki Circle - share, heal, and learn from each other! Group energies are often very strong and can be more than individual sessions. This type of Reiki treatment is a wonderful and can often create a profound experience! This Circle is open to all Reiki Levels. First time attendees, please e-mail/send a copy of your Reiki Practitioner Certificate prior to Reiki Circle .

Boston Naturists gather at house parties and at public (clothed) places to meet other HETEROSEXUAL nudists/naturists. Day trips to nudist resorts are planned from time to time. We encourage gender parity and discourage behavior not appropriate at mainstream nudist resorts. Singles and M/F couples welcome.

We require a picture so that we can identify each other at events, and also that all reserving for an event will know that there is no one they have met previously and with whom they would not be comfortable.  As a private group, only members will see your pictures. The best main photo is a headshot. You may post additional pics, which could be clothed or nude.

We prefer both a (real) first and last name for similar safety reasons. But if you just use your first name please include at least an initial for your last name, should we get more than one member with a the same first name. We also want to see a bio that you wrote for this group. Helpful also for acceptance would be making either your other meetups and /or interests visible (we like well-rounded members!).
results.name: Boston Naturists

results.description: This group is for anyone who is interested in creating a healthy lifestyle for themselves and family. We all want to eat better but with our busy lives it can feel challenging. We will explore where to get affordable organic vegetables, how to get started juicing, recipes, and most of all we can be a support for one another. Looking forward to sharing ideas with everyone.
results.name: Brockton Area Healthy Eating for MInd, Body, Soul

results.description: A branch of the edX Global Community for people who live near Boston, MA, USA! MeetUp with other people taking edX courses, have study groups at local coffee shops and libraries, and celebrate your successes!
results.name: edX Boston Community

results.description: This group is for anyone who has graduated from a Historically Black College or University (HBCU) or loves and/or supports them. If you find yourself living or working around the Boston Metro area, and would like to network and have a great time with those who share this common interest, then this is the group for you.
results.name: Boston HBCU Grads

results.description: This group is for anyone interested in 3D printing and technologies associated with the process. We will cater to all levels of experience from those who have just found out about it to the advanced 3D printing technologist. I am interested to hear from anyone interested about suggested formats for the meeting and locations for meeting. I would like to keep it informal and friendly with a high level of information exchange between members of the group.

results.description:
This group is for Software Engineers and technology professionals in and around the Merrimack Valley. The meetings will be focused on a variety of topics including new technologies, trends in software engineering, frameworks, and programming languages. Non-technical topics will include effective resume writing, job interviewing, and professional networking.  Our meetings will include guest speakers from local software companies.

Whether you are an entry level Software Engineer or V.P. of Software Development this group will have something for you.

results.description:
The New England Trail Volunteers group was created to provide local outdoor-oriented people an opportunity to give back to our trails through our trail care projects...

We are a volunteer based program, and generally work on projects involving trail maintenance/ construction helping out groups such as the AMC , USFS , Trail Adopters and more..  We will offer to help with  trail volunteer projects throughout New England....
results.name: New England Outdoor Trail Volunteers

results.description:
Welcome to NAKID Social Sports - the newest kickball, dodgeball and volleyball league in Boston! NAKID stands for "No, Adult Kickball Isn't Dumb" and we play fully clothed!

Throughout each kickball, dodgeball and volleyball season, we have lots of great social events that NAKIDs are invited to, such as our FREE parties, FREE movie screenings, the Beerlympics, sports games watches, tailgates, flip cup tournaments, festival trips, happy hours and more! Many of our events are free or have a small fee associated with it.

Anyone is more than welcome to join our Meetup group, but if you're not a paid member of NAKID, you may have to pay a higher fee to come to our events. Non-NAKIDs aren't permitted at our free movie screenings, unless you're coming with a NAKID - so come to our other events and start making some NAKID friends!
results.name: NAKID Social Sports - Boston

results.description: This is a social and technical group for those wanting to meet with web developers and discuss ColdFusion/CFML and other related tools and technologies such as JavaScript/jQuery, Mobile Development, HTML, CSS, and databases. Developers of all levels, from newbies to veterans, are welcome!
results.name: Boston ColdFusion User Group

results.description:
What is Secret Dining Hub?

Secret Dining is when someone uses their house or some other space to run a cross between an amateur restaurant and an intimate dinner party.

This group helps you to hear about local secret dining events and it's also a place where anyone planning to host an event can advertise and sign up guests.

Anyone is welcome to add an event. Here's how you do it:

1) Click on the “suggest a meetup” button and enter your details.

2) Pay $5 by clicking here (refundable if nobody signs up)

3) If you want to collect payments from guests in advance follow the instructions in this video

4) Once this is done your event will be announced. If you regularly add events you will be added as a Group Organiser which gives you more editing rights and allows you to announce your own events rather than waiting for a moderator.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Join our international community by adding us on Facebook, Twitter & Pinterest:
results.name: Secret Dining - Supper Clubs in Boston

results.description:
Startup Cafe Boston is regional group of innovative business entrepreneurs. The aim: to create create a true entrepreneurial mastermind, advisory board, and collective feedback forum for budding and veteran startups. The focus here less on networking or business cards than resources, connection, and shared success.

All discussions are to be assumed confidential and require an implicit agreement of non-disclosure from each member.


I am very interested in hearing your ideas on what you would like to gain from this group and if you would like to help organize events so please do not hesitate to reach out.


Let's make this the best city in the world to start great things.
results.name: Startup Cafe Boston

results.description:
Our mission is to help mothers.

We are here to support women during this transition. Having a baby changes everything. Certain decision are difficult and without support from the culture at large. Choosing to breastfeed can be a rocky road. We aim to help mothers to breastfeed through mother-to-mother support, encouragement, information, and education, and to promote a better understanding of breastfeeding as an important element in the healthy development of the baby and mother.

Our mission is to help mothers feel good about mothering.

Being a mother-to-mother support group, we never discriminate! We meet every mother where she is at on this crazy journey.

We welcome all mothers and mothers-to-be and women who share our goals.

And, of course, everybody's babies and toddlers and kids!

results.description: Single Volunteers Boston non-profit organization that connects singles who share a common interest in volunteerism. We were founded in 2002.  Our objective is to fulfill the volunteer needs of non-profit organizations in the Greater Boston Area while having fun and meeting people. We connect volunteers to Greater Boston area non-profits. It is fun and it is FREE to join this group but we do charge a small fee to sign up for some events.  The money raised goes to the meetup fees we pay and our operating costs.
results.name: Single Volunteers Boston

results.description:
The Sufi Order International of Greater Boston is devoted to meditation instruction, spiritual growth, and the teachings of Hazrat Inayat Khan, Pir Vilayat Inayat Khan, and Pir Zia Inayat Khan. It sponsors classes and events occurring around southeastern New England at a number of locations: a constellation of lights. It is a branch of the Sufi Order International, an interfaith international organization.

"Thus the ultimate purpose for which the soul is seeking every moment of our life, is our spiritual purpose. And you may ask how to attain to that purpose. The answer is that what you are seeking for is within yourself. Instead of looking outside, you must look within. The way to proceed to accomplish this is for some moments to suspend all your senses such as sight, hearing, smell, touch, in order to put a screen before the outside life; and by concentration and by developing that meditative quality you will sooner or later get in touch with the inner self which is more communicative, which speaks more loudly than all the noises of this world; and this gives joy, creates peace, and produces in you a self-sufficient spirit, a spirit of independence, of true liberty." -- Hazrat Inayat Khan
results.name: Sufi Order of Greater Boston

results.description: This is a group for Cloudera customers in the Boston area to network, share best practices, and exchange ideas around the Cloudera Big Data platform and components including Cloudera Impala, Cloudera Manager, Cloudera Navigator, HBase, and so on.

results.description: Looking to gather like minded folks who believe that searching for and managing a home via mobile applications can be simple.

Free monthly events.

Learn and share in variety of martial arts in a safe and fun environment.

Self Defense Muay Thai, Ju Jitsu, KAPAP Krav Maga, weapons....

Learn skills, meet like minded people, make friends while getting some exercise.
results.name: New England Muay Thai & Ju Jitsu

results.description:
Keep up with the latest you need to know in making your Internet based apps sing on a wide range of mobile and less-mobile platforms such as Android, Arduino, iOS, Mac, Raspberry PI, & Windows.

We evaluate technologies and methodologies applicable anywhere within the software stack, but always in the context of multi-platform development and architectural impact. Preference is given to standards-oriented browser/web technologies, such as HTML/HTML5, CSS/CSS3, Javascript, etc. and cross-platform tools from Adobe and others. Discussions evaluate the technical merits of a subject and how it plays with other elements in the bigger picture, such as integration, workflow, maintenance and market/marketing considerations.

Our hope is to help each developer find their own answer to the never ending question: Is there a core skill set that can enable me to efficiently create elegant solutions that have the desired reach.

Please sign up for free & join us on the journey.

Best regards,
Douglas McCarroll & Ira Hochman
Co-Organizers, Full Stack Boston
results.name: Full Stack Boston

results.description:
This Group is all about dancing, being social, and having FUN!

The mission: Help everyone feel the joy of salsa dancing, learn a few cool moves along the way, and provide a group environment for everyone to feel more confident about their dancing.

Two left feet? No problem! Practice makes perfect - Just join us and DANCE DANCE DANCE. You WILL get it if you KEEP trying.

Expert dancer? Welcome to the group! -  We look forward to showing you a few challenging choreographies with flashy footwork. Do you think you can handle it?

The bottom line: Life is short - Dance, have fun, learn some cool moves, and meet new friends.

Hope to see you soon!

topics.name: Single Parents of School Aged Children

results.description: I would like to plan some activities for single parents with their children. Sometimes it is difficult to find other adults to spend time with with the kids because they do things with their significant other and their kids as a family. I would like to create a community of people that want to plan some outings that would be difficult to do without another adult. Also I find it easier to motivate my son to do things when there are other children around to do it with. A day of skiing, or a day at the beach, a hike in the woods, kayaking, or just walking the dogs. Please feel free to contact me with your ideas or suggestions for an event and let's try to make it happen.

results.description: Stomach growling? Has your social appetite gone unfed? Tired of eating out at the same restaurants with the same people? Want to try a few new dishes? Want to make some new acquaintances? If you answered “yes” to any of the above, great news: you've found the answer! Good Friends, Good Food is here to satisfy your hunger. Each meet-up we get together, bring a home made dish (or two), kick back and enjoy. Have a killer culinary specialty of your own? Bring it! Can't cook? Bring something from your favorite store. Either way, come out and try some awesome food and hang out with great people. So, to recap: food, friends, networking, and good times! See you there!
results.name: Good Friends, Good Food

results.description:
The Boston Spa Club are for guests who enjoying trying new spa's, meeting new people and relaxing.

Please email us at bostonspaclub@gmail.com

Michele
results.name: The Boston Spa Club

results.description: A group for people and dogs in the Davis Square and surrounding area to get together and coordinate to go on walks or dog parks together so the dogs can get some exercise and socialization. It doesn't have to be a big event, just say you're going somewhere, and anyone else wanting to go can chime in!

We get together to discuss best practices, to exchange ideas and to learn how to apply these frameworks to various engineering challenges.

results.description: This is a group for paper crafters, book lovers, scrapbook makers or anyone wanting to explore the world of Mini Books. I started this group to meet others interested in making Mini Books or even regular sized books. Activities would include Book crafting demonstrations as well as workshops with participants making their own books to keep or swap.
results.name: Mini Book Crafters of Metrowest Mass

results.description:
Anyone want some company while running?! This is the group for you! We are on the North Shore and will be having group runs hopefully 2x a week. I have been having a hard time finding a group in my area, so I figured there must be other people out here too with the same problem!   Experienced and beginner runners are welcome to join, all are welcome!

 

I will start posting routes shortly, if you have any that you would like to run please submit them as well.  I'd love to change it up as often as possible and move around the north shore.   For the start I would like to keep loops around 5K and move up as we get more people and adjust to others abilities.

 

I look forward to running with everyone!
results.name: North Shore Running Group!

results.description: The purpose of this group is to meet other people who transcend traditional gender boxes. In doing so, we can build a system of support and have fun socializing.
results.name: Boston Area Genderqueer Meetup

topics.name: Sales and Marketing for Professional Services

results.description: This group will bring together business owners and others who want to start their own radio show to promote their business or further a cause. Having your own radio show is a great way to get exposure in your marketplace, become known as an expert and has tremendous marketing advantages for a wide range of businesses. The plan is to share ideas and experiences, hopefully visit some radio stations and help anyone that wants to start their own radio show or get more benefit from their current show. I started this meetup as I did a show for years, am back into it, and would like to meet others who share my enthusiasm for having their own radio show.
results.name: Host a Radio Show for Fun & Profit

results.description: Give back while having a great time!! Come dance, socialize, join in a game, comedy or fun theme night. Bring your friends and make new ones.
results.name: Socializing and Dancing for Charity

results.description:
Comics are brilliant. They are also an overlooked and under-appreciated part of the literary establishment, so we're looking to redress the balance a little.

The group works pretty much like a traditional book club - we pick a new graphic novel or collection every month, read it and meet up for a discussion with a beer or two. I bring some questions that may or may not get answered - it doesn't really matter.

We try to find the literary corners of the graphic storytelling medium, so we're interested in things like how art style informs character perception; how panel layouts inform pacing; we examine the moments when superheroes do some genuine soul-searching; we look at unsettling indie comics and ask what they're saying. We don't shy away from the mainstream - there's plenty of us who love a bit of Batman (we also love him remade as a communist icon) but we will at all costs avoid bland, knuckle-dragging characters with nothing to say, in favor of deep, cleverly-drawn characters and great narrative. (Or really good explosions.)

The Comic Book Club is open to all comic readers, creators, writers and illustrators, as well as to anyone who has never even read a graphic novel before but has perhaps secretly stolen a glance at that colorful forbidden shelf in the library erroneously labeled 'teen fiction'. We're a friendly bunch, and, for good or ill, we generally favor outspoken opinion over actual knowledge. Welcome!
results.name: Comic Book Club Boston

results.description:
@ Google+ Hangout  Community

We are respectful Traditional Catholics who love Mother Church and Her ever true Dogmas. 
We seek thoughtful and true friends in this our journey.

We attend only one kind of Mass, the Tridentine Mass, the official Roman rite of the everlasting Roman Catholic Church. We love this Mass, not because it is in Latin, but because it embodies and reflects no error whatsoever, but the fullness and richness of our Catholic Faith.

Although we still shamefully recognize the current Pope as the Vicar of Christ, we are not deceived by the great evil and apostasy of Vatican II itself and its various applications and interpretations. We await a Catholic Pope who will right the innumerable and pernicious wrongs of his predecessors, in the harshest and most declarative terms; perhaps even to the extent of revoking certain dubious canonizations.

We are and want to continue being serious about the Catholic Faith. We don't want to fall prey to liberalism, subjectivism, modernism or secularism.  We will water our Faith with plenty study and our Charity with plenty practice.
We do not wish to be turned bitter by the present crisis in the Church and world...

Since fighting the battle alone is bad business, this group is here to help us strengthen one another in every activity we perform. Let's be fellow pilgrims and friends, first bound on the highest level - the Faith, the true Faith that did not begin in the 50's and 60's.

How blessed it is to see Catholics taking on various professions, and still taking the time to put God above all. Impressive! We hope you will offer a great deal to the group. Share some of your talents. Broaden our horizons! Dazzle us!

Please read, study, appreciate and understand the life of Archbishop Marcel Lefebvre, without whom we certainly would not have had Tradition restored.

In Cordibus Jesu et Mariae,
Francis
results.name: Traditional ("Latin Mass") Catholics

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in learning and sharing the creative, relaxing world of Zentangle®. Zentangle® is an easy-to-learn, relaxing, and fun way to create beautiful images, one stroke at a time.

 Terry's Time to Tangle is for those who have attended a class taught by a Certified Zentangle Teacher (CZT) and/or those who have been tangleing on their own.  We will share new tangle patterns and help each other master difficult patterns. Occasionally we will have guest instructors to show us new mediums, techniques, styles, use of color etc. It's a great way to re-vitalize your tangleing.

 Looking for formal Zentangle® classes and workshops? I'll post those here as well.

 The meetup will generally be very informal and will meet at various locations and at various times. you are welcome to suggest and host meetups that will fit your schedule.

 Even if you are new to drawing or think you are not artistic, you will enjoy creating Zentangles. Also, great for the experienced artist to warm up and get creative juices flowing. The process of creating a Zentangle is a form of "artistic meditation". You can become completely engrossed in making each pattern, deliberately focusing on "one stroke at a time". The tangles (patterns) can be adapted to other art forms like quilting and polymer clay. The creativity options and pattern combinations are boundless. And anyone can do it!!!
results.name: Terry's Tangles - New England

results.description:
Great way to meet new friends and more, sharing interests, monthly parties, field trips, holiday gatherings, hanging out and taking advantage of the many great things about living in New England.

We are now organizing Meetup Social Gatherings exclusive to  membership, volunteer opportunities to meet, mingle and have fun while volunteering for community causes, weekend trips and much much more.
results.name: New England Social Events

results.description:
How can we do the most good in the world? What are the best charities? Which causes are most important? How can we best use our money and time to make a difference? And how do we do that without going nuts? Let's get together and talk about that.

Some useful sources on the topic:

The Effective Altruism Blog, a group blog

80,000 Hours, a career resource for those interested in effective altruism

GiveWell, a charity evaluator

Giving What We Can, a giving community

results.description:
Do you love to write songs but wish you had people to experiment or collaborate with? Maybe you need help with lyrics or melody? Maybe you want to explore your voice? Come join our group and let's start writing and singing!

All the best,

Gary
