results.description:
Explore the true nature of mind and consciousness, experience deep peace, and empower yourself  with the tools to succeed and lead a more fulfilling life. We offer:
• Free Talks and Courses in meditation, self-development, and spirituality
• Topics include Stress-free living, Positive Thinking, Practical Meditation
• Quiet Room for Meditation open to all

We're a non-profit and all our events and courses are ALWAYS provided FREE of charge as a service to the community. Voluntary contributions welcome.

results.description:
Let's get together and talk gamification! All skill levels are welcome.

We'll start small and have an informal dinner in January 2013. Join now to keep updated!
results.name: Gamification Meetup

results.description:
Publick House, Hops and Scotch, Zaftigs, Otto's, Barcelona... There are so many great restaurants and bars in Brookline; let's all get together and have some laughs and good conversation to go along with the great food and drinks!

Are you active or sporty? Let's climb Corey Hill, ice skate in Larz Anderson Park, or run together in one of the many 5K races in the area.  Whether it be Spring, Summer, Fall, or Winter, we can find some great activities that are more fun doing with others.

Do you enjoy movies? Let's go see a classic one at Coolidge Corner Theater or head down the road and catch a current release in Kenmore!

Want to give back to the town of Brookline? Getting together to do charitable activities or promote local events can help to make our community that much better.

This group is about good people getting together to enjoy our home and meet one another. Whether you grew up in Brookline or just moved here, are single or married, go to grad school or work, there is a place for you with us. Our target demographic is 26-40 year olds who live and/or work near Brookline (Brighton and Newton are included of course) but that is not set in stone. Most events will be 21+ though (no exceptions and this includes any guests).

All we ask is that you show your fellow members the same respect that you should show to friends and follow the RSVP rules and other policies that were designed to help Organizers continue running great events for your enjoyment.  Please make sure to go to the file section to find/read our official rules.

Welcome to the Brookline Social Club; this is going to be fun!
results.name: Brookline Social Club

results.description:
Chocolate is called the food of the gods for good reason. This club is dedicated to celebrating it in all its forms. We will meet in various locations around Boston, Cambridge, and environs (T-accessible as often as possible) to sample fine dark and milk chocolate. We'll focus on only the best stuff (sorry, Hershey, you're not invited to this party). We'll taste, share, learn, and enjoy together. Sound like fun? Please join us!

______________________________________________________________

The fine print: This group is inclusive and accepting of all chocolate lovers, but young children might not find us much fun. We hope that you will consider bringing a friend or two so that we can spread our appreciation for the most magical of treats.

We're focused on fine, tasting chocolate. That means that we're most interested in chocolate made with beans sourced directly by the chocolatier, and we're interested in the best quality chocolate.

NO SELLING, please. Some members have associations with various chocolate organizations and producers. That's great. We love that. But, please, no selling or recruiting at meetings. Let's keep the focus where it belongs: on tasting. However, if your organization has an event that might be of interest to our members, don't hesitate to message me.
results.name: Boston Chocolate Club

results.description: If you work from home in or near Westford, MA and would like to go grab some lunch and network once a month, then please join us...

results.description:
This is a group for professional queer women of color living in New England who are interested in meeting with other sisters to share laughs, tell stories and support one another.

 

It is open to bisexuals, lesbians, questioning women in search of a community to call their own. All ages, all interests, all ethnicities.

 

We have no definite agenda except the one we will build together.

If you are interested in the idea of building a community of queer women of color, please join and let us know what you would like to see happening.

You can also find us on Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/groups/PQWOC/

Responsibility of all members: (YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR YOU)
Participation in any and all events is at your own risk. The group and event organizers and those connected to this group and this website may not be held responsible for the safety or well-being of anyone or their pets who chooses to attend these meetups. By attending, you agree to prepare for the event as appropriate, and send the organizer or others questions as necessary. We certainly try to look out for each other as friends, but if you attend an event, you agree to take primary responsibility for yourself. There are no “liability waivers” or other written agreements to sign. By signing up for an event, you pledge to agree not to hold anyone responsible if something somehow goes wrong.

results.description: This is a group for Professional Singles in the area, looking to meet other quality Professional Singles! Your host is one of the most successful matchmakers in the country so she will be by your side every step of the way to ensure everyone is having a great time, introduced to each other and making connections both personally and professionally! We have great contacts in the Boston area and looking forward to great upcoming events!

Come visit us after 7 pm on any Thursday at the Wilmington Arts Council Building, 219 Middlesex St (Rt 62), Wilmington, MA.

results.description: North Shore Outdoor Photographers is for photographers of all levels who love nature & landscapes, New England scenes, and people enjoying outdoor activities. We may focus on reflections, abstracts, macro or close-ups, graphic elements, changing seasons, night, light & shadow, people outdoors, and the essentials of composition. We’ll get to shoot and socialize with other folks who share our passion for the outdoors and making photographs! What could be better?

If you'd like to sign up, please send me a note and describe how you'll contribute to the conversation.

results.description:
We are a group of real estate entrepreneurs looking to bring together other strategic real estate professionals so we can all do more deals and grow our businesses. Our event locations will vary in and around Boston and north of Boston locations Free Events: Networking events are free and open to the public.

Our events have both a networking and learning component(generally with one guest speaker per event).

Whether you are an investor looking for funding, a local real estate agent looking to grow your business or a just looking to learn more about the industry in general, come check us out.

results.description:
It's been said that "You are the sum of your 5 closest friends and acquaintances." That means that if you're trying to be successful, you should spend time with successful people.

Connections are tough to make in Boston. It's a cold city where people keep to themselves. That's why networking is the most important things you can do to get somewhere in this town.

It's all about who you know. You've heard it before because it's true. You create your own opportunities to move up in the world by utilizing the resources around you: The people you know.

If you're looking for a partner, people to make a deals with, to hire someone or to be hired, for a career, to surround yourself with other intelligent and successful people because you're actively trying to move up and be successful in Boston...

Then join Boston Profesional Networking and start making the best connections in town!

Don't just let success happen, MAKE success happen. Success is at your fingertips and it requires you take action. Start your path to success and join now!
results.name: ✅ Boston Social & Professional Networking - 20's & 30's 40's

Welcome Girlfriend!!!

Girlfriends of the South Shore is for women who want to expand their circle of friends and have fun! We go out to dinner, movies, clubs, horseback rides, we have girls night in and we have girls night out, trips, events, entertainment, festivals, home parties, hiking, road trips, comedy clubs, wine tasting, blueberry picking - you name it.

Really, if you want to do something fun just put it in our calendar and see if anyone would like to join you! Girlfriends of the South Shore is for down-to-earth, sincere, positive and classy women who love to laugh, women who have stories to share and listen to! We women need to support, lift each other and grow together!!!

Our youngest members are early 20's while we range in members to their 60's. We create a wide variety of events so you will find what suits you personally best. We hope to have something for everyone to try new things while making girlfriends in real life! Make some friends and get out and enjoy life.

results.description:
Looking for spontaneous fun in large groups? You don't have to be good at anything to participate. Meet new people at random places and be a part of a cultural phenomenon!

Feeling shy? Wear a disguise!

Flash mob + you =  awesomesauce

results.description:
Come and join us as we build our circle of mom friends, allow our little ones to socialize, and have a great time! Moms who seek to promote nutrition, fitness and healthy lifestyle habits in their families as well as their communities now have a new resource: Stroller Friends powered by Baby Boot Camp is a FREE moms' club to support healthy families. Regular play dates allow parents to meet and discuss what’s on your minds while allowing your children to get in some fun playtime.  Plus our Mommies get a much needed break when they attend our fun Mom's Night Out events every month!

Additionally, StrollerFriends offers a chance for those of you who might want to get back in shape after having a little one a way to do it among friends in a positive and encouraging environment.  Even if you might be intimidated, discouraged, tired, overwhelmed, and you don't know where to start (trust us, you are not alone!), we invite you to join us for a free Baby Boot Camp class. You will discover that working out with other moms who understand what you are going through makes being healthy so easy. It is tough to have the determination to get everyone out of the house on time, the tantrums, the hungry baby, and the daily mommy battles we all face.  Our classes are a place for women of all ages and stages of motherhood to come together in a non-judgmental place to enjoy time with other women while getting fit AND having a play date for your children.

There is no obligation to attend a Baby Boot Camp class to be a member of our group, but if you are interested in getting fit while spending quality time with your child/children then try your first class for FREE!

It is a fantastic way to become the healthy role model you want to be to your family.

Baby Boot Camp’s most popular class, STROLLFIT, is a 60-minute class. STROLLFIT classes cater to all fitness levels: pregnant moms, new moms recovering from pregnancy and conditioned moms with stroller-aged children. Cardio drills, strength training exercises and stretching increases overall fitness, and the ab assault at the end of class means you get a total body workout! Classes vary with indoor and outdoor locations based on the time of year.

Exercise modifications can be made for prenatal clients, particularly after the first trimester, new moms who are at least six weeks postpartum, and active moms who are ready for an additional challenge.

Our class schedule:

Mondays & Fridays at Sandy Beach/Winchester


Tuesdays & Wednesdays at Horn Pond/Woburn

*watch our schedule for evening & Saturday class sessions too!*
results.name: Baby Boot Camp Woburn/Winchester

erotic m4m spanking in a healthy atmosphere.

Meet with other friendly Boston gay and bisexual men interested in exploring kink, BDSM and fetish in a safe, fun and healthy ways whether privately and in group events.

About Kink Friendly Men

The focus of the Kink Friendly Men group is to offer resources in greater Boston and New England for men who want to explore, learn and play with other men in creative, safe, healthy, and fun ways.

Our mission is to empower gay and bisexual men to explore their sexuality and to help them say a heartfelt 'Yes!' to pleasure.  We do this by creating safe and friendly spaces where Boston gay men can explore authentic BDSM and co-create fun experiences that foster community, and expand pleasure and intimacy.

To Join, click "Join Us" in the upper right of your screen

Join Us!

While we welcome adult men of all experience levels, our focus is on men who consider themselves beginner to intermediate in their BDSM experience and skills, and want to explore in fun, nonjudgmental settings that promote community.

Join us if you are a gay or bisexual man interested in (or want to learn more about) role play, bondage, erotic spanking, power and surrender, applications of spirituality and gay tantra in gay BDSM or other forms of kink and fetish play.

Our Values

We support nonjudgmental, safe and friendly interaction in line with the following values

  • Taking a journey into better and more communicative sex.
  • The transformational nature of pleasure
  • The power of curiosity as an antidote to judgment of self and others.
  • Practices aligned with the ethos of "Safe sane, and Consensual" (SSC) and "Risk, Aware Consensual Kink" (RACK)
  • Clear communication and consent, freedom of choice and friendly negotiation in a welcoming,  nonjudgmental setting.
  • Making clear and informed choices about safety including choices about safer sex practices.
  • The freedom to always say "no" with an invitation to find your "yes" in any given moment.
  • The power of erotic energy for self-discovery and personal transformation.

To Join, click "Join Us" in the upper right of your screen

How to update your Meetup privacy settings

Before joining you may wish to update the privacy settings on your Meetup account.

Here's how:

1. If desired, hide the list of Meetup groups you belong to

Here's how

2. If desired, remove your last name from your Meetup account:

  1. When logged into Meetup, Click "Account Settings" (upper left of screen)
  2. Click "General" in the dropdown menu
  3. Click the "edit" link by your name
  4. Update and click submit

More detailed directions here

This is a private group.  You can review more detailed information about Meetup privacy here

Photo Policy

In the spirit of creating community, we encourage but do not require members to share a headshot (face) photo on your group profile. If you adjust your privacy settings as above this should not be a problem.

In keeping with Meetup.com Terms of Service, we are unable to allow nude photos ("unclothed") whether artistic or not, however, you can share links in your profile or Message Board posting to photos hosted elsewhere, such as on Fetlife.

results.description:
Start The Conversation is a group intended for all non-native, English speakers who want to improve their English conversation. It is also a group that connects people and allows them to improve their English skills at their own pace. It is the ultimate non-classroom experience and is organized by a veteran teacher with more than ten years experience working with non-native speakers.

Therefore, whether you are looking to improve your English conversation for fun, work, or personal reasons, this group provides the forum for socializing, networking, and making lasting friendships.

Lastly, when you join please make sure to include a photo of yourself as this helps the organizer and other members recognize you when you attend events.

Good Rules of Thumb (Tips)

1. Keep your RSVP up-to-date. If something changes and you are unable to make it please update your status. This allows others who are on the wait list to add to the event.

2. If you are going to be late please let the Organizers know by posting a message on the board. Some events require a reservation. If you are going to be more than 15 minutes late, we need to know so adjustments can be made.

3. If you are lost, please post a message or email the Organizers and we will get in contact with you.

Every few months inactive members will be deleted from the group. This is so we can keep the group balanced and current. If this happens to you and you'd like to re-join, we'd be more than happy to have you back. Just sign-up again.

Brief History of Start The Conversation

This meet up began in Boston, Massachusetts in December 2012. It has proven to be so successful that a second meet up group has been opened in Bangkok under the same name and is run by the original Organizer of the Boston location, Judith. Should you be returning to Thailand or plan to visit, please join us for an event as we'd love to meet you. Check out our website:  http://www.meetup.com/Start-The-Conversatio...

Remember, when learning English, it is important to practice, make mistakes and have fun!
results.name: Start The Conversation

results.description:
Joy

 

Connection

 

Freedom to be yourself

 

Playfulness

 

New Meaning


Unselfconsciousness

 

Insight

 

People come to Deep Dance Light Spirit unsure of what to expect. "Do I need to know how to dance? Is it just a playlist of music that each person dances to? What kind of dancing, what kind of music?"

 

The answers are: No, you don't need to know how to dance at all.  You don't even need to be mobile for that matter. A member came who couldn't dance and she sat and swayed and played the drum. And the group included her and made her feel valued and loved and accepted and completely part of the experience. This all happened spontaneously, because deep down in our souls joy and love are only waiting for permission to express themselves.

 

The music I choose is deeply evocative and pulled from all musical genres -- deep drum beats, lilting melodies, and haunting strains that encourage opening up to what arises in the moment.

 

The space is safe and sacred and most people find initial anxiety melting away within minutes of the dance starting.

 

We all intuitively understand that music has the power to move us.  If we give them permission, emotions become energy in motion.  When we open up to what is present in the moment, we see that our feelings want us to dance them. And if we dance them, old wounds heal, knots loosen, we shake off heaviness, despair lifts, sadness flows away and we begin to feel our joy rise right from our tippy toes to our fingers and all the way up through the tops of our heads.  We feel exhilarated, happy, clear, purposeful and finally at peace.

 

Through skillful facilitation and careful selection of music we will undertake a transformative journey into our deep selves. We will do this together for the human condition is not one of disembodied spirit wandering the earth alone.

We honor the need for connection because it is through connection that we learn about the world, other people, and ultimately ourselves.  We will dance in a large group, alone, in small groups and one on one. You will dance in safety and in sacred space. No previous dancing experience is necessary--everyone can dance their life.

 

In Deep Dance Light Spirit you can expect a large dose of fun as well as a physical, emotional and spiritual work(ing)-out.

For more information, please go to www.deepdancelightspirit.com
results.name: Deep Dance Light Spirit

We'll feature a variety of events, such as:

  • Sessions - Shorter than workshops, these lecture-style events will help you learn about various tools and technologies, from Microsoft or community experts.
  • Special Events - From time to time, we'll let you know about other app developer events we think you'll find helpful.

Also, be certain to App Builder for free education, resources, and promotions for your app development.

We hope to see you soon!

- Michael Cummings, Jim O'Neil, Steve Maier, and Josh Drew

results.description:
Would you like more 'warm' referrals for your business?

Welcome to the Charles River Professionals BNI group. We are a group of 28 business professionals in the western suburban Boston area who get together weekly to find referrals for each other. In a enjoyable, non-competitive environment we get to know each other and learn to serve as informal sales teams for each other's businesses. If each member knows 200 people then being in our group of 28 people expands your referral pool to 5600!

Last year our group generated over $500,000 in referred business for each other, that works out to over $20,000 PER SEAT!  Once you have joined, none of your competitors can participate in our chapter, thus locking out your competition.  We have open seats for individuals who will bring enthusiasm and integrity to our meeting.

As a BNI group we are organized so that there is no competition, only one person per business type is allowed.   You can e-mail me with you business information and I will let you know if there is an opening for your business.

You are welcome to drop in for a visit. To attend please use this Meetup site or send an email to mike@mikedelrose.com and let us know how many seats to reserve for your party.  Send us an email and we can discuss if we have an opening for your profession, or you can check out our web site at

http://www.bnimass.com/chapterdetails.php?c...

Search our member list to see if your category is open, then visit a meeting and lock out your competition!

Come for our meeting -- stay for the referrals!

We also want to provide a communication platform for the small business owners who are seeking employees and people who are looking for jobs. You are really welcome to join us if you are: • Planning to start a business or trying to grow a business • Looking for jobs • Have business and marketing experiences • Have customer service and retail selling experiences • Teachers and coaches • MBA graduate We really welcome all kinds of people to join us and give us their help and support. Communication language: mainly in Mandarin; those who can only speak Cantonese can contact us ahead for translation. 我们的宗旨是聚集波士顿地区想创业和正在创业，想做生意和正在做生意的中国人。共同探讨在北美做生意的方法，各种商机，未来经济发展的潮流与趋势。最终目的是让大家在北美创业中少走弯路。我们也想为小型企业主寻找雇员及一些没工作想找工作者提供一个交流平台。 我们真诚欢迎以下人员参加： 1， 想创业和正在创业者； 2， 想做生意和正在做生意者； 3， 想找工作者； 4， 有经商经验者； 5， 从事服务和销售人员； 6， 老师和教练； 7， BMA毕业者。 真诚的欢迎社会知名人士及企业家给我们以支持与资助。 交流语言：以普通话为主，只会广东话不会普通话者可以提前联系我们帮助提供翻译。

results.description:
Welcome to the Merrimack Valley Women's Group! Our group is where women over 40 (50, 60, plus!) come together to enjoy each other's company, share friendships, and experience a variety of social activites and events north of Boston and southern New Hampshire. If you're looking to enjoy new friends (and possibly reconnect with old ones) in a down to earth, non-judgemental and friendly atmosphere, please join us. I look forward to meeting you!

Before you sign up, please review the policies of our group under the 'pages' tab which is located on the top of of this page after Home, Members, Photos, etc... You will find the same info you find for other groups such as our 'no-show' and 'guest' policies. These policies are strictly enforced in the best interest for all of our friends in this group. 

Lastly, your first name at minimum is required for signing up. You're going to be a friend to all of us so don't be shy and please don't keep your first name a secret!

See you soon!

Sharon
results.name: Merrimack Valley Women's Group

results.description:
Fun Bostonians!

Welcome to Fun Bostonians There are so many great things about this city, first and foremost; YOU. The people here are friendly and warm and this is the group where you will blend right in.

Fun Bostonians does not cater to any one crowd because we believe in unity through diversity. Being unique is what brings us together and keeps us friends. We meet up for activities like going out to dinner, checking out new movies, dancing, having fun, exploring Boston, checking out live music and much more...

We also believe that a strong community comes from within. If you'd like to see a particular event, offer to host one. If you like hosting events and have fun doing it, ask about becoming an Event Organizer. It's very rewarding to lead events and giving value to your fellow group members is wicked good karma. ;)

RSVP Expectations

A lot goes into planning events and everyone who shows up to an event is counting on everyone else who RSVP's to show up as well. Therefore, you are advised to keep your RSVP's up to date. Sometimes things pop up and you can't make it, it's inevitable. Please do your best to update your RSVP. It's a very good habit to get into.

Feel free to add yourself to our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/groups/1659281564317838/
results.name: Fun Bostonians

topics.name: Tabletop Role Playing and Board Games

results.description:
This group was started by Ben Libner in March 2013 to form a cadre of MtG players who enjoy EDH, drafting and casual play in the Boston area.  Mike Wetmore became the new Lead Organizer in January 2015.

We enjoy teaching people how to play EDH or draft and welcome people who are getting back into it after time away.  We are happy to loan spare decks to new members, so even if you don't have your own cards, that's okay! We get together at members' apartments/houses in Waltham, Arlington or Lexington mainly because our homes are free venues.  If you find it difficult to get to our meetups because you rely on public transportation, PLEASE reach out to one of the organizers and we will happily figure out a ride to pick you up and return you to the nearest T or commuter rail stop.

To learn more about what EDH is, go here:

http://mtgcommander.net/rules.php

For all games using poison counters in this group, 12 counters will be the requirement for victory. We came to this number because it is blightsteel + 1. 

We have house banned/unbanned and rules list.  If anyone has a suggestion for a certain card to be added to the banned list, please start a discussion on the website or at a meetup!  The list below is only meant to be changes from the standard banned list, otherwise the usual rules stand.

Unbanned in this group:

-The banned as commander list of old still stands. Rofellos and Braids are OK in the 99, nut not as commanders.

Banned in this group:

-Iona, Shield of Emeria. This is a 'soft' ban. We determined the card to be unfun because it denies someone's ability to play Magic. And that's why we get together in the first place.

Considered for the Ban-Hammer:

-Consecrated Sphinx. Far too often this gets copied and slows the game to a crawl. 


House rules and Errata-ed  effects in this group:

-Any card that has an effect when your life total is a certain number happens when your life is twice that number (e.g. Serra Ascendent triggers at 60 life, Felidar Sovereign at 80).

-The change to tuck rules as pertaining to generals that was published on March 23. 2015 is not recognized in this group. If an effect would put a general into it's owners library then it does so and it's owner may not choose to return it to the command zone. 

Furthermore, wishes are always allowed in your decks, and your wishboard is your 15 card optional sideboard (not your entire collection outside of your deck; cards in your wishboard must be unique from cards in your deck).
results.name: Casual Magic: The Gathering of Metro West Boston

results.description: The Town Common Meet Up Group is perfect for meeting new people, developing friendships outside of the group, and OK to network your business. The Center is offering a plethora of new cultural opportunities and educational offerings affecting nearly every segment of the community. The Center, operating out of the Temple Bnai Moshe in Brighton, is open every day of the week except Saturdays. Makor engages hundreds of individuals each week in the CENTER’s activities forming for an example the nucleus of Russian-speaking Jewish community with a commitment to broader Jewish community and Israel. results.description:
Thank you for showing interest in the Balizinha Soccer Meetup.

The purpose of this meetup is to introduce people to the game of "balizinha", and spread this form of soccer/futbol in the Cambridge area.

This meetup is for players who have played high school level soccer or higher.  You must have "touch" to play balizinha, anything less will slow down the speed of play.

The balizinha meetup is capped at 18 players (6 teams of 3 players each).  We have a predetermined schedule and each team is guaranteed at least four (4) games, with the cap in place you will most likely get five (5) /six (6) games.   Because everyone has registered as a "free agent", teams are chosen at random and because we have quality players, there is no telling who will be the best team that day.

Atmosphere:

We are a pretty cool group with people from all over the world that understand the same language, the language of futbol.  We usually have samba (brazilian carnival music) playing in the background and we encourage people to stay on their feet and play the ball.  We all have work on Monday, so we play hard within a certain limit.

About Balizinha:

Balizinha (root word "baliza" (ba-lee-za) means goal in Cape Verdean/Portuguese Creole, any time you add "inha" (een-yah) to a word, it means that it is small.  "Balizinha" literally means small goals.

The game is played on hard top (basketball court) with a maximum of six (6) people on the court, three (3) people on each team.  The goals are 3x3, so a player's accuracy will be tested and the futsal ball moves quickly, so the players will require "touch".  Don't worry if you haven't played in a while, "touch" is like riding a bike, once you start playing it will come back to you.

We don't play with corner kicks, but if the opposing team purposely kicks the ball out on their own side three (3) times in a row, than a free kick is awarded from half-court.  Players are not allowed to crowd the goals and must stay on their feet at all times, no hard tackles.

If you at least played high school ball and love this game, this is the meetup for you.  The best way to see if this meetup fits you is to try it.  See you at the next balizinha meetup!

Força!
results.name: Balizinha (Futsal w/ Tiny Goals)

topics.name: Personal Growth through Yoga and Meditation

results.description:
Enjoy one day, weekend and week long retreats on self-help, personal development, and spirituality.

Retreats are designed to increase and develop more confidence, self-esteem and self-worth. You will  leave feeling rejuvenated about your life and excited to go after a happier, more fulfilling life.

No matter where you are in your life today, you will benefit from these retreats - it's all about taking your life to the next level of happiness, peace, and serenity.

Retreats will vary from writing, reading, sharing workshops, to meditation, yoga, and total relaxation. Some will be local and others may be within a 1-2 hour drive from Boston.

The leader for most of the retreats will be Jacki Rose, author of the book "Take Your Life & Love It" and your organizer for this group.

 


Jacki Rose shares with you all the tools that helped her go from having low self esteem to believing she could do more, discovering her passion and creating a happier more fulfilling life. Jacki has read, listened to and attended over 100 self-help and personal development programs including books, audios and seminars/workshops. She has been focused on self-help, personal development and spirituality for almost 20 years and has taught programs on Creating the Life you Want based on her book "Take Your Life & Love It!"

  • Card games like Hearts and Bridge

results.description: Raw=natural; of the earth and Chic=fashionable, and on point. This is a group for 20-40 something curlies of all colors and sizes; especially women who are interested in or in the process of transitioning to natural hair, new, natural kinky-curlies or long-time naturals (locs, curls, afros, come one, come all). I started this groups because I find myself always talking about my natural hair with friends, colleagues and even strangers. I have been leaning that the upkick of the natural hair movement is about more than "just hair". It relates to healthy choices and living as close to the earth as possible through our product choices, especially as women and people of color who have been disparately exposed to toxins in our neighborhoods, hair products and lack of access to healthy food. We will explore and discuss the psycology and culture of hair, maybe read a book or two about it, discuss how our hair impacts us at work and home, but primarily trade styling and healthy hair care tips, maybe even swap products or organize local larger scale natural hair meetups, all while having fun. Fashion talk to go along with our fabulous curls and locs and styling tips are a major part of this as well! Is it JUST hair?? ! Be a Raw Chic(k).
results.name: Raw Chic Coiffure: A Natural Hair and Lifestyle Meetup

results.description:
Want to learn how to code? Have a great idea? Don't be shy. Develop it!

Girl Develop It is an organization that focuses on getting more women into the tech sector. We welcome people of all genders to attend our events and classes who want to support our cause.

It can be intimidating for women to learn and ask questions when they are in an extreme minority. While open and welcoming, today's budding developer community is up to 91% male. There isn't a comfortable place where women can learn at their own pace and not be afraid to ask "stupid questions."

We decided it was time to provide a place where all questions are OK and everyone can learn in a supportive environment. Our courses focus on coding, leveraging existing technology, and having something to show for it (aka building sweet websites).

If you'd like to teach for us, TA a class or sponsor our events and students, please reach out to us. At the moment, we are strongly welcoming assistance with procuring event spaces in the Boston area.

The mission of Boston Women Connect is to help women entrepreneurs, small business owners and professionals to grow their businesses and achieve professional and personal success. We do this through shared learning in live events as well as “virtually” through social networks, and by fostering strong business connections. Networking Events, live-casts and other “live” events facilitate networking with afocus on sharing and helping each other to succeed. This approach helps women not only to make great connections on the spot, but also fosters strong ongoing business relationships.

Networking Events are held monthly, at venues in the Boston - north area. Virtual networking events and discussions include professional women across the country. Business Development Events feature Expert Speakers on pertinent professional and business development topics. Interactive learning sessions, these workshop events always incorporate networking to grow valuable business connections.

Who should join: Women Entrepreneurs; Corporate, Non-Profit Professionals and Executives. Why should you attend our events: To build strong business connections, To share ideas on business challenges and success; To enjoy and relax with smart, talented business women.

We are a friendly positive group of people BETWEEN the ages of 30 and 55 who love the outdoors. We plan a wide variety of outdoor activities throughout New England.

We are dedicated to outdoor activities combined with good food and drinks. A typical trip will be some type of outside event followed by a social at a local restaurant or pub etc.

Some fun activities will include hiking, short walks, enjoying nature, kayaking, snowshoeing, tubing, volleyball, haunted hay rides, holiday events, Ghost Tours, whale watches etc. We have some indoor events like bowling, pizza, restaurants or bars etc.

We schedule events year round. We meet once or twice a month on the weekends and a couple of weekdays.

This is a great way to meet other people who love the outdoors. I hope you can join us.

Important:

1.) Since this is a social group you must include a clear identifiable picture of yourself. It is important for the Event Organizers to be able to recognize you like you can recognize us. Please also include your first name.

2.) This is a great opportunity to make new friends. No pressure just great people enjoying the outdoors.

3.) DISCLAIMER: During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. The organizer and assistant organizers are not responsible for the safety of the participants. We will try our best to prevent accidents, but are not responsible or liable if something happens to you. By joining the group, you acknowledge this.
results.name: Outdoor Adventurers New England (Ages 30 - 55)

results.description: The Boston Book Festival is New England's largest annual literary event held in October. But we're expanding our events to cover more of the calendar, and we want you to be a part of it! This group is for anyone who can't wait until October to get their fill of the BBF!

topics.name: Zen or Tibetan or Vipassana Meditation

results.description:
The Henry David Thoreau Sangha (“Hank”) meets every Monday night at Wilson Chapel (lower level), Andover Newton Theological School, 234 Herrick Road, Newton Center, MA.

The group was formed in April, 2001. We have about 18 regular participants. We are affiliated with Boundless Way Zen and the Greater Boston Zen Center.

If you are new to Zen: Please send an email to let us know you are coming. Arrive at 7:00 pm for a brief orientation before our regular program.

Meetings always include Zen meditation (zazen) and Zen liturgy (chanting). On most Mondays there will also be either a dharma talk (lecture followed by a discussion), or the opportunity for individual meetings with a teacher (dokusan). You are invited to attend all or any portion of the activities — whatever works for your schedule and inclination. We do 25-minute periods of sitting meditation, and a few minutes of walking meditation between periods.

The event starts at 7:30 pm sharp. Some members show up early to socialize. We usually end between 9:00 and 9:30. You are free to leave at any time.

Attendance is free. Donations to help us pay our rent are appreciated.
results.name: Henry David Thoreau Sangha

results.description: Do you live in the Metro Boston area??? Let's get together!! For everyone 20s & 30s......let's meet at local bars, meet for dinner, watch movies, etc. A fun group for those of us new in town or just looking to make new friends.

results.description:
Do you have a family member or friend who wants to get in shape but doesn't know how to start? Help get them walking or jogging.

We have 2 groups:

  1. Our Walking Group will exercise and encourage one another towards walking a 5K.
  2. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K.

Using CoolRunning.com’s Couch To 5K program we introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace.

  • FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles).
  • Anyone from the community can participate.
  • Led by experienced runners.
  • Mondays through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:40am
  • 45 minute time commitment (3 days a week)
  • Nutrition nights for learning how to snack and replenish your body after a run
  • Goal of jogging and finishing a 5K

NOTE: We will start our SPRING SEASON around the last week of March 2015. We're taking the winter season off because of snow.

(Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising.)

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group at the Assabet River Rail Trail in Marlborough. (Please park in the municipal parking lot next to 72 Jefferson Street, Marlborough.)

In the Spring 2013 we had over 110 people participate and 42 people jog the Finnegan's Fantastic 5K on June 1, 2013. People from all levels of walking and jogging are welcome to join us.
results.name: Marlborough Couch to 5K

results.description:
No matter how delicious we can try to make meditation sound in order to tempt you into meditating, this is a fruit that is meant to be eaten and not just described. In the end, it is not for anyone else but you yourself. Meditation removes the blindfold, the darkness that covers our eyes from the truth. Meditation generates the inner light that gives us vision to see just what is really happening around us. When you attain true bliss and happiness inside yourself through meditation, you will feel so overwhelmed with joy that you will not be able to adequately find words to describe it. No one can do this for you, you have to attain it yourself in order to understand how it feels. When you eat a chili, for example, others may ask you how it tastes, but you can only tell them that it is spicy. They do not really know what spicy means until they try it for themselves. Thus, you cannot describe inner happiness to others. You cannot attain inner peace for others and others cannot attain it for you. This is the truth of life. You must do it for yourself. Embrace the simple relaxed dhammakaya meditation technique that can be used by people of all faiths, regardless of nationality or race to attain inner happiness. Our meditation sessions are conducted by Dhammakaya practitioners who have committed their lives by ordaining to teaching meditation and dhamma (reality of life). They are eager to teach their technique and wisdom on meditation methods, benefits and knowledge gained from meditation, and our true purpose. Every session will be inspiring and will help encourage one to meditate. Though many of us are aware that meditation can help reduce stress, there is still so much more to learn from benefits of meditating. We constantly need to be reminded on how meditating can be beneficial to our overall well being, otherwise it is easy to forget. Our services: - Community meditation class: free and open to public, all are welcome. - Private meditation session: individual/groups -Alms offering and meditation: Observe and experience Buddhist and Thai cultures. For anyone that might be interested in furthering their understanding and learning meditation 

https://youtu.be/vUK2j0Y34vw

Contact: bostonmeditation@gmail.com 

Location: 65 Roberts St. Quincy, MA 02169 

To learn more about our group please visit our website www.dmcboston.org 

Please take a look at http://www.dhammakaya.net/ to learn more about Dhammakaya Meditation and our Dhammakaya Foundation. 

Become MFA fan http://www.facebook.com/boston072 

Follow us @boston072 or visit us at www.dmcboston.org

We are featured in Boston Magazine !

Visit our new locations:

Denver Meditation for All

Palm Beach Meditation for All

Edit description

I imagine there are lots of Boston young women out there in the same boat! Despite the "professional" in the title, this isn't a networking group! The idea is to link together other busy working ladies through fun activities like wine/cocktail nights, dinners and brunches, museum visits, ballet/theatre performances, sporting events, volunteering, etc. I think we're all beyond hitting up the clubs on weekends, but a night out dancing here and there sounds good :) Looking forward to having fun and meeting you all!

topics.name: Grief Support for Partners and Spouses
Grief Support for Parents Who Have Had a Child Die

results.description:
Our grief group is a friendly, caring group of people who will walk alongside you through one of life’s most difficult experiences. You don’t have to go through the grieving process alone.

This support group is led by Dr. Vinnie Cappetta a licensed counselor.  I understand what you are going through and I want to help.  I come at the topic of grief from a Christian perspective, but people of all faiths or no faith are welcomed in this group.  Your own personal journey will be respected.

It may be hard for you to feel optimistic about the future right now. If you’ve lost a spouse, child, family member or friend, you’ve probably found there are not many people who understand the deep hurt you feel.

This can be a confusing time when you feel isolated and have many questions about things you’ve never faced before.

This group meets weekly to help you face these challenges and move toward rebuilding your life.

You are welcome to begin attending the group at any session. Each is “self-contained,” so you do not have to attend in sequence. You will find encouragement and help whenever you begin.

This group is for people grieving the death of a loved one. Many other life situations bring deep grief, such as separation, divorce, a loved one who is dying, estrangement, loss of a loved one to a cult, loss of custody of a child through divorce and more. If you are struggling with a loss not due to a death, this group is not designed to meet your grief needs for healing.

If you are struggling with another loss, you may contact us about individual counseling at 508.293.1611 or see us at http://www.checkyourcompass.org
results.name: Grief Support Group

results.description:
Are you ready to proactively create more happiness and success in your life?

The Personal Growth Network (PGN) is a Greater Boston community whose members work together to consciously create more success and more happiness in our individual lives.

PGN provides you with heart-felt social connections, with a wide-spread support network, and with your choice of a humongous selection of diverse tools and techniques.

We each may have different goals or use different approaches, yet together we find ways to support one other, helping each other to reach our individual, personal life goals.

You'll find much here that can help you on your unique life journey. Any one particular approach may not necessarily be "right" for you at this point of your journey, but many approaches are here for you to try on -- to utilize or to set aside as you decide -- depending on how well they appear to you to support what you want to create in your life.

For you personal growth & development leaders, PGN provides you with a giant toolbox that helps you to more easily share your concepts, techniques, tools, and love with the larger personal growth community. Given PGN's interest in collecting diverse techniques towards diverse goals, our community is "open" and "non-denominational". PGN welcomes effective approaches from any positive psychology or cognitive discipline:

• National approaches (e.g., Insight, LOA, Forum, HAI, Dale Carnegie, MAP, MDI, NLP)
• Home-grown approaches, developed by local members and drawn from many disciplines.
• Study groups, organized by members like you, supporting one other, perhaps practicing particular approaches more deeply or working together towards a shared life goal (e.g., health, new business) 
• Social events where you create fun events that combine connection, fun, and learning.

The path that serves you best may not serve someone else; your path today may well change tomorrow. Our open, diverse, growing, networked community is intended to remain your primary resource for personal growth & development tools and support. Use whatever serves you best -- to learn and grow and succeed towards your current goal -- and, once complete enough, refocus on your next goal, perhaps utilizing different tools, perhaps in a different part of your life.

Our community creates 100s of events: 

• Social events: dances, parties, get-togethers, movies
• Study groups: interest groups, support groups, mastermind groups, book clubs 
• Formal presentations: classes, miniWorkshops, workshops, retreats, seminars. 

Thus, our community needs many organizers to create this abundance. Whether you are trained, enthusiastic, social, or simply organized, please consider PGN as your giant toolbox, with which you can share fun, knowledge, growth, events, connection, opportunities, and a sweet heart.

At PGN, we are all explorers of life together.

Next:

More about The Personal Growth Network

    Quick Links 
    Is Personal Growth Right for You?
    Heartbeat Salons -- Local Gatherings
    How to Offer Your First Event On PGN
    How to reduce the volume of Meetup emails
results.name: Personal Growth Network

Community Boating, Inc. (CBI) is the nation's oldest public sailing center - incorporated in 1946. Located on the Charles River behind the Hatch Shell, members can sail, windsurf, and kayak right in the heart of Boston between the Longfellow and Harvard Bridges.

The mission of CBI is the advancement of sailing for all by minimizing economic and physical obstacles to sailing. In addition, CBI enhances the greater Boston community by using sailing as a vehicle to empower its members to develop independence and self-confidence, improve communication, foster teamwork, and acquire a deeper understanding of community spirit and the power of volunteerism.

This group is for anyone who is interested in learning more about sailing, engaging in watersports activities, meeting new friends, or volunteering with a great community.

The National Association of Asian American Professional (NAAAP) Boston Chapter is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization whose mission is to cultivate and empower leaders for professional excellence, connect accomplished professionals for mutual success, engage and participate with the community-at-large, and inspire leaders to make a meaningful difference in government, education, business, and society.

As part of the NAAAP National organization, NAAAP Boston is the largest and fastest growing Asian American professional organization in Greater Boston. Through its nine committees, members can participate in many activities that bring together other Asian American professionals in the community.

Our history goes back to New York when the first chapter was founded in 1982. Boston founded its chapter in 1986. There are 27 active Chapters and Associate Chapters across the country with a growing membership of over 3000. Currently, NAAAP Boston is one of the largest chapters, with over 350 members. With an active Asian American community, NAAAP Boston is present at many events across the city.

Join NAAAP Boston now!

topics.name: Is Smoking the only way to use Medical Marijuana

results.description:
Hi Everyone. This group is slowly taking on a colorful flavor of personalities.. not a big surprise lol. Our meetings have been slow to start but some of that has to do with health issues, sadly most members suffer from one or many painful chronic health problems. On the up side, we share a common solution that alleviates some of the pain. At this point, We all expect mmj to stay legal.

Anyway, a few guidelines for this group: No advertising on your personal profile. No private emails for networking or directly to individuals for building a patient list. And don't use the comment wall as an opportunity to mention your product. Come to a meeting. That's the purpose of the group! No posting your link on this group site. The sponsor request link is in the left column to see if you match our group needs. Formally, we are an educational group for individuals (not corporate entities). Bringing the public, medical marijuana patients, caregivers and interested parties together for the purpose of discussing use of medical marijuana in New England. If you are considering the option of medical marijuana as a more reasonable alternative to narcotic and prescription medication, then this group will help provide access to other like-minded individuals. If you are a Legal patient through the Department of Health's Medical Marijuana Registry and are looking for support, our group might fit your needs. We are completely neutral and non-judgemental in every aspect of your personal and private lives.

Regarding cannabis use at our events: Be respectful of other members during events. When in doubt, think of cannabis use similar to alcohol use. If you are out of control is anyway then it is uncomfortable for people around you. Unfortunately, our society has a high value on self control. Another consideration is that other members may not have access to products and may be a bit envious of your supply. We only ask that your medical condition is certified in writing by your doctor and that you have obtained the documentation required by the State that permits you to possess medical marijuana.

(Ignore the last profile question and type your favorite color instead) Thanks for joining our group.
results.name: New England Medical Marijuana Discussion Group

results.description:
This group is about getting together after work for a cocktail and a little chit chat. Both men and women, single or married, 40 and up are welcome.

We all have long days; instead of going home and zoning out in front of the TV, stop in and meet for a drink. Socializing is good for the soul and making new friends is a great pick-me-up!

We'll meet once or twice a month at a nice place - there'll be no dive bars in this group. If you prefer virgin cocktails, a.k.a. Shirley Temples or a soda, don't hesitate to join us. We're all about chit-chatting and making friends, not drinking.

You're invited to sit back, relax, and get lost in conversation. Forget about your long day while you enjoy the company of new friends.

Because this is a coed group and we'll be meeting at restaurants and martini bars, please be sure to post a recent photo of yourself and share your first name when signing up. You won't be admitted into the group without it. This is important not only for the safety of our members, but for the simple fact that it's just easier for me to recognize you at events and for us to become friends.

As with other groups, we do have policies so that we treat each other with respect as friends do. Before you sign up, please review the policies of our group under the 'pages' tab which is located on the top of of this page after Home, Members, Photos, etc... You will find the same info you find for other groups such as our 'no-show' and 'guest' policies. These policies are strictly enforced in the best interest for all of our friends in this group.  

These policies are a cinch to follow. Now let's get out there and mix and mingle!

Sharon

Join with confidence. I’m a founder/organizer and event organizer of many other groups with a direct network of over 10,000 members!

Fitness Friends is the largest multi-purpose Meetup fitness group in Boston! We're not just about running, tennis, and rock climbing. We're about everything!

This is not just for singles; however, most of our members are. This group has the "friends first" philosophy and helps us all meet likeminded people. We will do our best not to mix in with the same events as all of the other groups BUT when we do, there will be an effort for our group to find one another so we can congregate as well as mingle with others.

This group will be very much activity-based and if drinking and food are involved, it ideally will be preceded by something else.

I'm confident we can do some good here. So join us in the fun!

Activities of the past and to come:

  • Ladies nights (volunteer needed)
  • Racquetball
  • Tennis
  • Squash
  • Running
  • Rock Climbing
  • Dodgeball
  • Walking
  • Crossfit
  • Martial Arts
  • High-speed go cart racing
  • Black light mini-golf
  • Historical tours
  • Bowling
  • Pool
  • Trivia
  • Wine/Beer Tastings
  • Comedy Shows
  • Karaoke

Code of conduct:

1. It is CRITICAL that you keep your RSVP’s up to date. It creates false expectations of our members, puts vendor relationships at risk, and is just plain rude. So please use that cute red button. It only takes a second. If you can't go in the first place, do nothing.

2. Contacting other members prior to meeting them is seriously frowned upon. This isn't Match.com or a career website. Members leave the group and will never attend an event because of this behavior.

3. While at an event, treat our members AND the staff of venues with respect. Your behavior has an affect on all of us.
results.name: Fitness Friends of Boston (OPEN TO ALL AGES!)

Lets come together believers with faith and the power of prayer. We are praying for the angels of heaven to remove violent behavior out of our neighborhood and community residents.

We are blessing blocks and communities, anointing those blocks with oil. It does not matter what denomination you belong to just that you believe in the power of prayer.

We are asking God the father to send peace angels who will dwell for months in these communities and keep violence away. We believe he will do it and we know he can.

We stand on the promises of Jesus. Matthew18 vs 19 - 20 - Again truly I tell you that if two of you on earth agree about anything they ask for, it will be done for them by my father in heaven. For where two or three gather in my name, there am I with them.

Amen

topics.name: Adults Taking Care of Aging Parents

results.description: This group is for women in their 50's dealing with all that comes with middle age - My hope is this group will serve as a forum for support in dealing with issues like perimenopause/menopause, caring for aging parents, grief and loss of loved ones, facing our own mortality, recent empty nesters, becoming more of who we want to be and improving the quality of our lives. We all have something to offer even if it isn't apparent to us. The direction of the group will be dependent on the members of the group. Some meetings can be open ended while others can be more focused and structured. We can choose a book as a guide (i.e. Cheryl Richardson's Life Makever series is a great tool for this) or not.  The expectation is that members of the group who RSVP to an event will give proper notice if they need to cancel their attendance(i.e. at least 24-48 hours notice).

results.description:
The Boston Data Mining meetup focuses on making data mining accessible to everyone. It aims to be inclusive to all regardless if you are a beginner or expert in statistical modeling, machine learning, data mining, or any of the analytics (business, predictive, etc). Our talks will focus on the practical side of data mining and analytics by showing attendees how to perform data modeling in a variety of modeling environments, both graphical (e.g. Rapidminer) and text-based (R, Python, Julia, etc.)

Our Goals:

• Host talks on a wide range of topics related to data mining.

• Focus talks on the practical side of data mining.

• Goal of most meetings will be build data models that attendees can use themselves

• Make data mining and data analytics accessible to everyone.

• Increase awareness of open source data mining tools

Our Members:

• Any and everyone who is interested in doing data mining and analytics.
results.name: Boston Data Mining

results.description: It's not easy raising children. It can be even more challenging if you are a divorced Dad that had chosen to be an integral part of your kids' lives. MDD is a meet up group devoted to helping Dads be better parents. Peers share experience, connect each other to important services and share friendship.
results.name: Metrowest Divorced Dads

results.description: Our Mission: to educate and empower every girl and woman at every age level, on every skill level, at every income level on computer technology with fun and provide a legacy by giving back and paying it forward. We do this by providing full day Tech Boot Camps, Meetups, Geek Girl for Hire, Speakers, online blogs and help. Our demographics are from 10 years old to 86. Why you should be a part: * You want to learn more about computers, including Social Media, Blogging, Photoshop, Quickbooks, Mac and PC, programming, design, email marketing, Google Docs, and the latest in tech * You want a better job, but need some better skills * You are a techy geek girl who wants to meet and network with other geek girls * You want to be a Speaker at Boot Camp and be part of the Geek Girl for Hire program * You are unemployed and need some help with computers * You are one of those "passed by by technology" and are somewhat embarrassed by it and need a nurturing environment We realize there is a dearth of women in many computer tech areas, and we want to help women and girls get into tech! We hope you will join us and add to the conversation! Visit us at http://www.geekgirlcamp.com or our tech conference information at http://www.geekgirltechcon.com
results.name: Geek Girl - Boston

results.description:
Welcome! You are invited to join us as we explore many different spiritual topics. We look forward to the sharing of everyone's experiences and insights. Hosted by local members of Eckankar.

 


We live in a time of unprecedented interest in spirituality.  Spiritual experiences are no longer the exclusive domain of religious leaders, saints, and mystics.  They are a part of everyday living for millions of people.  And these people have questions:  Are their experiences real?  What do they mean?  How can a person have more experiences of the Divine?

Eckankar offers answers. It is an ancient spiritual teaching and a modern-day religion that offers spiritual techniques and resources for an individual to discover truth through personal experience.

To learn more about Eckankar and receive free books and information, go to www.Eckankar.org

www.eckinmass.org
results.name: North Shore Spiritual Experiences Group

results.description: Come join the "North Shore Meditates " Meetup Group initiated by members of the international Art of Living Foundation. This meetup functions as movement to spread awareness about the benefits of meditation, and hosts meditation and breathing workshops, meditation mixers, and free meditation experience sessions. Most of us are now leading hectic professional and personal lives. In fact, the busier one is the more one has to meditate. Meditation, when used as a daily practice helps one dive inward to the source of joy, energy and creativity and come out into activity more able to practically express these qualities in our lives. Backed by science and personal experience, corporations and other institutions are now offering mediation workshops. CEOs and executives at top companies, including Google, Salesforce and Tupperware state in recent magazine articles that meditation restores balance in their lives, improves sleep and helps to provides them with a competitive edge. North Shore For Meditation is supported by The Art of Living Foundation. Founded in 1981, the Art of Living Foundation is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) educational and humanitarian organization working in consultative status with the United Nations’ Economic and Social Council on initiatives related to health, meditation, education, sustainable development, conflict resolution and disaster relief.
results.name: North Shore Meditates

results.description: This group is for anyone that is planning to compete in an obstacle course / adventure race such as Tough Mudder, Spartan, Warrior Dash, Rugged Maniac, etc. Whether you're a seasoned athlete looking to improve last years finish time or a total newbie that has never ran in a 5k... we can scale a workout to your ability level. As a endurance/triathlon coach and competitive mountain runner I know what it takes to finish some of the toughest races that New England has to offer. All group training sessions are designed to build endurance, strength, and to prepare you for the obstacles that you will encounter on race day.

results.description:

Our members primarily reside in Connecticut with additional Meetup groups in Boston,MA & Rhode Island. The Urban Professionals Network is headquartered out of New Haven, Connecticut serving the major Metropolitan markets of New England; Boston, MA, Providence, RI , Fairfield County, Greater New Haven, and Greater Hartford/Springfield. The frequency of each areas events will be determined by actual member participation and attendance.


Join the Official UPN Mailing List today!

Click Here

Our mission is to deliver unmatched upscale, cultural, and thought provoking events that focus on integrating Connecticut Urban Professionals for the purpose of social, business, and community engagement. If you are a talented, outgoing, and charismatic individual looking to showcase your skills/talents. Please call or text 203.444.2509 as we are currently developing a regional team of UPN co-organizers.

If you have any suggestions or you know good places don't hesitate to share with us. I am looking forward to meet you and share a good international meal! :)

results.description:
Creative writing is exciting. We are more likely to grow as writers when we are in a community with other writers. Writing does not need to be lonely and unproductive, but should be a fulfilling and liberating form of creativity and self-expression.

As a member of The Brighton Writers' Workshop, you can belong to a community of fellow writers who will encourage you in your craft. We typically meet every other week either for a Workshop (writing prompts/exercises) or a Critique (giving feedback to members on their work).

Check out past meetups we've had to get an idea of what we do, and feel free to contact the organizers if you have any questions. We're looking forward to meeting you!

results.description: EAA106 is the largest and one of the most active Experimental Aircraft Association (EAA) chapters in New England (201 members in MA, NH, RI, CT, and beyond - as of 12/31/12). ~1/3 of our members have built or are building their own aircraft, ~1/3 are pilots of production aircraft (including CFIs & ATPs), and many are student pilots, aviation veterans, mechanics, and aviation enthusiasts! We host monthly aviation presentations/seminars covering a wide array of topics, host an annual fly-in with ~ a dozen free seminars, the NorthEast LSA (Light Sport Aircraft) Expo, New England tour stops of EAA's B-17 and 1929 Ford Tri-Motor, fly youth (ages 8-17) for free flight experiences as “Young Eagles”, and award an annual youth scholarship. Most events (not all) are at the Lawrence Municipal Airport (LWM), No. Andover, MA. EAA106 is an educational 501(c)(3) public charity based in Massachusetts. We invite you to check us out, then JOIN and SUPPORT us! www.106.EAAchapter.org

We'll hear a little bit from our featured businesses, enjoy whatever food, drink or activity is being spotlighted, and leave plenty of time for relaxed conversation.

results.description:
Code for Boston is a Code for America Brigade - a volunteer civic innovation organization created by Boston-area developers, designers, urban planners, data geeks, and researchers with an interest in solving civic and social problems through the use of creative technology.

We feel that Boston was the driving force in the creation of Government 1.0; we should be leading the way for Gov 2.0. We seek to leverage the revolutionary spirit of New England to help open, improve, and engage our local governments across the Greater Boston area, and to pursue projects that solve real problems in our communities.

In conjunction with our fellow Brigades across the country, we aim to provide a focal point for community-based civic innovation and technology projects in the Boston area. We meet weekly at the Cambridge Innovation Center in Kendall Square, from 7 - 9:30pm. Please review our group's Code of Conduct before attending.

Homepage: codeforboston.org

Meeting notes: codeforboston.hackpad.com

GitHub: codeforboston

But when you suggest it, you receive death stares from your fellow nerds? Well no longer, because this group is for you. results.description:
Search marketing on Google AdWords or organic SEO can be a big waste of time and money if you don’t get the details right.

Digital Marketing Show and Tell is for anyone working on a search marketing campaign who would like to compare notes. Our members are both experienced and novice search marketers who come to get answers to their questions, seek advice to specific problems and learn new strategies from their peers because there is no need to work in isolation. Beginners are welcome.

Each month, we huddle up to share results, brainstorm solutions and review each other’s campaigns. So, bring your laptop and your questions for the group.

This Meetup is a working group run by the search marketing heads of three Boston area digital marketing agencies - Including Dale Bertrand (Founder of Greenway Media), Will Brierly (Owner at Snowrunner Productions) and Guiseppe Frustaci (Principal at InnoVox Marketing).
results.name: Digital Marketing Show and Tell

results.description:
The Civil Air Patrol is a civilian, volunteer organization and the official auxiliary of the United States Air Force (www.gocivilairpatrol.com). We volunteer our time to train for and execute missions when called upon by the Air Force as well as State and Federal Government agencies.

Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com/hanscom.squadron

This group is sponsored by the Hanscom Composite Squadron (www.hanscomcap.org) that runs its operations from a dedicated facility at Hanscom Air Force Base in Bedford, MA. The primary missions involve search and rescue, disaster recovery and photographic flights in addition to aerospace education and cadet training.

 

You do not need to be a pilot to join. There are air crew qualifications you can obtain without being a pilot (i.e., Mission Scanner, Photographer and Observer) that will be needed in the airplane during training and actual missions. There are ground operations and Mission Base operations positions as well.

 

As a relevant example of what we do, the Civil Air Patrol was tasked with providing aerial photographs of the entire coast from Maine to Carolina following hurricane Sandy and Hanscom air crews participated in photographing the coast of Mass, the Cape and Islands.

 

We will schedule Open House Meetup Events periodically that all are welcome to attend. 

Contact the squadron commander for additional info (shood1 at aol dot com)
results.name: Civil Air Patrol: Hanscom Composite Squadron

results.description: The Analytics Professionals group was created to provide a forum for those in Boston to share tips, tricks and knowledge about using an analytic platform such as ParAccel to drive business value. With the variety and volume of data available these days from a number of sources (RDBMS, web logs, sensor data, social media, etc.) we're interested in discussing how you begin to make sense of all this data and derive real business value from it.
results.name: Boston Analytics Professionals

topics.name: Spanish Play for Moms and kids

results.description:
This group is for parents who want to increase their childrens exposure to spanish. Native speakers, non native speakers and English only parents  are welcomed. We can meet 1-2 times per month at different parks, beaches, restaurants and homes of various members.

Did you know,,,

Feb. 20, 2013 — A study conducted at the University of Granada and the University of York in Toronto, Canada, has revealed that bilingual children develop a better working memory -which holds, processes and updates information over short periods of time- than monolingual children. The working memory plays a major role in the execution of a wide range of activities, such as mental calculation (since we have to remember numbers and operate with them) or reading comprehension (given that it requires associating the successive concepts in a text).

and .....

Children who grow up learning to speak two languages are better at switching between tasks than children who learn to speak only one language, according to a study....

and.....

Not so long ago bilingualism was thought to be bad for your brain. But it looks more and more like speaking more than one language could help save you from Alzheimer's disease.

http://www.npr.org/blogs/health/2013/01/10/169066535/speaking-more-than-one-language-could-prevent-alzheimers
results.name: Boston Spanish Playgroup for infants and toddlers

results.description: Welcome to the Boston Jaspersoft User Group. results.name: Boston Sports + Fitness Technology

results.description:
Welcome to Coming Off Psych Drugs, a mutual support group for people thinking about, in the process of, or with past experiences of coming off or reducing psychiatric drugs.  Our sole purpose is to provide support for each other by sharing our own experiences of psych drug withdrawal and listening to others do the same.  This group is founded upon a fierce belief in the human spirit, and in our innate capacity as human beings to heal from trauma and to regenerate.

Coming Off Psych Drugs is unaffiliated with any religion, institution, 12-step program, medical practice, or ideology.  This group is not therapy or counseling, and nothing that is said in this space should be taken as medical or personal advice.  We have no leaders and claim expertise only on our own individual experiences.  We respect the right of each person to decide for themselves whether or not their medications are helpful, and we welcome people interested in reducing some but not all of their meds.  Coming Off Psych Drugs is founded upon acceptance of each person’s unique experience of and relationship to the mental health system, and we strive to keep our ears, minds, and hearts open to one another.  We ask that what is said in this space, stays in this space.  Coming Off Psych Drugs will remain forever free, and operating costs will be based on donations gathered at each meeting.

Because we believe that spreading awareness about coming off psychiatric drugs is important for society as a whole, we welcome friends and family of those on psychiatric drugs to attend our group, after they’ve introduced themselves and shared their reasons for attending.  However, we ask that only those with personal experience of psych drugs, past or present, speak in the group.

*If you are uncomfortable using your real name here in the online group, please feel free to sign up using a pseudonym :)
results.name: Coming Off Psych Drugs mutual support group

results.description:
Join the Microsoft Store for regularly scheduled workshops and events on relevant business topics and technology.

Each month we will offer different workshops on how technology can improve your small business, professional organization, company, or non-profit.  Committed to community and business development The Microsoft Store features a fully equipped theater with a 103” TV with presenter PC, sound system, wireless microphone, and seating for 30+.

Set within an interactive high tech environment where we encourage public play, networking and development opportunities for all. This environment allows for community and business partners to conduct public or private workshops, presentations, and other events on various community, business and educational topics by leveraging our technology, products and services to deliver their message.

The Microsoft Store Theatre is located in the Natick Mall at 1245 Worcester Street (off Route 9). Offered to the community for complimentary use please contact the Community Development Specialist at Lisa.Casillo@microsoft.com to schedule your next workshop, networking or special event!

results.description:
Welcome to Japanese Flower Arranging!

Japanese Flower Arranging is my passion! I lived in Japan for 12 years. I am happy to host the Japanese Flower Arranging Meetup.

We meet to learn about and how to create beautiful Japanese flower arrangements. Learn about this beautiful and tranquil aspect of Japanese Culture. Attend Ikebana International and other related events including Japanese culture and dining in the Greater Boston area.

Of all Japan's traditional arts, the most practiced today is Ikebana---the art of Japanese flower arrangement. In basic form, an Ikebana arrangement follows a fixed pattern: a triangle of 3 points. Emphasis is placed on linear perfection, color harmony, space and form. Ikebana usually contains the flowers and foliage of the season. There are numerous styles of Ikebana, ranging from the traditional to contemporary modern. Come, learn and enjoy!
results.name: Japanese Flower Arranging

results.description: This group is for dance enthusiasts, dancers, students, teachers and basically everyone that has SOMETHING to do with dance. results.description:
What?

We are a group of bold, quirky tipsters who dispense advice in public spaces throughout the city, 25 cents at a time. Any kind of advice, to anyone that asks. Someone drops us a quarter and asks us a question, then we we do our best to help.

Why?

Because we love making people happy, talking to anyone in our city, offering our view points, giving our outside opinion, and hearing all the stories. We do this because every once in awhile we provide direction to those who truly need it.

Why do you charge a quarter?

It's just a symbol. It promotes more of a connection and buy-in to the process, and we will always return the money if the advisee is not satisfied. Collected funds are used for group expenses and promotion.

Are we qualified to do this?

Just as much as you are. So come out and join us!
results.name: advice4quarter-Cambridge

results.description: Let's make a movie. The name of the group really says it all. Lets make a movie and find other people who are interested in doing the same thing. This will be a group for people who want to have fun and make something tangible. You do not have to be an expert or even be knowledgeable in any aspect of film-making, you should just want to be involved in someway. We can start with shorts and then expand to a feature film. There are so many roles to fill when making a movie so come participate.  We will provide training, you provide your involvement. If you live in the Greater Worcester to Central Mass Area, come join us.

results.description: The Greater Boston Network Users Group, BNUG for short, provides an education and technical forum for professionals and those interested in computer networking and related technologies. We hold (free) monthly meetings on technical topics, and that provide an opportunity to meet other professionals to ask questions, get answers, share ideas and information. BNUG has been in existence since its founding in 1986. Our meetings are free and open to everyone interested in joining us. No obligation. No hidden fees (we work off your optional, unpressured donations). No sales meetings -- our meetings are technically oriented.
