results.description: One Heart Zen: Learn & join in Zen Meditation (Zazen) near Union Square. Whether you are a long time practitioner, a recent beginner, or just thinking about it, you are welcome. Weekday mornings, Monday through Friday at 6:50 AM for 40 minutes. Tuesday evenings from 7:30 PM to 9:30 PM for zazen instruction, zazen, and talks and discussions on Zen and Buddhist practice. I’m John. I’ve been living in this neighborhood for 17 years and sitting zazen for 40 years. A somewhat unorthodox Soto Zen Priest, I teach meditation, lead meditation retreats, give talks about Zen and Buddhism, facilitate discussions and give individual practice interviews and discussion.

results.description: A social community centered around cooking and conversations, where friends and soon-to-be friends cook and talk together while enjoying tasty dishes. How it works. Bring the ingredients necessary for everyone to try a little bit of your dish, grill, extra knives & cutting boards (if you have them) and a bottle of wine per person. When you arrive 1) Check in 3) Pour yourself some wine 4) Start making your dish 5) Drink some more wine 6) Help your new friends 7) Bang on a pot when your dish is finished 8) Don't forgot....try some dishes, share your dish, and try not to start yourself on fire 9) Wrap up some food to take home 10) Everyone helps clean up This has been an incredible success, cultivating some of the best vibes we've felt in a while. We started at 18 people and pushed the chaos to 60, which somehow still works. Some dish ideas of what was made in the past; Vietnamese Summer Rolls, Gazpacho, Watermelon Basil Mint Feta Salad, Week-long marinated Pork, Portobello Mushroom Burgers, Curried Squash Soup, etc.
results.name: Chaos Cooking (Boston)

Don't shoot film? That's ok! Everyone with an interest in photography (yes, even digital!), or analog things, is welcome at our events. Just don't be suprised if you find yourself reaching for a film camera again when you get home. ;-)

results.description: Beantown Cornhole .....Are you done laughing? Haha. Yes...If you are not aware of this game, we admit that the name seems odd...BUT, it is the real name for the most exciting, fun, and competitive indoor/outdoor game that men and women are falling in love all over the country and beyond! In other states, Cornhole is known as Baggo, Bags, and Tailgate Toss. Cornhole was born in Western Ohio. The origin of the name is simple: 6" Bags filled with corn, that you throw into a hole. Sounds easy right? Well, although it takes about 2 minutes to learn, it can take a long time to master. Many people love playing the game, because there are not many sports that you can play, while holding a beer or drink in your hand. It has become a tailgating staple, and a back yard cook-out favorite. Beantown Cornhole LLC is a company that is dedicated to spreading this game to others in not only Boston, but all over Massachusetts and New England. We have weekly Events, Tournaments, Leagues, and more. We offer fundraising opportunities to charities and non-profit organizations. We also provide rentals and even sell the highest quality Cornhole Boards and Bags that you can find. Our goal is to spread the love of this game, through meet up...to meet and make friends with others who love to have fun while meeting others.
results.name: Beantown Cornhole - New England's 1st Cornhole Meetup Group

results.description:
This group is for busy city dwellers with an active interest in recreational and sporting cycling. This group was created to help folks stuck in the city in summer to meet up, cycle together, and have fun.

Here’s club’s charter and other useful information.

Club’s Charter:

  • All regular trips will depart from Boston’s North End.
    There are plenty of bike trails that start right in the city and connect with other trails outside of the city. Let’s get on our bikes and start riding and avoid the hassle of driving to the bike trail.
  • We will have at least one weekly re-occurring trip scheduled starting in May.
    Summer is short. Let’s try to ride our bicycles at least once a week!
    You don’t have to commit to the weekly schedule but reoccurring event will be there to keep up the riding spirit.
  • We prefer paved bike trails to roads and will be picking safe routes with minimal on the road riding.
  • We will have special events in summer and will explore trails outside of the city including Cape Cod Rail Trail, and others
  • Club will organize free weekend sailing events in the Boston Harbor at no cost to members.
  • Our rides will be recreational for the most part with an average duration of 3-4 hours and 20-40 miles.


Meeting Location:
https://maps.google.com/maps/myplaces?hl=en&ll=42.366471,-71.050558&spn=0.002965,0.013937&ctz=240&t=m&layer=c&cbll=42.366477,-71.050558&panoid=aANaZOfmJeKyKMPkl6OjAw&cbp=11,169.28,,0,2.29&num=10&z=17&source=gplus-ogsb
results.name: Boston’s North End Cycling Club

results.description:
Who Should Join:

Local and International professionals who want to learn and share ideas on how to be clearly understood and how to clearly understand others in the global workplace.
Managers, Human Resource Professionals, Toastmaster's Members, Executive Coaches and all others interested in communication:
Come share ideas and gather new ideas that help your valued team members to effectively communicate their great ideas.

Why? If you are in or manage a group of Global professionals, you understand the challenges of confusion necessitating meetings after the meeting, emails after the meeting and the lost time it entails.

If you speak with a regional accent or style or the accent of a first language and still get misunderstood, Or  whether you are an individual business person, in sales, a scientist, technology, engineering or physics professional that struggles to get their great ideas understood correctly.

We will have some ideas to share.  And hopefully you will have ideas to share as well!

This group is for you.

You've earned the degrees, now it's time to really Communicate your Brilliance! Whether you are from Medford or Mumbai, Chicago or Shanghai: If you want to learn, share and practice strategies to increase your skills in speech clarity, develop confident voicing, speak like a broadcast journalist, lead a team or network successfully, come bring your ears and your ideas:

I've started this group as I've found that I have learned a lot from clients and managers. Let's help each other! We'll practice some real world strategies as well as sharing some strategies that have helped us.
results.name: MetroWest Boston Professionals Presentations, Voice & Accent

results.description:
Pretty simple boys and girls: This group is for 21-30 ish people who like to pregame, postgame, tailgate, and just walk around public places with a sweet buzz.

 

So grab your spiked 7-11 cup, sports bottle, soda bottle, or coffee tumbler and enjoy any of the following and other ideas to come: People watching, street performers, window-shopping, annoying complete strangers, picking up guys or girls, recruiting complete strangers to join us, Museum of Fine Arts, Isabella Gardner Museum, Museum of Science, The Aquarium, riding the MBTA together, and most importantly—having ridiculous conversation with each other, vendors, and complete strangers.

 

For our own and the public’s safety—everything will absolutely, positively, be T-accessible. After walking around for a bit, those interested can go to a bar, restaurant, or whatever to party a little more and/or satisfy the desire for munchies.

 

This is open to anyone over 21 and younger than 40. This is not a singles group and it’s a judgment-free zone. Absolutely anyone is welcome as long as you plan to partake in the root of this activity.

 

So don’t kid yourself or be shy. You like to do this and your prudish friends or partners hate it when you do it out with them. This is a place where we can be ourselves for a change.

 

For those of you new to this and unfamiliar how to break the law in style--not to worry; we will teach you.

 

I will be setting this group up with sufficient privacy settings in order to protect the members, while still making it possible for new people to join. Looking forward to meeting up!

 

-Matthew

This is an open minded spiritual group that offers a safe place for women to come heal, learn and grow. For thousands of years women have collected in sacred circles under the moon to learn, share, heal and inspire one another. This group will echo the sacred circles of the past! We will gather in a healing sanctuary away from daily life to explore healing, spirituality, chakras, angels, reiki, meditation, psychic development, crystal healing and more. I have been offering workshops and gatherings for women for over 15 years assisting them with their healing and spiritual paths, to help them find their own way towards balance, empowerment, inner peace and joy! 


About the organizer...

Trisha Matthies started this meetup group. She is also the founder and owner of The Healing Moon Wellness Center, LLC originally from Norwood, now located in Foxboro.  Trisha is a Crystal Healer and Certified Hypnotherapist and Reiki Master Teacher in both the Usui and Karuna Systems. As a child Trisha recognized her ability to “feel” the emotions and energies of those around her. As a young adult she embraced her intuitive gifts and began to follow her spiritual calling as an empath, medium, and energy healer. Trisha specializes in assisting women and children on their own paths towards  peace, balance, wellness, and enlightenment.

For over twenty years, she has studied various healing techniques allowing her to practice a gentle blend of healing methods utilizing Reiki, Shamanism, Tibetan Singing Bowls, Guided Meditation, Aromatherapy,  Hypnotherapy, Crystal Healing, and Color Therapy.

results.description:
PyLadies Boston is for women and genderqueer individuals who are either Python programmers or aspiring Python programmers in the Boston area. Or even if you have no clue what Python is, but you're interested in learning to program. It's a great language to learn if you have no prior programming experience.

Our goal is to get a larger number of women coding and involved in the open source community. Developers and aspiring developers only, please. We encourage all women to come out to our meetups. If anything is said during a meetup or in any PyLadies Boston forum, please contact the organizers. We want this to be a welcoming environment for all attendees and ask that everyone be treated respectfully. We follow the PyLadies Code of Conduct.

Join us on IRC! #pyladies-boston

Pyladies Boston is for women and genderqueer individuals only. Men who join will be removed from the group. Nothing personal. If you're interested in learning more about why we are women-only, read the articles in the "Why Women Only?" section on our resources page.

Please note: We highly discourage solicitation from recruiters unless explicitly invited or are sponsoring an event.  We are here to learn, to hack, and support women in the Python developers' community. Job postings are welcome on our forum.

What to expect at our meetups:

Presentation nights (Monthly meetings): These will be presentations put on by group members and other women (and the rare man) who are in Boston's programming community. We welcome talks about any relevant subject... it does not have to be strictly Python! We will not generally be installing things. However, feel free to email the organizers (boston[at]pyladies[dot]com) anytime if you are having trouble getting setup for a meeting. We also get there about 30 minutes early as well and are happy to help before (or after!) the meetup. The expected level of knowledge is just basic Python. Questions are always welcome, but if it's really basic, we will ask you if we can answer it later. If you can, also come grab a drink with us after the meetup!

Beginner meetups: Bring on your install problems! This is 100% about making sure beginners are up and running. Our beginner meetups are weekly (alternating Saturday and Sunday) and are project based. Don't have a project? No problem! You can still come and we'll help you get started.

Hack Days: We like building things together! Open to suggestions as to what we should build. We have coded our website during a hack day and have plans to build Django apps in other hack days. In general, we'll spend at least two hours trouble shooting installs, then the next four actually building something cool! Also a good place to have install problems.
results.name: PyLadies Boston

results.description:
The Divine Office of Canonical Hours, not to be confused with “hours” on the clock, rather related to the time of day such Morning Prayer, Mid-Day Prayers, Evening Prayer, Vespers (Night Time Prayer), etc. is prayed in Christianity “wherever two or three are gathered” in His name. It is considered “The Prayer of the Church”—the Church being the Mystical Body of Christ—“It is he who is head of the body, the church” – Colossians 1:18-.
 We meet, pray and live. Join us to also have fun, work, to volunteer and be happy. Eternally designated through Divine Providence, the time, place and activity before, during and after praying are consecrated to His Holy Will. Be encouraged to change and be uniquely responsive to His Will and, in a humble way, open to Divine Inspiration. All of life in Christ is open to the category of possibility. Meet new people with Traditional formation in the Catholic Church who actively engage in life through prayer and work. All are welcome.
results.name: LIturgical HourS

This series alternates between 90 minute Meditations and 3 hour Workshops. The former consists of guided journeying, and the latter incorporates an educational piece, bringing folks up to speed as to the Crystal Concentrics way of using Power Stones for focus, relaxation, and personal development.

We come together periodically to share what we know and expand both our individual and collective healing capabilities with Kyle Russell's leadership. A long-time collector and practitioner of crystal energy work, Russell also sees clients individually, and has innovated the Crystal Concentric Reading modality of assessing a person's situation, and what might be appropriate energies to bring into their lives as they take their next steps towards fulfilling their destiny.

Attendance ranges from 4-14 people at these events - so don't judge the turnout by Meetup's tally alone - as he also has his own following, and a substantial presence on Facebook, both as Crystal Concentrics & Power Stone Crystals (his For Sale items, page). You may also wish to check out Russell's main site www.CrystalConcentrics.com.

results.description:
Startup Product, a movement for product excellence.

Startup Product welcomes everyone passionate about product excellence, regardless of title, industry, or stage of growth, to come together to share, learn and talk about what it really takes to produce products that people love and how to build sustainable businesses and revenue streams based on product excellence.

Everyone is encouraged to contribute their point of view, workshop their product dilemma, share their lessons learned in the process of shepherding products from idea to inception to build to launch and beyond. We need a place where all perspectives and orientations of what the product requires are welcome. Everyone who sheds light on specific areas that are essential to product excellence are welcome to present and contribute to the conversation.

There is a lifecycle that every product, startup, idea and project passes through to be realized. Focusing on where the product is in its lifecycle enables a conversation that brings us all together on what will serve the product most to arrive at product/market fit, sustain growth and generate revenue streams.

We welcome people from all disciplines and stages of product evolution:

  • Product managers, product owners, Scrum Masters
  • Product Marketers, Agile Marketers,
  • Growth Hackers
  • Designers
  • UX professionals
  • Founders, funders, CEOs
  • Software developers
  • Community managers
  • Customer Support & Service
  • Content strategists
  • Business Analysts
  • Project managers
  • Innovation leaders

And anyone who loves to talk and think about products! Come share what you've learned and learn from others about the art AND discipline of all the facets involved in the process of breathing life into a product, managing actionable goals and producing scalable businesses...

We encourage open debate so the group can learn from us and each other. StartUp Product events may be led by a guest speaker or a panel of experts ideally representative of the local community.

“StartUp Product Talks” is also a networking function. An opportunity for anyone passionate about product quality and what it takes to delight customers to come together to meet, interact, and network. The ideal environment within which sharing and learning can flourish and complement the knowledge base for all on a peer to peer basis.

We’re keen for Product People across different industries to meet up and exchange business cards. You never know where your next job offer will come from.

Visit our site & contribute to the blog: http://startupproduct.com

Subscribe to the Startup Product newsletter: http://bit.ly/WtN2oY Totally follow us on twitter: @StartupProduct

Continue the conversation between face to face Startup Product events,

- Participate in regular Global Product Management Talk broadcasts with thought leaders discussing all aspects of product excellence http://www.blogtalkradio.com/prodmgmttalk

- Check out discussions in the linkedin group: http://linkd.in/ugZrJR

- Read crowdsourced content from product related events: http://storify.com/prodmgmttalk

--->Bring Startup Product Talks and Summit to your community! Join us at http://www.meetup.com/StartupProduct/

 

"Startup Product" is a trademark owned by Cindy F. Solomon
results.name: Startup Product Talks Boston

You should join if you would like to go to a star party and look through a variety of telescopes and see objects in the night sky.  Or maybe you like hearing lectures about interesting, updated topics from notable engineers and scientists.

Not your thing?

How about some hands-on/'maker' type events?

If you decide to join, you can expect us to list as many events as we learn about in Boston and beyond.  We'd love your help of course.  And, if you become a member, you'll be expected to actually participate in something we list!

This is important.

It's not a 'meetup' if you never attend an event. 

Please be sure to R.S.V.P. 'YES' if you intend to go.  A 'NO' or no answer will be considered the same.  If you happen to show up at an event with limited resources in spite of that, you may be turned away and we'll all be sad about that!

Mainly, we want to show you ways you can personally and directly participate in this exciting area and have FUN doing it!

If you ever need anything from us, do call or write.  We'll include contact information anytime you join and we send you the traditional 'welcome' message - usually within a day or two.

The idea of the OSF Meetup group is to bring like minded people together to openly share ideas, contacts, and expertise with each other for the benefit of the entire meetup community, and our individual projects.

The continuous emergence of new technologies and products are constantly changing how businesses are being conducted. Whether you represent a fashion brand, e-commerce portal, boutique, or fashion media outlet - we all have our own area of expertise. Keeping up with all the tech tools, unique brands, and resources available to us can be daunting - however, it does not have to be! Every 6-8 weeks we will organize an event that will make learning and collaborating enjoyable and light hearted.

Events will include panel discussions, social mixers, and activities geared towards educating our community and uncovering collaborative opportunities within our member base. Panel discussions will cover various aspects of business development, and will consist of "experts" in their respective fields (Technology, Merchandising, Sourcing, Branding, Social Media, photography, SEO, etc).

Join our group to keep in the loop. We look forward to meeting, learning, and growing with everyone! If you have any questions or are interested in sitting on a panel - feel free to contact us, and we will be more than happy to discuss!

Whether it is sharing ideas, sharing referrals, networking, or just hanging out, we all thrive on the flow of ideas, people and relationships.

results.description: Join other women for discussions on an eclectic mix of fiction and non-fiction books. We will meet once a month - usually the evening of the first Tuesday - at a member's home on the North Shore. The North Shore Page Turners will be a very dynamic group of women who share one thing in common: an enthusiasm for books. Each month, members read a particular book, chosen by the whole group or by the Organizer, and meet to share observations, insights, and personal thoughts about it. Meetings are devoted to various genres, both contemporary and classic. The club's members may represent a variety of backgrounds and literary tastes, bringing wonderful diversity to each book discussion. The North Shore Page Turners Club will hopefully thrive on both the celebration of literature and the camraderie of its readers. More importantly, the club values the ideas of its members, allowing everyone a chance to suggest book selections and other ideas for making this club a lively group to participate in. I had established a similar book club while living in San Francisco and met some wonderful friends and fellow readers. I am hoping this east coast north shore version, will inspire inspired new and ongoing interest in reading. The club will read everything from historical fiction and literary works to thrillers and graphic novels. Thanks to its members, the club will aim to be an engaging book interest group, discussion forum, and social club all rolled into one. The mission of the North Shore Page Turners Club is simple: provide an opportunity to explore the excitement of literature, one of humankind's oldest forms of leisure, and to meet like-minded people along the way. The book for each month will be chosen by a mixture of voting and consensus. Our discussions include both the book itself and the issues it raises. They are lively, informal, and respectful of everyone's view. We will be an enthusiastic bunch of women who love books and we look forward to meeting you!
results.name: North Shore Page Turners

results.description:
Who We Are:

Awesome, fun, self-confident, stylish young women  who want to expand their social circle and develop real, genuine, friendships with people who have similar interests.

So what is this whole "outgoing introverts" part about?

Pretty much just what it says: women who identify as introverts, but also know how to turn on the charm and even if they don't go out every night, know how to enjoy a lively social atmosphere when once in awhile they do go all out.

I think we all desire a deeper connection with the people around us. We are hoping that the contradictory nature of "outgoing introverts," resonates with and speaks to you. Our hope is that this group will attract individuals who understand what that means.

What kind of events do we offer?

We are looking for a group of friends to be active with - and explore. We try to offer a range of "quieter" opportunities together - yoga, hikes, coffee dates, potlucks, and even pub trivia (it's can be a relatively quiet bar, we swear!) We also grab dinner and drinks together, check out different neighborhoods, and maybe even go for a run.

If you have an idea for a Meetup, schedule it! Unsurprisingly, this is the best possible way to find those other members with similar interests!On that same note though, because we all consider ourselves "outgoing introverts," we might require a little more recharge time, and we might all be a little more fulfilled by spending time together creating real connections.

Housekeeping: 

Due to the costs of running a group, we are charging $5/year fee. You will have 30 days to trial the group to see if you want to continue.
results.name: OUTGOING INTROVERTS. connections with like-minded ladies.

results.description:
Welcome!

This group is for those in their 20s and 30s dealing with the emotional rollercoaster ride that comes from separation or divorce.  The purpose of this group is to provide emotional support and moral.  Our main means of interacting and supporting each other is through a twice-monthly meeting.  Details regarding our meetings are only disclosed to members.

Each group meeting is facilitated by nonprofessionals – others who have been through the ups and downs that come with separation or divorce.  We are simply a group of concerned people helping people.

We are a “first-come, first serve” group (if your estranged or former spouse wants to join at any point, they will respectfully be turned away and directed to join another support group in the area.)

Safety and Privacy: We take the safety and privacy of all our group members very seriously.  The Meetup settings are designed so that group events and members are only seen by people inside the group.

    For the safety of all members, we REQUIRE a face picture in your meetup profile.

    It is recommended that members NOT meet unknown members outside of group meetings and group events.

    Those that do not comply with our safety recommendations will be BLOCKED from the group.

Social Opportunities: There are social opportunities that take place in addition to our regular support meetings, if you choose to participate.  Many find that it’s healthy to get out, be active, and interact with others – it combats the tendency toward isolation & depression that comes with separation or divorce, and reinforces that there is life (fun, laughter, joy, community) after separation or divorce.

    We REQUIRE that you participate in a Regular Support Meeting or Coffee and Conversation Meeting BEFORE participating in the social events.

    It is important for all members to understand that this is NOT a dating group.  Unwelcomed advances are NOT acceptable behavior and those that do not comply will be BLOCKED from the group.

Separation and divorce are very difficult and painful, and members commonly find comfort in meeting others who know what the divorce/separated experience is all about – you’ll quickly find that you are not alone! Tremendous bonds of friendship have been forged and continue beyond the scope of the group (the comment is often made that people wish they had found this group sooner).  Several members who have gone through the divorce process continue to stay active in the group because they feel that they have something to share with others who are going through this phase in their life.

We hope you will join us.
Co-Organizers
results.name: Boston 20s/30s Separated & Divorced Support Group

results.description:
NSS IS A MEMBER-ORIENTED GROUP.

The North Shore Social group is open to everyone. Whether you're Attached or Single, come make new friends! The NSS group organizes fun Social Activities throughout the North Shore and Beyond. We host Social Events for those of you just looking to make some new friends and we host Singles Events for those of you looking for that someone special to sweep you off your feet. It is up to you to decide which events are for you. I am hoping with NSS to create a Member Oriented Community by bringing together people that love life and want to share that with others. Hopefully through this group you will make good friends and just maybe for those of you looking, meet that someone special.

I realize it is hard for one person to do everything alone, so if you are an ACTIVE MEMBER and you are interested in becoming an Event Host just email me:

Northshoresocial01@gmail.com

1) Active Event Hosts/Members are considered members that attend some events, keep their RVSPs up to date and pay the voluntary $16.50 yearly member dues.

2) All events on NSS calendar must have someone acting as the Event Host. No events with out a Host will be allowed. The whole purpose of North Shore Social Meetup is that members sit together and interact. It is not for people to just randomly arrive at venues and sit alone, just for the purpose of promoting the venues and businesses.

3) Any active Event Host/Member can Host/suggest an event free from personal profit. For all other types of events please contact Eirini Kay for approval. Our Members trust in the NSS is # 1 priority.

4) The $16.50 annual Members Dues help cover the costs that the Meetup site charges to host our NSS group. Eirini Kay personally covers all these expenses every month out of her own pocket to keep this group going. Dues can be payed online with credit card by clicking on the $16.50/year Manager under Members Dues. You can also pay Eirini Kay in person with cash/check at an event we are both attending or you can mail a check made out to: North Shore Social, 56 Peabody St 1E, Salem, Mass 01970.

5) All Event Hosts/members are required to: Have a clear photo of themselves in their profile. This makes it easier for the Event Host to find people at events and vsv. Even though our events have dozens of people or more in attendance, to the venue we are all one person. Your behavior affects us all. Please be respectful of our members and those who work with us.

http://www.meetup.com/help/How-do-I-add-and-manage-my-photos/

6) Attendance policy: If you sign up to attend an event and your plans change, please be sure to change your RSVP. It misleads members and the venues into believing more people will attend. Members who no show are subject to removal from the group at the discretion of Eirini Kay.

DISCLAIMER: During all events, Members are responsible for themselves. The Organizers and Event Hosts are not responsible for the safety of the participants. We will try our best to prevent accidents, but are not responsible or liable if something happens to you during your membership with NSS. By joining the group, you acknowledge this. Thank you for joining us.

Be safe, yours truly Eirini Kay!

results.description:
Want to lean more about photography from fun, friendly, and professional photography instructors? Want to meet new people, take great photos, and have a ton of fun at the same time? Boston Interactive Photography Workshops is the group for you!

Our fun and friendly photography group offers classes for all levels of photographers - from the novice who just bought their first camera and can't find the power button, to the seasoned pro who wants to hone their skills and meet new people.   

All of our classes are organized by Remember Forever Photography and include professional instruction from our veteran photographers, and a free course workbook with notes and lessons from class. Best of all, when you sign up through Meetup, all of our classes are half off the retail price!

So grab your camera and bring some friends for a fun and memorable photo experience! We have 5 star reviews on Yelp, Tripadvisor and Travelzoo! Check out our website as well at www.rememberforever.co

Frequently Asked Questions

1.  Help! I can't find my instructor/don't know where we're meeting?

After you sign up for one of our Meetups, you should shortly receive an email from Remember Forever Photography with directions to your meeting spot and contact information for your instructor for the day.  If you don't receive an email from us, give our business office a call at 646.736.3231 and we'll be happy to put you in touch with your instructor or send you another copy of your confirmation email. Most of our instructors also have the Meetup.com app, so you can send them a direct message as well if you need to.


2. Can I just pay you in cash when I get to class?

Unfortunately, we can't accept cash for tax purposes. Sorry! Most of our instructors can process credit cards on site, but we really appreciate it if you sign up through Meetup first so we get an accurate headcount on who's coming to class.


3. What do I do if it's raining/snowing/hurricaning on the day of my Meetup?

We'll notify everyone by email as soon as possible if we feel we need to cancel a Meetup due to the weather.  If we do need to cancel, we'll automatically reschedule you to the next available Meetup or any Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value.  Check out each individual Meetup for for more info on our refund policy.  


4. Why do you need at least three students enrolled to run a Meetup? And what happens if we don't get enough students signed up. 

Having at least three students per Meetup ensures that we cover the cost of liability insurance for our workshops and also ensures we can pay our awesome staff photographers a fair wage. 

If we don't have enough students to run a Meetup, we'll notify you as soon as possible and get you signed up for the next available Meetup, or any other Meetup of your choice with equal or lower value. 


5.  I don't see any other students signed up.  Does this mean my Meetup is canceled?

Maybe not! We get students signing up for our courses from several sources in addition to our Meetup group. Unless we notify you otherwise, we more than likely have enough students enrolled to run as scheduled.


Still have questions? Feel free to give us a call at 646.736.3231 or drop us an email at info@rememberforever.co

results.description:
This group is for solo** parents and their children who would like to get together in the great outdoors to connect with other like-minded people.

 

If your family enjoys tent camping, deep connections, having fun, playing games, being active, having intelligent, thought provoking discussions, sharing stories around the campfire and being, in general, open to life, this might be the group for you.

 

It's for people who understand the gifts of spending intergenerational time together i.e. this is a group that encourages the kids and the adults to hang together for at least some of the time.

 

Solo** means anyone who has the kids by themselves e.g. single parents, or parents who might be partnered but the partner does not want to camp or can not go camping for whatever reason (e.g. work commitments). However, we certainly do not want to discriminate against both parents joining so if the other partner wants to join for some of the time, of course they can but this group is primarily geared to solo parents and their kids.

Here's a list of things we personally think would make for a good fit:

*Kids are respectful and well-mannered.


*Adults are responsible but flexible.


*Sense of humor is appreciated.


*The family has an openness to new experiences.


*Able to have intelligent discussions.


*Valuing activity - taking hikes, walking, going canoeing etc.

Here's a list of things that would indicate you're perhaps not an ideal fit with this group:

*You (or your children!!) smoke.


*You have no problem with using bad language in public places.


*You typically consume more than 3 alcoholic drinks in quick succession one after the other on any given occasion.


*You tend to be loud and obnoxious (people typically shush you in movies and you like cutting other people off in traffic).


*Slovenly (you think personal hygiene is overrated and you don't care too much about leaving used cups where they fall).


*Unable to discipline children (your children do whatever they want and you are fine with that).
results.name: Weekends in the Woods for Solo Parents and Kids of All Ages

results.description:
CORO-DANTE: The Dante Alighieri Society of Cambridge is seeking interested members of the community to sing in a four-part chorus called Coro-Dante. The purpose of the chorus is to promote Italian language and culture through singing Italian music.

CHORUS SIZE & REPERTOIRE: The chorus is comprised of about 60 singers SATB (soprano, alto, tenor bass), and performs a wide variety of musical styles – old and new, but always in Italian.

REHEARSALS / LEADERSHIP: Knowledge of Italian and extensive musical experience are not required. Ability to sing in tune is highly desired. There will be a very brief voice check. Ability to read music is preferable. A weekly commitment of an hour and half on Mondays for rehearsing gives you a chance to meet with friends, make new ones and perhaps expand your musical and linguistic skills! Rehearsals October-December and February-May are held at the Dante Alighieri Society (Monday Eves, 7-8:30pm) located at 41 Hampshire Street (Kendall Square Area) in Cambridge. International Choral/Orchestral conductor Kevin Galiè, J.D., M.M., a Dante board member, has graciously donated his musical expertise as musical director. There is a membership fee of $30/year to join – your enthusiasm and love of music are also required.

INTERESTED? For more information: http://launch.groups.yahoo.com/group/CORO-DANTE Or email the admistrator, Kellie Gutman: kellieogutman@gmail.com

CORO DANTE: La Società Dante Alighieri di Cambridge cerca nuovi membri per il Coro-Dante. Il Coro ha scopo di promuovere la conoscenza della lingua e della cultura Italiane attraverso canzoni e musica italiana di tutti i tempi.

IL REPERTORIO e IL CORO: Il coro ha al momento sessanta membri iscritti (soprano, contralto, tenore, basso), ed esegue in italiano una vasta selezione di stili musicali – dai mottetti barocchi alla musica moderna.

LE PROVE: Non è necessaria né la conoscenza della lingua italiana né l`esperienza musicale, ma è auspicabile essere intonati. Ci sarà un breve controllo della voce. È richiesto un impegno settimanale alle prove nei periodi Ottobre - Dicembre e Febbraio – Maggio. Le prove si svolgeranno il lunedì (eccetti i giorni festivi). per una durata di novanta minuti. Gli incontri sono concepiti sia per accrescere l’abilità canora, ma anche come opportunità per creare amicizie e migliorare la conoscenza della lingua italiana.È previsto un costo d'iscrizione di $30/anno.

INTERESSATO/A? Per ulteriori informazioni consulta: http://launch.groups.yahoo.com/group/CORO-DANTE oppure manda un email all’amministratrice, Kellie Gutman: kellieogutman@gmail.com

results.description:
Making friends can be difficult, especially for women and seems to become more difficult with age... Have you ever watched how easy it for a child to walk up to another group of children they've never met before
and just start playing? If only it were still that easy!


Welcome to the girlfriends group, a group for women to meet likeminded ladies who are looking for fun things to do as well as long-lasting and meaningful friendships. So if you are married,
single, divorced, widowed, newly out of college, a mom or at any other stage of life
you should join. Our group is full of women in different stages of their lives
looking to connect with some new people!


Our events include Trivia nights, Wine tastings, and fitness classes of all types, dinners, drinks, cookie swaps, craft nights, outdoor events and so much more. If you join please feel free to
suggest a meetup that you might find interesting, chances are someone else
wants to try it as well!


There is a 5.00 membership fee to cover the cost of meetup for the organizer; you are welcome to join for a trial period of 90 days to see if you like it!


Some rules:

No shows - No shows are removed from the group after not showing up to a meetup twice. The reason for this is that meetups have been held up waiting for people who have never reached out and said that they didn't plan on coming. Events are held at people's homes where they give out home addresses and that information should only be given to people who are serious about attending. Reservations are often made and sometimes we can't be seated until the full party arrives and other times other
ladies miss out who really wanted to attend an event.


What is a No Show - someone who does not change their RSVP and who does not make contact with the organizer to let them know they are not coming.

Be respectful and have an open mind - everyone has joined this group for the same reason, it takes meeting people a few times to get a good sense of who they are so please give everyone a chance, you'll find it's worth it!

Facebook Group - There is a private
facebook group for this meetup - if you are interested please contact the
organizer.

results.description:
Quantified Self Women's meetup - Boston chapter.

Inspired by the QSXX SF meetup group. (http://www.meetup.com/QSXX-Quantified-Self-Womens-Meetup/)

Do you track your weight or your period in a journal or calendar? Do you use a Nike Plus or a Fitbit? Do you use a financial management tool like Mint.com? Then you might be a quantified self.

We're all generating lots of data, whether actively recording it or using transactions, apps, and sensors to generate the data. What do we do with that data? What can it tell us about ourselves?

People in the Quantified Self community have been self-tracking and analyzing their data in novel ways. We are doing experiments, running correlations, fostering new habits. More tools are entering the consumer market to make it easier for us to track ourselves without much effort and we're starting to find tools that help us make sense of our disparate data sets. It's not just geeks or science bros running statistical correlations in R. Creating data can be just as useful as a tool for building awareness about a goal you have.

Women's voices in the QS community are underrepresented, even though we've all been tracking things forever. We're hoping to change that. What does your data tell you about yourself? What can women learn when they take advantage of the existing data, and use more tools to generate novel data about our bodies, minds, and our environment? 

We want to create a space for all the interesting, women specific QS conversations we want to have. For women and people who identify or have identified significantly as non-male. Let's get together to talk about what we're tracking, what we're learning, and how we want to share it.

The Quantified Self movement involves exploring the self through numbers. Some potential topics of interest might include:

- Behavior monitoring
- LIfelogging
- Fitness and health tracking
- Chemical body load counts
- Personal genome sequencing
- Metabolic monitoring
- Self experimentation
- Location tracking
- Sleep tracking
- Mood and emotion tracking
- Medical self-diagnostics
- Digital body info
- Psychological self-assessments
results.name: QSXX - Quantified Self Women's Meetup Boston

results.description:
Meet other developers and ops engineers using Docker. Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications. Consisting of Docker Engine, a portable, lightweight runtime and packaging tool, and Docker Hub, a cloud service for sharing applications and automating workflows, Docker enables apps to be quickly assembled from components and eliminates the friction between development, QA, and production environments. As a result, IT can ship faster and run the same app, unchanged, on laptops, data center VMs, and any cloud.

Learn more about Docker at http://www.docker.com

results.description:
API- Craft Conference from Joe Monzo on Vimeo.

Join us next year !

API-CRAFT CONFERENCE

Where do we lead the APIs of tomorrow?

Mon July 28 - Wed July 30, 2014   
Port Detroit - 130 E. Atwater Street
Detroit, MI, USA

 

About the Boston Members

API Craft Boston is a vibrant community of individual API practitioners who see building APIs as a craft. Our goal is to drive leadership and open discussion in the API development space as we move toward a more connected world. Also, check out API Craft on Google Groups to collaborate with other API craftspeople around the world.

Our standards are simple - we are a community of individual API practitioners who see building APIs as a craft.


 We represent our own opinions, and not that of employers or anyone else.


 This meetup is open to thoughtful posts from prospective employers who want great API thinkers and doers.


 This meetup is not open to posts from vendors who are promoting their products or spamming recruiters.

Come collaborate in an open space to get tips, ask questions you may have about APIs, and then feel free to hop into the conversations.
results.name: API Craft Boston

results.description: This is a meditation and mindfulness group for people looking to practice and learn with others. It's about living in the present moment and letting go of stress based or unskillful habits. Meetups in this group include Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) events, weekly meditation groups, loving-kindness or metta practice, tonglen or compassion practice, open awareness meditation, insight or vipassana meditation, body scan guided meditation, interpersonal communication, skillful living and more. We're all about creating community or sangha and learning together. Some of the teachers we draw from include Pema Chodron, Joseph Goldstein, Jack Kornfield, HH the Dalai Lama, Eckhart Tolle, Byron Katie, Sharon Salzberg, Gangaji, Adyshanti, Jon Kabat Zinn, Thich Nhat Hanh, Ramana Maharshi and more.

results.description:
This group started out centered around World's End in Hingham. It's since been expanded to the general Boston Harbor area, including Boston, Cambridge, the harbor islands, Quincy, Hingham and Hull.

There are alot of kayaking groups in New England, but not many that focus on the Boston region in particular. For me, I like to spend a lot of time in the waters of these areas, since they are local to me. As it just so happens, this region as a whole makes up one of the best paddling destinations one could ever hope to find.

The variety found around here is extraordinary. Obviously there are lots of urban settings. Add to that Boston Harbor, Quincy Bay, Hingham Bay and World's End ... not to mention the many picturesque islands and lighthouses ... and you truly have a world-class area in which to paddle.

So I'd like to see this group consist of a plethora of Boston-area excursions. Frankly, I'm gunna be in the water around there half the time anyway, so might as well do it with friends, old and new!

Also, I've found alot of groups that seem to have far too few events at will encompass beginners. Sure, people who are farther along in things want to have a challenge, but I don't like to see people left out. We all were beginners once, and I like to remember that.

So if you're an experienced kayaker who hopes to share some paddling time with others, or if you're someone just looking at getting started, I want this group to be something fun for you. If it's not ... send me an email, yell at me about it, and I'll see to it straight away.

http://www.meetup.com/KayakBoston/suggestion/

Cheers, and happy paddling!
~Nate
results.name: kayak | boston

results.description:
UB2 is a group for gay men infected with HIV.  Stigma associated with HIV & AIDS has contributed to social isolation for so many of us.  It is my hope that this group will connect individuals who have been impacted by the virus for the purpose of decreasing loneliness and shame, while promoting opportunities to socialize, network, and have fun.

This group is not intended to be a support group in the traditional sense, although its very nature will no doubt lend itself to members being supportive of one another.  My hope is that this group will highlight the many positive in our lives, while also acknowledging the difficulties -- all in a manner that lends itself to having fun.   With UB2, I hope to foster a sense of community among members, reminding them that, if nothing else, they are not alone in this journey.

I've decided to make this a closed Meetup group for privacy purposes, as I imagine we are all at varying points on the spectrum of disclosure.

We're living and loving, striving and thriving with HIV . . . . UB2.


Come visit us on Facebook, where our Page is still under construction.
results.name: UB2

results.description:
*Please note that I have tried to make it possible for any member to create an event. I can't keep up with all the films showing everywhere, so please feel free to schedule a showing or activity, even same-day, if you think it's something we'd all enjoy. Now back to your regularly scheduled programming....*


Do you see a lot of movies at Kendall Square Cinema, the Brattle Theater, Coolidge Corner, West Newton? Are you unfazed by subtitles? When you tell people your favorite director, do they have to Google the name to find out who you're talking about? Do you find poetry in black-and-white studio-era pictures, off-the-radar art-house films, and challenging foreign fare? Do you look forward to meeting other film fans, and even getting to talk about the movies, as much as actually seeing them?

Then this MeetUp is for you!

Each meeting will be to see a film, sometimes (at the members' discretion) to be followed by a meal or a drink, over which we can discuss the film--and whatever else comes to mind. :) Note that ANY group member can convene a showing. And films need not be restricted to the Brattle, the Kendall, or even a Cambridge cinema at all!

Conveners are responsible for:

1. Choosing a film and showtime.

2. If there is going to be food and/or drink that day, the convener should also suggest a reasonably priced venue near the cinema.

To help make each Meetup of this group be a success, members are responsible for:

1. Keeping their RSVP status current.

2. Deciding on a place to meet at the theater before the movie.

3. Bringing cash to any eatery.  It makes paying the bill in a group SO much easier!

Thank you and enjoy the show!

-The Management ;)

Mostly the book club part of this group is to get ideas for good reads from people, read something 'together' and use the book as a launchpad for conversation. I do not envision it being rigid or handing out bulleted discussion point lists. I'd love to go see movie versions of books we read and complain how bad they were. And just to meet nice, like minded people. About me: I'm 39 and have always been a voracious reader (some times in my life more than others, there were years when the books I read to my kids were the only ones I read). Here are some books I've enjoyed lately: Fiction: Toni Morrison - The Bluest Eye and the Song of Solomon, Barbara Kingsolver: The Prodigal Summer, The Bean Trees, Stephen King: 11/22/63, Alice Sebold: The Almost Moon, Kathleen Kent: The Wolves of Andover, Annie Proulx: Fine just the way it is, Mitch Albom: The 5 People you meet in Heaven......        Memoirs: Cheryl Strayed: Wild, Alice Sebold: Lucky, Mitch Albom: For one more day, J Maarten Trost: Getting Stoned with Savages,      Non-Fiction: Bill Bryson: A Short History of Nearly Everything, A Walk in the Woods, Nathaniel Philbrick: Heart of the of Sea, The Tragedy of the Whaleship Essex, Marlene Zuk: Sex on six legs, Stephen Puleo: Dark Tide. I'm open to reading just about anything, maybe with the exception of romance and vampire novels.

results.description:
Welcome to Boston’s Countryside Cruisers!

BCC is a motorcycle meet-up group for riders of 2 or 3-wheeled motorized vehicles. It doesn't matter what you ride, only that you ride. Our group is about enjoying the backcountry roads of New England at a leisurely pace, in groups of 10 or fewer motorbikes and in a relaxed social atmosphere. Our rides often stop for a meal, ice cream stand, etc. along the way. Typically, our rides start/end at various places between the 128 and 495 belts.

We typically avoid highways, but on the rare occasion that we touch an interstate we will make our plans clear and keep the interstate travel quick and painless. Our ride leaders set a pace that is within 5-10 MPH of the posted speed limit. If you have the need for speed, this may not be the group for you.

We’re also about safety. We believe in "Safe Riding Skills" which includes following the MSF Group Riding protocol. The protocol is available by clicking "More", then "Files" from our home page. Boston’s Countryside Cruisers’ riders must have a minimum of 1- year or 1000 miles of riding experience and adhere to the MSF Group Riding protocols [or click here for PDF copy of MSF's Guide to Group Riding]. You must be comfortable, and have the riding skills necessary to safely ride in a staggered motorcycle formation. This means that you must be able to safely maintain a 2-second gap between you and the bike in front of you, without drifting from side to side in your lane. You must also be able to understand, act on, and pass along group hand signals. Our ride leaders provide a safety briefing before each ride which reviews these hand signals [click here and see Page 3 of MSF's Guide to Group Riding].

It is free to join, and there are annual dues of $5.00 after a 30 day try out period. You will be asked to sign an annual liability waiver; a copy of which is available for review on our Group's webpage.

We will often stop at locally owned counter service establishments that are inexpensive and casual.

Whenever a ride is posted there will be a tentative map, a list of planned stops and we will try to end up near or at where we started.

Riders are always welcome to leave early, but please communicate this with both the Ride Leader & the Sweep so that no one is waiting and wondering.

The cruisers are based around Boston. Rides will start somewhere outside the city and head out for some great country roads.

We will ride on many weekends in the spring summer and fall and will try to host a series of Thursday night rides and Wednesday night bike nights to break up the week as well.

All Boston's Countryside Cruisers rides will:

• Be open to all 2 or 3 wheeled motorized conveyances.

• Be thoughtfully planned.

• BE DRUG/ALCOHOL FREE

• Have 10 or fewer vehicles.

• Stay within 10 mph of the speed limit nearly all of the time.

• Choose back roads over highways.

• Be a relaxed and fun way to meet other riders.

• Come out and ride with us!
results.name: Boston's Countryside Cruisers

Health Benefits of Dancing: (Boost Memory, Improve Flexibility, Reduce Stress, Diminish Depression, Help Your Heart, Lose Weight, Balance Better, Increase Energy, Make Friends) Ballroom Dancing is a great way for people of all ages to get in shape and stay fit. Dancing has many positive health benefits and is a wonderful activity that will benefit your mind, body, and spirit. Dancing will improve your health and fitness, mental acuity, and social connections. Dancing is a great social activity and studies have shown that socializing and dancing with friends can contribute to high self-esteem, increased self-confidence and a more positive outlook. Dancing reduces stress and tension, so over time one can feel an overall sense of well-being.

results.description:
Asian American women are a special group with unique experiences and specific needs that are not catered to in mainstream practices. This group is made especially for Asian American women who want to find their personal strength and inner power to achieve more fulfilling relationships, successful careers and balance in their lives.

This group was created by a transformational life coach who was tired of only seeing career development workshops for Asian American women---What about the rest of us? "What are my needs and personal goals, beyond making money?"

Our emotional development: "Why do I have issues that keep repeating?"

Self growth: "Am I living the life that makes me happy?" Mental health: "How do I handle all this stress from my family?"

Relationship matters: "Why is it so difficult for me to open up/effective communicate with another person?"

Spiritual practices: "I don't necessarily go to church, but I have lots of strong emotions and a belief in something greater, how can I develop my intuition and understand my Higher Self?"

If you are looking for a circle of Asian American sisters whose focus is creating a strong inner space to manifest abundance and miracles--you've found us :) Please join this Meetup--we're gonna have lots of fun and cool events!

results.description:
Since winning the 2012 TechCrunch Disrupt SAP Big Data Startup of the Year, for using chaos theory principles with twitter, I have been asked by friends and colleagues to start a meet-up about Big Data 2.0.  So here we start!

As an ex-IBMer and veteran in social media, collaboration computing and knowledge management, I thought that it would be fun to look at the exploitation of this chaotic wealth of information in a more holistic approach that supports new practical uses.

This is a group for people and technologists who want to explore how to make sense of the information overload that comes with Big Data 2.0 (the Big Data of open social expressions, news, blogs and microblogs). During these gatherings, we will explore innovative technologies and best practices to make sense of what is trending and how to turn this mess into something useful. We try to meet once a week.

If you are in the discovery, SEO, advanced analytics, predictive computing or know someone who wants to share how you manage information overload, then you are right for this group.  We are also open for candidates to present and lead a sessions.

**WE ARE ON BREAK FOR THE SUMMER -- IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN JOINING, PLEASE EMAIL ME OR REQUEST TO JOIN AND I'LL GET BACK TO YOU ASAP WITH INFO ABOUT THE NEXT SESSION, WHICH WILL BEGIN IN SEPTEMBER. THANKS!**

We are a small group geared toward the experienced writer. If you have an MFA and/or have been published and/or have taken numerous workshops at the Advanced or Master level and are devoted and committed to a regular writing practice, producing work at a steady pace, this workshop could be you. 

We focus on the craft of fiction, where language, sentences and character drive stories -- more so than plot. Our members are working on novels, memoirs, essays and short stories.  

There are two groups: a workshop and and a studio. 

• In the workshop, which meets on Thursdays, writers hand out manuscripts to a group of readers, who provide feedback about what's working and where they might have questions. The writer remains in a "cone of silence" during this phase and then at the end is released to ask questions. We discuss two manuscripts per session, giving each piece ample time for feedback. 

• In the studio, which meets on Tuesdays, all members come to the meeting with 2 to 4 pages of their best work. They read to the group, who listens intently and takes notes. After which, the group provides feedback about what is working, what is dynamic, what is emotionally resonating, and what is not. 

Both sessions have room for no more than 8 people who commit to participating for a set number of weeks (typically 10 to 12). We meet once per week. 

If you're interested, please write back and tell us a little bit about yourself, your writing and your writing goals.

We look forward to hearing from you.
results.name: Fresh Pond Writers Workshop

results.description:
The focus of this meetup group is to present informative lectures, hands-on tutorials, and networking events to help grow the use of open source languages and tools within the data science and data-centric community. As such our specific goals are:

1. Host data science talks specific to our goals
2. Promote the use of open source languages and tools amongst data scientists and    others.
3. Host educational workshops
4. Spread awareness of new open source languages and tools that can be used in data   science
5. Contribute back to the open source community

Who is this meetup for?
• Data engineers, analysts, scientists, and other practitioners
• R, Python and other software engineers who work with data
• Data visualization developers and designers
• Non-technical team leaders, executives and other decision makes from data centric startup and companies looking to utilize open source

How can you get involved?

• Attending events, network and precipitate!
• Give a talk or workshop that meets our goals
• Volunteer to help the group (social media, website, blogging)
• Provide us with a venue
• Sponsor food and beer.
results.name: BOSTON #ODSC

topics.name: Tabletop Role Playing and Board Games

results.description:
Formerly known as Metrowest Board Gaming.  We are a group of gamers in lower New England that meet up to play strategy board games, deck-building games, LCG's, and the like.  We originally started in Metrowest, but have begun expanding beyond those boundaries to serve gamers across Massachusetts, New Hampshire, and Connecticut.

Currently, we have three weekly meetups (every Sunday, Wednesday and Thursday), four fortnightly meetups during the week (every other Monday and multiple events for Tuesdays), four monthly meetups on the first Thursday, the third Thursday, and the fourth Monday of the month plus one Friday night based on venue availability. On top of all that, we host one all-day event on a Saturday every quarter to play longer games that we are not quite able to get in at one of the weeknight meetups.  There are also other occassional one-off meetups in addition to those and several several fill-and-fire events you can view by expanding the "More Meetups" at the bottom of the Upcoming Meetup list or at the Fill and Fire page (http://www.meetup.com/TabletopGamersAlliance/pages/Fill_and_Fire_Games/).

This meetup group was established on September 10th 2013 and currently costs $144 per year to run (Meetup.com Subscription Pricing).  das_ninja (the group organizer) would be extremely grateful if members each donated $1 per year towards that annual cost.  You may give your donation in cash directly to das_ninja or to any Event Organizer in the group.

You can also "Chip in" with bank or credit card using the button on the left-middle of the page beside the piggy bank.  Meetup takes $0.50 + 7.5% of each "Chip in" transaction, so please donate at least $1.50 when using "Chip in".  Meetup does not allow us to customize the values for the buttons on the "Chip in" page, so please let your sticker-shock quickly subside.

All donations will go towards the cost of the subscription.  Any donations in excess of the cost of the subscription will be applied towards the cost of a running one of the quarterly meetups or a one-off meetup.  Members who donate will be forever recognized on the Wall of Gratitude
results.name: Tabletop Gamers Alliance
